en: Police arrest 16 suspects over cultism, recover firearms in Enugu
pcm: Police don arrest 16 pipo as suspect for cultism matter for Enugu, dem recover firearms

en: The Police Command in Enugu State has arrested 16 suspects within two weeks, one female inclusive, for cultism and unlawful possession of firearms.
pcm: DI police command for Enugu state don arrest 16 suspect dem withing two weeks, one female sef dey there, for cultism and say dem get firearms wey dem no suppose get.

en: The command also recovered two cut-to-size locally-made guns, one locally-made pistol, two live cartridges, six mobile phones, a powdery substance suspected to be heroin and weeds suspected to be Indian Hemp.
pcm: Di command be also recovertwo cut-to-size locally-made guns,one locally-made pistol, two live cartridges, six mobile phones, on powder subsatnce wey dem suspect say na heroin and weed wey dem suspect say na Indian Hemp.

en: The Command's Public Relations Officer, ASP Daniel Ndukwe, said this in a statement made available to the News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) on Sunday in Enugu.
pcm: Di Public Relations Officer for di Command, ASP Daniel Ndukwe, tok am inside one statement wey dem carry give di News Agency of Nigeria (NAN)  inside Enugu on sunday.

en: Ndukwe said that the feat was achieved by joint operations carried out by police operatives attached to 9th Mile Police Division, Anti-Cult Unit and personnel of the Nigerian Army, 82 Division in Enugu.
pcm: Ndukwe tok say na joint operation wey police of di 9th Mile Police Division dem carry out make dem achieve di feat, Anti-Cult Unit and personnel of di Nigerian Army, 82 Division for Enugu.

en: He said that the joint operation took place between April 19 and May 4, within a span of three council areas in the state.
pcm: He tok say di joint operation be take place between April 19 and may 4, and e stretch hand reach council area for inside di state.

en: They included: Cornelius Uche, 31; Ifeanyi Umeneze, 22; Chijioke Anachuna, 34; Chibuzor Umeayo, 28; Chinedu Okeke, 23; Ozinachi Obadike, 22; Ifeanyi Nwagbo, 27; Chigozie Okeke, 18, and Chikamso Odinwankpa, 18; were all arrested.
pcm: dem included: Cornelius Uche, 31; Ifeanyi Umeneze, 22; Chijioke Anachuna, 34; Chibuzor Umeayo, 28; Chinedu Okeke, 23; Ozinachi Obadike, 22; Ifeanyi Nwagbo, 27; Chigozie Okeke, 18, and Chikamso Odinwankpa, 18; dem arrest all of dem.

en: They were arrested on May 4 within Ezeagu Local Government Area following their alleged involvement in bloody cult clashes.
pcm: Dem arrest dem for May 4 withing Ezeagu Local Goment Area afta dem do plenty bloody cult clash dem.

en: Others included: Ozor Chidubem, 22; Amina Inalegwu (female), 18; Benard Bright, 20; Ugwu Chidera, 21; Ani Chukwuebuka, 23; and Onoh Obumneme, 20; who were all arrested on April 19 at about 3:30 a.m.
pcm: Oda dem included: Ozor Chidubem, 22; Amina Inalegwu (female), 18; Benard Bright, 20; Ugwu Chidera, 21; Ani Chukwuebuka, 23; and Onoh Obumneme, 20; wey dem arrest on April 19 at about 3:30 a.m.

en: They were arrested along Enugu-Makurdi Expressway, 9th Mile, Udi L.G.A. on their way to plan and perfect a heinous cult activity, as preliminary investigation reveals.
pcm: Dem arrest dem along Enugu-Makurdi Expressway, 9th Mile, Udi L.G.A. as dem wan go plan one bad cult activity, according to wetin preliminary investigate don show.

en: Another of the suspect, one Uchenna Aniagozie, 28, was arrested on April 28 for his alleged involvement in a deadly cult clash sometime in January 2021.
pcm: Anoda of di suspect, one Uchenna Aniagozie, 28, wey dem arrest on April 28  say im involve for one deadly cult clash sometime wey don pass for January.

en: Preliminary investigation shows that they all confessed to being members of Vikings Confraternity, he said.
pcm: He tok say preliminary investigation don show say all of dem confess say dem be member for inside Vikings Confraternity.

en: The police spokesman said that the suspects would be prosecuted accordingly once ongoing investigations into their nefarious activities were concluded.
pcm: Di toktok pesin for police tok say dem go prosecute di suspect dem as dem suppose do am once di investigation wey dem dey do don conclude.

en: To this end, residents of the state have been called upon to remain law-abiding, vigilant and quickly report suspected criminals and their activities to the nearest police station.
pcm: To dis end, dem don call upon residents for di state to dey follow wetin law tok, make dem dey vigilant and make dem report suspect quick quick for police station wey near pass.

en: Residents can call the Command's emergency hotlines on 08032003702, 08075390883, 08086671202 or 08098880172, he added.
pcm: He add say residents dem fit call di Command emergency hotlines on top 08032003702, 08075390883, 08086671202 or 08098880172.

en: How cassava is becoming gold in Benue
pcm: How cassava don dey  is become gold inside Benue

en: In Benue State, farmers are expanding their fields almost every season to increase production as cassava farming becomes a thriving business in all the three senatorial districts.
pcm: For inside Benue State, farmers don dey expand dem fields almos evri season to take increase production as cassava farin don bikom better business for inside di three senatorial district dem.

en: Although the state is largely known as the highest producer and consumer of yam in the country, cassava consumption now gradually reigns.
pcm: Although na di state dem know as state wey dey produce and chop yam pass for inside di kontri, cassava don dey reign gradually.

en: As such, more farmers are said to be cultivating cassava.
pcm: As such, dem tok say more farmers dem don dey plant cassava.

en: A cassava farmer in the Gboko area of the state, Titus Atondo, said he started cultivating the crop for many years now.
pcm: One cassava farmer for di Gboko area of di stste, Titus Atondo, tok say he begin to plant di crop for many years now.

en: Atondo said cassava farming posed little or no challenge because farmers only need to spray the farm once to repel weed, then wait for harvest.
pcm: Atondo tok say cassava farming no dey too get plenty challenge bikos farmers only need to spray di farm once to repel weed, den dem go wait for harvest.

en: Cassava chips are very expensive now.
pcm: Cassava chips don dey very expensive now.

en: I have a large cassava farm where I make money and my family consumes some of the produce, he said.
pcm: I get large cassava farm wia I dey make money and my family sef dey chop some of di produce, as e take tok am.

en: Faith Ben is now preparing a large expanse of land in the Ugboju area of Otukpo Local Government Area to cultivate cassava as soon as the rain begins, following the high demand of the by-product in her vicinity.
pcm: Faith Ben don dey prepare large land for inside di Ugboju area of Otukpo Local Goment Area to take cultivate cassava as soon as rain start to fall, dis one na as dem dey demand for di product welwel for her vicinity.

en: The demand for cassava is usually high these days.
pcm: Di demand for cassava dey high welwel nowadays.

en: From the tubers to the processed produce, it has become a money-spinning crop.
pcm: From di tubers go enter di di one wey dem don process, e don bikom crop wey dey bring money.

en: That's why I am going into the farming.
pcm: Na y I dey enter di farming be dat.

en: And I am doing so purely for business, she added.
pcm: She add say na for business alone she dey do am.

en: On his part, the state chairman of the All Farmers Association of Nigeria (AFAN), Aondongu Saaku, admitted that cassava consumption in the state had become more than yam in recent times.
pcm: For im own part, di stste chairman of di All Farmers Association of Nigeria (AFAN), Aondongu Saaku, admit say dem don dey chop cassava for di state pass yam sef.

en: Saaku said this is because cassava is eaten in varieties, unlike yam.
pcm: Saaku tok dis one bikos dem dey chop cassava for many variety, unlike yam.

en: Meanwhile, the Director of Agric Science in the Ministry of Agriculture and Natural Resources, Thomas Unongo, explained that cassava farming has been thriving in the state in recent times because no aspect of the crop is wasted.
pcm: Meanwhile, di Director  of Agric Science for di Ministry of Agriculture and Natural Resources, Thomas Unongo, explain say cassava farming don dey do well for di state in recent times bikos no aspekt for di crop dey wasted.

en: Unongo, whose farm occupies three and a half hectares in Apir, Makurdi, said that for the past two years, he had been cultivating the land with new varieties of cassava released by the International Institute of Tropical Agriculture (IITA).
pcm: Unongo wey get farm wey be three and  half hectres for Apir, Makurdi tok say for di past two years, im don dey cultivate di land with new varieties of cassava wey di International Institute of Tropical Agriculture (IITA) dem release.

en: Apart from weed control, it is one of the cheapest crops to grow.
pcm: Apart from say dem dey kontrol weed, na one of di crops wey cheap pass to grow.

en: Rice production costs between N200,000 and N300,000 per hectare, while yam costs between N150,000 and N200,000 per hectare, but inputs for cassava production for farmers with stems cost only about N150,000.
pcm: To produce rice dey cost between N200,000 and N300,000 for one hectare, as yam dey cost between N150,000 and N200,00 per hectare, but input for cassava production with stems for farmer dey only cost N150,000.

en: And where there is light vegetation, it could be as low as N100,000.
pcm: And wia dem get light vegetation, e fit low reach N100,000.

en: It is really cheap and the output/return on investment is one of the highest in Benue now, he said.
pcm: He tok say e dey chaep and di output/return on top investment na one of di highest for Benue now.

en: Unongo further noted that the challenges of farming cassava in the state hinged on insecurity as herders attacks worsened.
pcm: Unongo further note say  di challenge of farming cassava for di state dey on top  insecurity as herders attack dey worse.

en: He alleged that herders usually removed the stems and tubers for their cattle.
pcm: He allege say herders dem dey komot di stem and tuber for dem cattle.

en: He, however, advised that to get a better yield, one would have to apply weed control three months after planting, stressing that when weeds are allowed to grow in the farm, they invite pests, such as grasshoppers.
pcm: However, he advise say to get better yield, pesin go need to apply weed kontrol three months afta dem palnt am, e stress say wen dem allow weed to grow for insie di farm, dem dey invite pest like grasshoppers dem.

en: He said inputs like fertiliser, herbicides, among others, are necessary, adding that there's the need to observe farm sanitation, which would help against attacks by rodents.
pcm: He tok say inputs like fertlizer, herbicides dem, among oda things dey necessary, he add say need dey to dey do farm sanitation, wey go help against attack of rodents dem.

en: Unongo maintained that while the conventional old varieties of cassava would last up to two years before harvest, with one-year maturity, the new improved varieties have a maturity period of five and seven months; but the eight months are superb for harvest.
pcm: Unongo maintain say as d old variety of cassava go last reach two years before harvest, with one year maturity, di new improved varieties get maturity period of five and seven months, but na eight month better pass for harvest.

en: Cassava farming is turning to gold in Benue because the state is nearer to the North, where the crop is not produced.
pcm: Cassava farming don dey turn to gold for inside Benue bikos di state dey near to north, wia dem no dey produce di crop.

en: Also, the produce, especially garri, is becoming costlier because vendors are everywhere in villages mopping up the chips desired more for the Northern market, he noted.
pcm: Also, the produce, especially garri, don dey cost more bikos  vendors dem don dey  evriwia for villages dem mopping up di chips wey dem desire to sell go Northern market, as he take note am.

en: Start agric revolution now, Bode George, Gen Olanrewaju tell Sanwo-Olu
pcm: Begin agric revolution now, na wetin Bode George and Gen Olanrewaju tell Sanwo-Olu

en: Prominent Lagos indigenes under the aegis of Eko Pataki have asked Governor Babajide Sanwo-Olu to immediately begin a move towards revolutionising agriculture in the state.
pcm: Prominent indigene for Lagos under di name of Eko Pataki don ask Governor Babajide Sanwo-Olu to begin to revolution for agriculture inside di state.

en: The indigenes made the call against the backdrop of the recent decision to block food supply to the South by the Amalgamated Union of Food Stuff and Cattle Dealers in Nigeria (AUFCDN).
pcm: Di indigene dem make dis call against as di recent decision to take block supply of food to di south by di Amalgamated Union of Food Stuff and Cattle Dealers in Nigeria (AUFCDN).

en: Reacting to the development yesterday, the group said there was the need for the government to redirect its policies towards broadening agricultural investment in order to enhance food sufficiency in the state.
pcm: As dem dey raect on top di development yesterday, di group tok say need dey for goment to redirect dem policy towards to broad agriculture investment in order to help food surficiency for di state.

en: This was contained in a joint statement by the leader of the group, Chief Bode George, and its trustees, Gen Tajudeen Olanrewaju and Mr Gbadebo Dallas.
pcm: Dis one dey inside joint statement by di leader of di group Chief Bode George, and its trustees, Gen Tajudeen Olanrewaju and Mr Gbadebo Dallas.

en: The group charged the governor to engage the huge unemployed youths in the state to drive the agricultural revolution.
pcm: Di group cahrge di governor to engage di plenty youth wey no get employment for di state to take drive di agricultural revolution.

en: The statement reads in part: The recent action of the Amalgamated Union of Food Stuff and Cattle Dealers in Nigeria which halted the convoy of trailers from bringing tomatoes, pepper, onions and all kinds of foodstuff to the South should awaken the leadership of Lagos State to redirect its policies in widening its agricultural investments.
pcm: Part of di statement read say: di recent action of di Amalgamated Union of Food Stuff and Cattle Dealers in Nigeria wey no allow trailers dem to bring tomatoes, pepper, onions and all kind o foodstuff enter south suppose wake di leadership of lagos State to redirect dem policies to take widen dem investment for inside agriculture.

en: Lagos State which is naturally our foremost concern as Eko Pataki should henceforth impress into immediate duty a massive workforce of her unemployed youths across the IBILE traditional enclave, whipping our vast and enriched lands into a huge agricultural holding.
pcm: Lagos State wey be awa foremost concern as Eko Pataki make dem begin impress into immediate duty for huge workforce of di youth wey no get employement for inside di IBILE traditional enclave, as dem dey turn awa vast and enriched land into agricultural holding.

en: From Ifako-Ijaiye to Imota, from Epe to the rolling fields to the mangroves of Badagry, Lagos State is blessed with nutrient-rich agricultural fields that can quickly be marshaled into farmlands where various kinds of crops from tomatoes, lettuce, pepper, beans, rice, corn, yam, potatoes, cassava to many others can be planted to enhance our self-sufficiency in food production.
pcm: From Ifako-Ijaiye to Imota, from Epe to di rolling fields to di mangroves of Badagry, Lagos State dey blessed wit agricultural fields wey get nutrient wey fit quickly turn to farmland wia different kind of crop like  tomatoes, lettuce, pepper, beans, rice, corn, yam, potatoes, cassava go reach many odas wey dem fit plant to take enhance awa sef-sufficiency for food production.

en: It is our candid advice to Governor Sanwo-Olu to quickly reorder the state's priorities in ensuring that our state becomes the new food basket of the country thereby triggering a new agricultural revolution in the state of excellence.
pcm: Na awa candid advise to Governor Sanwo-Olu to quickly re-order di state priority to take make sure say awa state bikom di new food basket for di kontri to thereby trigger new agricultural revolution for inside di state of excellence.

en: China to raise proportion of middle-income earners
pcm: China wan raise di proportion of middle-income earners

en: China's consumption has been on a continuous rise in recent years, and its consumption structure is also being optimized.
pcm: Di consumption of China don dey continue to rise for recent years, and dem dey optimise im conumption structure.

en: Last year, the country's total retail sales of consumer goods reached 39.2 trillion yuan ($6 trillion), and final consumption contributed 54.3 per cent to China's GDP.
pcm: Last year, di total retail sales of consumer goods for inside di kontri  reach 39.2 trillion yuan ($6 trillion), and final consumption be contribute 54.3 per cent to di GDP of China.

en: As a result, China maintained its position as the second-largest consumption market in the world.
pcm: DI result na say China still be di second-largest consumption market for di world.

en: New business forms such as online shopping and influencer marketing experienced rapid development.
pcm: New business like online shopping and influencer marketing don experience rapid development.

en: In 2020, a total of over 24 million Livestream shows were aired on e-commerce platforms; online sales of national entity bucked the trend and grew 14.8 per cent; the express delivery industry handled 31.2 per cent more parcels than it did a year ago.
pcm: For 2020, dem show over 24 million levestream on top e-commerce platforms, online sales of national entity becked di trend and grow reach 14.8 per cent. di express delivery industry handle 31.2 per cent more parcels dan last year.

en: China has become the world's largest market of online retailing for eight consecutive years.
pcm: China don turn largest market for online retailing for eight years straight.

en: The robust recovery of China's consumption, despite the severe impacts from COVID-19, showcased the strong resilience and huge development potential of the Chinese market.
pcm: Di robust recovery of China's consumption, despite di severe impact of COVID-19 don show di strong resilience and huge development potential of di Chinese market.

en: As a major force of consumption, the middle-income group is a pillar of the economy.
pcm: As major force for consumption, na pillar di middle-income group be for di economy.

en: At present, China has 400 million middle-income earners that account for around 30 per cent of its population.
pcm: For present, China get 400 million middle-income earner dem wey dey account for around 30 per cent of dem population.

en: In developed countries, the distribution of household income is always in an olive shape that is sharp at both ends and plump in the middle.
pcm: For kontri dem wey don develop, di distribution of household income dey always come for olive shape form wey dey sharp for di two end and e plump for di middle.

en: In other words, the middle-income group usually accounts for 60 per cent to 70 per cent of the population in developed countries.
pcm: For oda words, for kontri wey don develop di middle-income group dey usually accpount for 60 per cent go reach 70 percent of di population.

en: Such a structure is considered healthy and good for economic and social development.
pcm: Dem dey consider dat kind structure as say dem dey healthy and good for economic and social development.

en: In contrast, China still has a long way to go to expand the size of its middle-income group.
pcm: In contrast, China way still far to take expand di size of im middle-income group.

en: Vice-Minister of Commerce Qian Keming said that with 1.4 billion people, China boasts a super large market and huge development potential.
pcm: Vice-Minister of Commerce Qian Keming tok say with 1.4 billion pipo, China get large market and huge development potential.

en: In the next 15 years, the number of Chinese middle-income earners is expected to reach 800 million, which will generate robust momentum for consumption upgrading and bright prospects.
pcm: For di next fifteen years, dem expect say make di nomba of Chinese middle-income don reach 800 million, wey go generate robust momentum for consumption upgrading plus bright prospects.

en: According to China's 14th Five-Year Plan, China will work to increase the income for graduates of universities and vocational schools, skilled workers and migrant workers in the next five years.
pcm: According to di 14th Five-Year Plan of China, China go work to increase di income for graduates of universeties dem and vocational schools, skiled workers and migrants workers dem for di next five years.

en: Experts believe that it's both possible and necessary to include them in the middle-income group.
pcm: Experts dem believe say e dey possible and necessary to put dem for di middle-income group.

en: Graduates of universities and vocational schools come in huge size and are well educated and skilful, which makes them possible to become middle-income earners.
pcm: Graduates of university and vocational school dem  plenty and are dey well  educated and get skil, wey make am possible for dem to  become middle-income earners.

en: Most people from this group, with their degree of education and competence, will not work simple and repetitive jobs, so it's possible that they become middle-income earners, Su Hainan, a contract research fellow with China Association for Labor Studies, told People's Daily during an interview.
pcm: Most pipo for dis group, with dem degree of education and competence no go wan do simple and repetive work, so e dey possible say make dem bikom middle-income earners, Su Hainan, wey be contract research fellow with China Association for Labor Studies, tell People's Daily during one interview.

en: According to the latest statistics from the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security (MOHRSS), China has over 200 million skilled workers, who take 26 per cent of its total jobs, up from 20 per cent a few years ago.
pcm: According to di latest statistics from di Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security (MOHRSS), China get over 200 million skiled workers wey take 26 per cent of dem total job, up from 20 per cent few years ago.

en: More than 50 million of them are highly skilled workers.
pcm: More dan 50 million of dem be skiled worker.

en: In recent years, skilled workers are in a short supply in China, and their income keeps rising.
pcm: For recent years, skiled workers no reach for China, and dem income don kontinu to det rise.

en: The MOHRSS recently issued a guideline, encouraging enterprises to institute an annual salary system and offer special awards for skilled talents, especially highly skilled ones.
pcm: Di MOHRSS issue one guideline recently, wey dem encourage enterprises to institute annual salary system and offer special award for skiled talents, esecially di ones wey get high skil.

en: Migrant workers are a major part of China's workforce, many of whom are also well educated and skilful, and are able to work complicated and innovative jobs, Su said.
pcm: Su tok say migrant workers na major part of workforce for inside China, many of dem sef dey well educated and dem get skil, and dem no dey able to do complicated and innovative works dem.

en: Last year, the number of migrant workers in China reached 280 million, including 170 million who worked out-of-town.
pcm: Last year, di nomba of migrant worker for inside China reach 280 million, plus 180 wey work out of town.

en: The average monthly income of them stood at 4,072 yuan.
pcm: Di average income wey dem dey get per month stay for 4,072 yuan.

en: Many of them are getting close to the threshold of middle income if calculated in terms of household.
pcm: Plenty among dem don dey get close to di threshold of middle income if dem take terms of household calculate am.

en: To make a part of migrant workers middle-income earners is necessary for narrowing the rural-urban income gap, improving the competence of workforce and accelerating rural vitalization, and it's also feasible to do that, Su noted.
pcm: To make part of dem imigrant worker to become middle-income earners dey necessary to take marrow di rural-urban income gap, to take improve di competence of workforce and accelerate rural vitalization, and e lso dey feasible to am, as Su take note

en: As the income of these major groups rises in the future, the size of China's middle-income group will be further expanded, turning the country's household income distribution into the olive shape.
pcm: As di income of dis major group go rise for future, dem go expand di size di middle-income group for China, dat one go turn di household income distribution to olive shape.

en: By that time, China's consumption vitality will have been further activated, and the country will also release more dividends to the world.
pcm: By dat time, dem go don further actuvate di consumption vitality of China, and di kontri go release more dividends to di world.

en: Aba agog as maiden Gov Ikpeazu golf tourney tees off
pcm: Aba dey go agog as Gov Ikpeazu golf tourney don start

en: Over 2,500 players from across Nigeria and West Africa are currently vying for laurels in the maiden edition of Governor Okezie Ikpeazu open golf championship which teed off on Wednesday, May 19 and will end on May 23at the famous Aba Golf Course.
pcm: Over 25,000 players dem from across Nigeria and West Africa dey try get laurels currently for inside di maiden edition of Governor Okezie Ikpeazu open golf championship wey start on wednesday, May 19 and e go end for May 23 for di famous Aba Golf Course.

en: The Governor who teed off the tournament charged the players to enjoy the game and also the hospitality of the people.
pcm: Di Governor wey start di tournament charge di player say make dem enjoy di game plus di hospitality of di pipo.

en: He said they should find time to visit major shopping centres in Aba to buy memorabilia to take to their respective homes.
pcm: He tok say make dem find time to take visit major shopping centers dem for Aba to buy memorable things to dem houses.

en: The governor also promised to continue to support the sport and assured that his administration will construct a new golf course in Ohafia to further deepen awareness and participation in the game.
pcm: Di governor be also promise say im go kontinu to dey support di sport and assure say im administration go construct new golf course for Ohafia to help awareness and participation for di game.

en: He said,I pray that golf which is a unifying game will continue to unify us in Nigeria and also avail us of the health benefits of engaging in this gentlemen's game.
pcm: He tok say, I pray say golf wey be unifyin game go kontinu to dey unify us for Nigeria and also give di health benefit of engaging for di gentleman game.

en: In his remarks, the National Director of Competitions, Professional Golfers Association of Nigeria (PGAN), Johnbull Dangofa informed Ikpeazu that having gone round the historic city, he was pleased with the prevailing peace and the good infrastructure put in place by the governor.
pcm: For im remark, di National Director of Competitions, Professional Golfers Association of Nigeria (PGAN), Johnbull Dangofa inform Ikpeazu say as im don go round di historic city, di peace ey dey and di good infrastructure wey di governor do please am.

en: The President of Aba Sports Club, Chief Jerry Kalu, expressed members appreciation to the governor for the support given by the state government to ensure the smooth take-off of the competition.
pcm: Di president of Aba sports club,Chief Jerry Kalu don express di appreciation of members to di governor for di support wey di state goment give to take make sure say di take off of di competition smooth.

en: He said more than 250 golfers had registered to take part in the tournament.
pcm: He tok say more than 250 golfers don register to take part for inside di tournament.

en: A letter to DSS and other intelligence agencies
pcm: One letter to DSS and oda intelligence agencies dem

en: You guys are supposed to be smart.
pcm: Una suppose dey smart.

en: I know you evolved from the police  just as did many other agencies.
pcm: I know say na from police you for evolve just as many oda agency dem.

en: By splintering from the police you were meant to be cleaner, and smarter, much quicker on your feet.
pcm: As you take komot from di police you suppose clean pass dem, make you smart, make you dey quick for your feet.

en: Is it politics that overcame you guys?
pcm: Shey na politics come over una?

en: I heard the National Security Adviser, Monguno, for the first time since he was appointed years ago the other day, sounding very eloquent with his Queen's English.
pcm: I hear say di National Security Adviser, Monguno, for di first time since dem appoint am years ago, wey he dey sound very eloquent with im Queen's English.

en: He should be polished, after all he was one of those privileged ajebutter Nigerian children who attended Kings College back in the day.
pcm: Make dem polish am, afta all im na one of dis ajebutter Nigerian wey get priviledge to attend Kings College back in di day.

en: From his speech I could hear and see an organised mind and an intelligent, functional brain, and I wondered at length why and how Abba Kyari managed to cage such a person while Buhari looked on.
pcm: From im speech I dey hear and I dey see one mind wey dey organised and intelligent, functional brain, and i wonder why and how Abba Kyari take manage to cage dat kain pesin and Buhari dey look.

en: Monguno, later went on to allege that quite a number of the arms and ammunition that Nigeria paid for under the recently ambassadorised military chiefs were nowhere to be found.
pcm: Munguno later go on to allege say plenty inside di arms wey Nigeria pay for under di recent military chiefs wey don turn ambassador na im dem no fit find.

en: When he saw that feathers were ruffled, he tried to walk back what he was alleged to have said.
pcm: When im see say dem don dey ruffle feathers, im try to walk back wetin dem allege say im tok.

en: A couple of days after that happened, we heard in the news that Buhari stopped some weapons acquisition he wanted to make from Dubai through third parties.
pcm: Some few days afta dat apun, we hear di news say Buhari be stop some weapon acquisition wey he wan make from Dubai through third parti dem.

en: The report put Monguno in bad light and sought to expose his hypocrisy.
pcm: Di report put Monguno for bad light and e wan expose im hypocrisy.

en: Will we ever find a way out of our insecurity maze?
pcm: Shey we go ever get way to komot for inside dis insecurity maze?

en: We are no longer hearing from the leadership of the DSS.
pcm: We no longer dey hear from di leadership for inside DSS.

en: Since the initial gra-gra and controversies they've fallen silent.
pcm: Afta di initial gra-gra and controversy dem don silent.

en: No one sees or hears from Yusuf Bichi anymore, but we sometimes see smart DSS chaps in dark suits and goggles performing their bodyguard services to the high and mighty.
pcm: No one dey hear or dey see Yusuf Bichi anymore, but we dey see smart DSS chaps dem inside dark suits ad goggle wey dey do dem bodiguard service to di high and mighty.

en: We even see them on few occasions heavily kitted up like ninjas, complete with balaclavas and some out-of-this-world machine guns.
pcm: We even dey see dem on top few occasion wey dem go dress like ninja, dem go complete like balaclavas plus some out-of-this-world machine guns dem.

en: But that is where it ends.
pcm: But na there e for end.

en: It seems that the president does not care about the efficacy of the DSS and so they too have jejely withdrawn to their cocoon.
pcm: E be like say di president no care about di efficacy of DSS and so dem sef don jejely withdraw enter dem cocoon.

en: There is some politics going on there.
pcm: Some politics dey go on for there.

en: The police, we know their problem; that one is agelong.
pcm: Di police, we sabi dem problem; that one don tey.

en: I am writing not to draw the attention of these bodies to myself
pcm: I  don dey write so I no go draw attention of dis bodi dem kom my side

en: but well I am available for their attention if they take this personal.
pcm: But well I go dey available for dem attention if dem take am personal.

en: I am writing as a concerned Nigerian citizen.
pcm: I dey write as concerned citizen of Nigeria.

en: I'm afraid that there is no intelligence in this country anymore.
pcm: I dey fear say intelligence no dey for dis kontri anymore.

en: I am prompted to write specifically because the nation is totally adrift and even if we accuse the politicians of being asleep at the wheels, it is inexcusable for our intelligence services to also be snoring.
pcm: I dey prompted to write specifically bikos di nation don drift totally and even as we accuse politician say dem don sleep, no excuse for awa intelligence services dem to dey snore too.

en: There looks to be a deliberate abandonment of Nigeria into the hands of the elements  kidnappers, secessionists, fake news agents, online terrorists, and other forms of terrorists.
pcm: E dey be like say dem don abandon Nigeria for di hand of element like kidnapper, secessionist, fake news agent dem, online terrorist, plus oda form of terrorist.

en: Who does not know that security is won and lost at the level of intelligence?
pcm: Who no know say security for di level of intelligence don loss?

en: Whereas Nigeria has come to disrespect the police force, but many still hold the intelligence services in awe as we see them as elite corps.
pcm: wiaas Nigeria don kom disrespect di police, but many still dey fear di intelligence service dem seek of say we dey see dem as elite corps.

en: At least they cannot be seen on the roads collecting money from bus drivers.
pcm: At least dem no fit see dem for road dey kolekt money from bus drivers dem.

en: However, one can conclude that with the rifeness of crime, and general disintegration of society, the intelligence services have lost their bite and famed prowess, especially under this government.
pcm: However, pesin fit confirm say wit di rifeness of crime, di way di society don dey fall apart, di intelligence service don loss dem bite and famed prowess, especially for inside dis goment.

en: How can a faceless group named FUNAM be sowing so much discord in the Nigerian society and we have intelligence services feigning ignorance?
pcm: How one group wey no get face wey dem name FUNAM dey plant dat kind plenty wahala for inside Nigeria society and we get intelligence service wey dey komot eye?

en: Whoever is putting out statements on behalf of FUNAM is certainly playing a childish game on the minds of Nigerians but even professors believe them.
pcm: Whoever e be wey dey put statement out for FUNAM dey play small pikin play for inside di mind of Nigeria pipo but even professor dem dey believe dem.

en: This is because at the end, we are very emotional people in this country.
pcm: Dis one na bikos, for di end, for dis kontri we dey very emotional.

en: However, the intelligence services have deliberately looked away while all this has been going on.
pcm: However, di intelligence service don komot eye as if say dem no see as all dis things dem dey go on.

en: I googled statement by FUNAM just to be able to get some direct quotes for this article and up popped a statement from 2018
pcm: I google statement by FUNAM so I go fit get some direct quote for dis article and one statement from 2018 pop komot

en: wherein this same FUNAM claimed that Nigeria is their only inheritance and that the whole of Nigeria up to the Atlantic belongs to them, that Plateau is their indigenous territory, even as they claimed responsibility for some gruesome killings.
pcm: wiain na dis same FUNAM claim say Nigeria na dem only inheritance and say di whole of Nigeria go reach di Atlantic na dem get am, say Plateau na dem indigenous territory, even as dem dey claim say na dem do some bad bad kilin dem.

en: In recent times, the same group claimed that it attacked Benue Governor Ortom, and only missed killing him because of some slight technical communications error.
pcm: For recent times, di same group claim say na dem attack Benue Governor Ortom, and only dem no see am kill bikos of some kind small error for communication.

en: The group went further to say Our intention is unequivocal: TO KILL HIM.
pcm: Di group further tok am say dem intension no get doubt: TO KILL AM.

en: The mission will one day be fulfilled and very soon too.
pcm: Dem go fulfil di mission one day and e go dey very soo too.

en: Furthermore, We warn collaborators working against Fulani people across Nigeria: WE SHALL GET YOU irrespective of your hidden place
pcm: Furthermore, we warn pipo wey dey collabo to take work against Fulani pipo for inside Nigeria: WE GO GET YOU NO MATTER WIA YOU HIDE

en: We state clearly, any state or individual that opposes RUGA will be confronted.
pcm: We tok am clearly, we go confront any state or individual wey dey oppose RUGA

en: Any State or individual that opposes ranching, we shall get you.
pcm: Any State or individual that opposes ranching, we shall get you.

en: Speak against ranching and RUGA even on the internet: Our Noiseless fighters shall find and fix you
pcm: Speak against ranching or RUGA even for internet: awa fighters dem wey no dey make noise go find you and dem go fix you

en: In the next few months, FUNAM will carry out attacks on strategic human and material assets of States and Non State groups or individuals known for their anti-Fulani campaigns¦ We shall hunt you down in your houses, in your work places, in your car, in your streets.
pcm: For di next few month wey go follow, FUNAM go attack some strategic human and material assests for inside states and non state group dem or individual wey we know say dem dey do anti Fulani campaign. We go hunt you down for your house, for your wrk place, inside your car, for your street.

en: It's a matter of time.
pcm: a matter of time.

en: People sign these documents but no one has been apprehended, neither has the statements been declared fake by our intelligence services.
pcm: Pipo sign dis document but dem neva catch any person, and awa intellingence serveice dem neva declare say na fake.

en: From my own humble perception these statements are childishly written by someone who wants to foment trouble and arouse public anger and disunity in general.
pcm: From my own humble perception dis satement dem be like pikin tok, wey pesin wey dey look for wahala, wey wan make pipo vex, wey wan cause disunity write.

en: The statements also deflect from focusing on real perpetrators.
pcm: Di statement also take eye away from di real pipo wey dey do di bad.

en: I have been on many WhatsApp groups trying to calm people down by bringing attention to the fact that their minds are being manipulated.
pcm: I be don dey on top plenty WhatsApp group dem wey I dey try to calm pipo down and bring dem attention say dem dey manipulate dem mind.

en: But why am I doing DSS job?
pcm: But why I dey do work wey DSS suppose do?

en: Even Ortom had earlier called a press conference at which he read another statement that this group put online to the extent that Benue State belongs to them and that it was their pleasure to kill Tiv people!
pcm: Even Ortom don call press conference before wia im for read anoda statement wey di group put for online to di extent say Benue state na dem own and dey e dey sweet dem to kill Tiv pipo dem!

en: A lot of Nigerians have been hailing Ortom for being a governor who loves his people for these public shows.
pcm: Plenty Nigeria pipo don dey hail Ortom say im na governor wey love im pipo on top im public show dem.

en: However, those who attacked him must be found.
pcm: However, dem must catch pipo wey attack am.

en: We hear that the police have arrested some fishermen in the area.
pcm: We hear say police don catch some fishermen for inside di area.

en: I have become a bit wary as every crime in Nigeria is now attributed to herders.
pcm: I don dey careful as dem put evri crime for Nigeria on top herders dem.

en: Are we not leaving the space open for other criminals to ride on our sentiments?
pcm: Shey no be say we dey give oda criminals dem space to ride on top awa sentiment?

en: Are we saying with all the resources at the behest of our intelligence services, no one can fish out those dumping things online, stewing up the minds of Nigerians, causing mayhem all over the place and even getting people primed to the idea of war and national disintegration?
pcm: Shey wetin we dey tok be say with all resources dem wey awa intelligence service dem get, pesin no dey wey fit find di pipo wey dey dump things for online, wey dey stew up di mind of Nigerians, wey dey kos wahala evriwia and wey dey get pipo prepare for war or make nation scatter?

en: Is this the best that we can do really gentlemen?
pcm: Shey na di best wey we fit do be dis gentlemen?

pcm: Queen Elizabeth II don show say she sad concerning di interview wey her grandson, Prince Harry, and im wife Meghan do.

pcm: However, Buckingham palace tok for inside one statement on Tuesday say di palace no dey hapi with di challenge wey di grandson Prince Harry and im wife Meghan dey face, and dem go take di allegation of racism for di royal family seriously.

pcm: Di issues dem wey dem raise, especially di one wey concern race, dem conmcern di palace, as di palace tok for inside one statement wey dem release on Queen behalf.

en: Why secession is not the silver bullet to Nigeria's challenges (II)
pcm: (II) Why secession no be di silver bullet to di problem wey Nigeria get (II)

en: The proponents of Nigeria's break up hinge their reasons on three main pegs; the 1914 amalgamation of the northern and southern protectorates which gave birth to Nigeria, the United Nation's charter on self-determination and allegations of lack of representation and marginalisation in the affairs of the country.
pcm: Di pipo wey dey do say make Nigeria break up put am on top three main reason dem; di amalgation of northern and southern protectorate for 1914 wey born Nigeria, di charter of sef determination for inside United Nation plus lack of representation and marginalisation for inside di affairs of di kontri.

en: The notion that the 1914 amalgamation which secessionist groups say was the foundational move from which most of the current challenges facing the Nigerian nation emanated need to be vigorously challenged and totally debunked.
pcm: The mind say na di amalgamation of 1914 wey secessionist group dey say be di foundamental move wey cause plenty inside di current challenge dem wey dey face Nigeria need make dem challenge welwel and debunk am totally.

en: In this regard, it will benefit us to know that there was an earlier amalgamation in 1906 where the Lagos colony which had been in existence in 1862 was merged with the southern protectorate.
pcm: For dis regard, e go benefit us to know say amalgation be don apun earlier for 1906 wia dem merge di Lagos colony wey don dey since 1862 wit southern protectorate.

en: Like the subsequent 1914 amalgamation which seems to enervate the secessionists, the 1906 amalgamation too was a forced one between unwilling entities which had little or no cultural similarities.
pcm: Like di 1914 amalgamation wey follow wey dey enervate di secession pipo dem, di amalgamation wey apun for 1906 too na force dem take do am between entity dem wey no dey willing and dem get little or no cultural similarity.

en: Pray what did the peoples of the coastal states in the Niger Delta region have culturally and historically with the Yorubas of the Southwest?
pcm: Wetin di pipo of costal state for inside Niger Delta region get culturally and historically wit Yoruba pipo of southwest?

en: What links historically and culturally do the Igbos in the eastern hinterland have with Yorubas for that matter?
pcm: Wetin be di historical and cultural link wey di Igbo wey dey for east hinterland get wit Yoruba for dat matter?

en: As far as can be deduced, the reasons for rejecting the 1914 amalgamation also suffice for the one of 1906 in that they were both a forcible measure against peoples of different historical and cultural backgrounds.
pcm: As far as we fit see am, di reason to take reject di amalgamation of 1914 go reach for di one of 1906 on top say na force dem force di two against pipo wey get different history and culture.

en: Why then do the secessionists harp only on the 1914 amalgamation to press home their demands neglecting conveniently the 1906 amalgamation?
pcm: Why secession pipo dey only tok about di 1914 amalgamation to take press dem demand and dem dey neglect di one wey apun for 1906?

en: The reasons are simply because for their own narrow political narratives and ends which seek to justify a North versus South secessionist agenda the 1914 amalgamation narrative is more suitable.
pcm: Di reason dem dey simple bikos for dem own narrow political tok wey dey try justify North vs South secessionist agenda na di 1914 amalgamation enter am pass.

en: It would not make good strategy if they also have to cite the 1906 amalgamation which essentially, by import and effect, was similar to the one of 1914.
pcm: E no go form beta strategy if dem dey also tok about di amalgamation wey dey essential, by import and effect, and e dey similar to di one wey apun for 1914.

en: How would it look for instance if Oduduwa secessionists say that the 1906 amalgamation was the reason why Igbos who are of different historical and cultural background have come to  dominate the economic and commercial life of Lagos and as such the Oduduwans are seeking out of this marriage with the Igbos forced on them by the British?
pcm: How e go take look for instance if Oduduwa secessionist tok say na bikos of si amalgamation for 1906 di Igbo wey get different history and culture don kom dominate di economic and commercial life inside Lagos and as such di Oduduwa dey seek to komot for di marriage with Igbo wey di British pipo be force on top dem.

en: Or the Igbos claiming that the 1906 amalgamation was responsible for the skewered nature of economic infrastructure being concentrated in the Southwest which compels them (Igbos) to have to invest in the Lagos economic zone rather than the East at great inconvenience?
pcm: or di Igbo dey say na di amalgamation of 1906 kos the bad nature of economic infrastructure wey dem concentrate put for Southwest wey dey carry dem (Igbo) kom invest for Lagos economic zone rather than di East wey go dey convienient pass?

en: Another fallacy being peddled about the 1914 amalgamation which was purportedly signed by representatives of Nigerian entities, was that it was to expire after a hundred years meaning by 2014.
pcm: Anoda falacy wey dem carry concerning di 1914 amalgamation be wey Nigerian entity dem represent sign be say e supoose expire afta hundred years wey mean say na 2014.

en: That Nigeria is still existing after the expiry date of 2014 is something the secessionists are trying to instigate other Nigerians to agitate against and ensure the end of this expired contraption as they call Nigeria.
pcm: Say Nigeria still dey exist afta im expiry date na somethingg wey secessionist dem still dey try to instigate oda Nigeria pipo against and make sure say dem end of dis joinjoin wey don expire as dem dey call am.

en: Again this is as near a namby pamby narrative as it can get.
pcm: Again dis one na near tok wey no get leg.

en: By 1914 the British had established full and total control of the territory we now call Nigeria as all pre-existing entities such as they were had become subsumed under British rule.
pcm: By 1914 di British don get full and total kontrol of di territory wey we dey cal Nigeria now and all di entities as dem be don dey under British rule.

en: British colonial rule over Nigeria had been unquestionably established which made the amalgamation a purely administrative measure by a colonial overlord for which he did not need the permission of his subjects to carry out.
pcm: Dem don establish di British colonial rule on top Nigeria and na dat one make di amalgamation pure administrative measure by colonial overload wey im no need permision from im subject to carry am out.

en: In this regard the amalgamation could not have been time bound as claimed, and it was not.
pcm: For this regard di amalgamation no fit get time to expire as dem dey claim, and e no get.

en: If ever there was a time for the amalgamation to expire as claimed, it had to be at the end of the British colonial enterprise which at the time was not in the reckoning of the British.
pcm: If time ever dey for di amalgamation to take expire as dem dey claim, e suppose be for di end di British colonial enterprise wey be say at di same time no be British go determine am.

en: If there was a genuine document that contained the terms and condition of the 1914 amalgamation including the signatories representing various pre-existing Nigerian entities as well as clause stating the date of expiry, the onus is on those peddling such as basis for the break-up of Nigeria to present it as proof to us of their justification.
pcm: If any genuine document dey wey carry di terms and condition of di 1914 amalgamation wey include pipo wey represent various pre-existing Nigerian entities plus clause wey dey state di clause for di expiry, na di work od di pipo wey dey pray for Nigeria to break up to present am as proof.

en: In any case, even if such a document existed, with Nigeria's independence in 1960 it ceased to be valid because all entities in Nigeria at the time partook through their elected representatives to discuss and agree on terms to be part of the new country.
pcm: For any case, even if such document dey, as Nigeria take get independence for 1960 e no go dey valid again bikos na evri entity for Nigeria dey take part wit di representative wey dem elect to take discuss and agree on top di new kontri.

en: If an agreement such as being bandied about on the amalgamation existed and if the parties that took part in the independence talk agreed for its retention and inclusion in the independence constitution, it would have become a relevant constitutional and legal case for the secessionists to cite in their agitations.
pcm: If di kind agreement wey dem dey carry about di amalgamation dey anywia and if di parti dem wey follow tok about di independence agree to retain am and dem include am inside di independence constitution, e for don bikom relevant constitution and legal case for di secession entity to take cite dem agitation.

en: On the issue of the UN provision on self-determination as cited by the secessionists for their action, it is important to bear two important points in mind.
pcm: On top di issue of di UN provision on sef-determination as dem take cite am for dem secession action, e dey important make dem get two important point for mind.

en: The UN is not a world government with executive powers to superimpose its will on national governments.
pcm: Di UN no be world goment wey get executive power to take stamp dem will on top national goment dem.

en: A country can invoke the principle of sovereignty to block the implementation of any UN resolution it considers in conflict with its national interests.
pcm: Kontri fit use di principle of sovereignty to take block any resolution wey UN make if dem see say e no follow dem national interest.

en: Although Nigeria is signatory to the UN charter including the provision on self-determination, it can and has the right to block any attempt by any group within it to break-up the country by latching on to that provision.
pcm: Although Nigeria follow sign to di UN charter wey di provision of sef-determination follow, e fit and dem get right to block attempt from any group withing wey wan break di kontri if dem use dat provision.

en: Thus even in the unlikely event of any break-away group in Nigeria securing UN support, Nigeria can within its sovereign rights stand against such a move.
pcm: Thus even as e dey unlike say any group break away from Nigeria and UN support am, Nigeria fit use dem sovereign right to stand against such move.

en: But what is more significant is that although the UN charter provides for self-determination, the UN places a great onus on seeking such to prove their credentials and case comprehensively.
pcm: But di thing wey dey more significant be say although di UN charter dey providde sef detrmination, di UN don place great onus to take seek dem credential and case comprehensively.

en: The process of seeking and eventually getting UN support for a self-determination bid is a very complicated and convoluted one which will take years to come to fruition and may not result in success ultimately.
pcm: Di process to take ssek and to eventually get di support of UN for sef-determination bid dey very complicated and covoluted one wey fit take year to set and e still fit no get success at di end.

en: Those seeking to invoke the UN principle of self-determination for their secessionist bid must first of all prove that they have the mandate of the people of the area they seek to represent through popular elections or referendum and not through the media or internet.
pcm: Those seeking to invoke di UN principle of sef-determination for dia secessionist bid must first of all prove say dem get di mandate of di pipo of di area dey seek to represent through popular elections or referendum and not through di media or internet. Di pipo wey dey try to evoke UN principle of sef-determination for dem secessionst bid must firts prove say dem dey do wetin pipo for di area wey dem dey represent want wit popular election or referendum no be through media or internet.

en: They must also show proof that the area seeking to secede has been denied or does not have adequate representation at local, state and national levels of the government of the country.
pcm: Dem must to show proof say di area wey want do secession dem don dey deny dem or say dem no get adequate representation for local, state and national level of di goment of di kontri.

en: To be concluded next week
pcm: We go conclude am next week

en: Lebanon starts its COVID-19 vaccination drive, PM says will wait his turn
pcm: Lebanon don start dem COVID-19 vaccination drive, PM tok say im go wait for im turn.

en: Lebanon started its COVID-19 vaccination drive on Sunday by inoculating the head of critical care at its biggest public hospital, followed by 93-year-old celebrated Lebanese actor and comedian Salah Tizani.
pcm: Lebanon be start dem COVID-19 vaccination drive for Sunday as dem take inoculate di head for critical care unit for dem public hospital wey big pass, na di 93-year old Lebanese actor plus comedian wey pipo celebrate Salah Tizani follow am.

en: Battling a sharp spike in infections in recent weeks which has overwhelmed its healthcare system, Lebanon took delivery of 28,500 doses of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine on Saturday, the first batch of 2.1 million doses set to arrive in stages throughout the year.
pcm: As dem dey fight rise of infection for recent weeks wey pass wey don pass di power of dem healthcare system, Lebanon kolekt 28,500 doses of di Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine on Saturday,na di first set inside 2.1 million dose wey go dey kom stage by stage throughout di tear.

en: Delays in signing a deal to purchase a vaccine and the rollout of an inoculation programme had caused frustration in Lebanon.
pcm: Di delay to take sign deal to buy vaccine and di to take rollout inoculation program don cause fraustration inside Lebanon.

en: The World Bank, which helped fund the first batch of doses, has said it would monitor the inoculation drive to ensure the shots go to those most in need.
pcm: Di World Bank, wey help wit money to buy di first batch of doses, don tok say dem go monitor as dem dey do di inoculation drive to ensure di shot go reach pipo wey need am pass.

en: I will not be receiving the vaccine today, for today is not my turn and the priority is for the medical sector that has done its duty and presented big sacrifices,
pcm: I no dey kolekt vaccine today bikos today no be my turn and di priority na for di medical sector wey don do dem duty and present big sacrifice,

en: caretaker Prime Minister Hassan Diab told reporters at the Rafik Hariri hospital, where Lebanon's first coronavirus case was quarantined about a year ago.
pcm: Hassa Diab wey be caretaker Prime Minister tell reporters dem for inside di Rafik Hariri hospital wia dem for put di first coronavirus case inside Lebanon for quarantine about one year ago.

en: Tizani, who is better known by his stage name Abou Salim, encouraged everyone to get the vaccine.
pcm: Tizani, wey dem sabi pass with im stage name Abou Salim, encourage evri pesin to go get di vaccine.

en: For those who are afraid to get vaccinated, I swear by God, it is protection for them, he said.
pcm: For pipo wey dey fear to kolekt di vaccine, I swear on top God, na protection for dem, as e tok.

en: The country has also booked 2.7 million doses through the global COVAX scheme for poorer countries and officials
pcm: Di kontri don also book 2.7 million dose through di global COVAx scheme for kontri dem wey poor and official

en: say talks are underway for some 1.5 million doses of the AstraZeneca vaccine.
pcm: say dem don dey tok for some 1.5 million doses of di AstraZeneca vaccine.

en: The total number of doses ordered so far would cover about half of Lebanon's population of more than six million, which includes at least a million Syrian refugees.
pcm: Di total nomba of dose wey dem don order so far go cover about half of di pipo wey dey inside Lebanon wey pass six million, wey include at least one million refuge from Syria.

en: Lebanon has been under a 24-hour curfew for nearly a month, although the government began lifting some restrictions this week.
pcm: Lebanon don dey under 24-hour curfew for almost one month, di goment begin to dey lift some kind restriction dis week.

en: BIC launches 2021 Art Master contest
pcm: BIC don launch 2021 Art Master contest

en: BIC has announced the launch of its continent-wide art competition that will see to a grand prize of $2,000.
pcm: BIC don announce dem don launch dem art competition wey dey for di whole continent wey go see to grand prize of $2,000.

en: The stationery giant is searching for talented ball pen artists to submit their exceptional artwork for an opportunity to be named the Art Master of Middle East and Africa, a statement by the company indicated on Sunday.
pcm: Di giant on top station sellin dey serach for ball pen artist wey get talent say make dem submit dem exceptional artwork for opportunity to take name dem as ARt Master for inside Middle Eats and Africa , on statement wey di company do for Sunday indicate am.

en: The BIC Art Master competition was first held in South Africa in 2017 and, following its success, it grew to include all of Africa in 2019.
pcm: Di BIC Master competition na im dem first do for inside South Africa for 2017, and as e dey follow di success, e grow reach all of AFrica for 2019.

en: Deputy General Manager, Lucky Stationery Nigeria Ltd and Senior Sales Manager West & Central Africa, Mr Guillaume Grou, said, With our diverse Nigerian culture, we are excited to be launching this year's edition of the BIC Art Master Competition that acts as a platform to recognize and showcase African talents.
pcm: Deputy General Manager, Lucky Stationery Nigeria Ltd and Senior Sales Manager West & Central Africa, Mr Guillaume Grou tok say wit awa culture for Nigeria wey dey diverse, we dey excited to dey launch di edition of BIC Art Master Competition for dis year wey dey act as platform to take showcase African talents dem.

en: The grand prize for the competition is $2,000, a personalized online gallery and an opportunity to be featured as part of the BIC Art Collection.
pcm: Di grand prize for di competition na $2,000, one personal gallery online and opportunity to feature as part of di BIC Art Collection.

en: The second prize winner will walk away with a $1,000 cash prize, and the 2nd runner-up will win a $500 cash prize.
pcm: Di second prize winner go carry $1,000 cash prize komot, and di second runner-up go win $500 cash prize.

en: This contest is open for Africa and Middle East residents only.
pcm: Dis contest dey open for pipo wey dey Africa and Middle East alone.

en: FG gets N392bn tax from companies in 3 months
pcm: FG get N392bn as tax from company dem inside 3 months

en: The federal government has gotten N392.77 billion as Company Income Tax (CIT) from breweries, telecommunications companies, and others in the first quarter of 2021.
pcm: Di federal goment don get N392bn as Company Income Tax (CIT) from breweries dem, telecommunication company plus odas inside di first quarter of 2021.

en: According to data on CIT published yesterday by the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS), the amount was higher than the N295.72bn generated in the fourth quarter of 2020.
pcm: According to data wey National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) publish on top CIT yesterday, di amount pass di N295.72bn wey dem generate inside di fourth quarter of 2020.

en: Daily Trust also observed that it was higher than the N295.68bn generated in the first quarter of 2020.
pcm: Daily Trust be also observe say e high pass di N295.68bn wey dem generate inside di first quarter of 2020.

en: The tax revenue growth in the first quarter of 2021 further represented 32.82 percent quarterly increase and 32.84 percent yearly increase.
pcm: Di growth on top tax revenue inside first quarter of 2021 dey further represent 32.82 percent quarterly increase and 32.84 percent yearly increase

en: Breweries, bottling and beverages generated the highest CIT of N23.26bn and closely followed by professional services that includes telecoms with N18.17bn.
pcm: Breweries dem, bottling and beverages generate di highest CIT wey reach N23.26bn and professional services wey include telecoms dey close to follow am  with N18.17bn.

en: State ministries and parastatals generated N17.35bn
pcm: State ministry and parastatals dem generate N17.35bn

en: while textile and garment industry generated the least of N13.49 million.
pcm: As textile and garment imdustry generate di one wey low pass wey be N13.49 million.

en: Mining was higher at N34.40m while Automobiles and Assemblies generated N73.57m.
pcm: Mining dey higher at N34.40m as Automobiles and Assembles generate N73.57m.

en: The report showed that out of the generated amounted in the first quarter, N152.33bn was from local industries while N184.59bn was generated as foreign CIT payment.
pcm: Di report show say di amount wey dem generate inside di first quarter, 152.33bn na from local industries dem as dem generate N184.59bn as foreign CIT payment.

en: NBS reported that the balance of N55.85bn was generated as CIT from other payments.
pcm: NBS report say di balance of N55.85 na im dem generate as CIT for oda payments dem.

en: Trump impeachment article heads to U.S. Senate
pcm: Di impeachment article of Trump don head to U.S.

en: A second impeachment trial of former U.S. president, Donald Trump is set to come a step closer.
pcm: A second impeachment trial for former U.S president, Donald Trump don almost carry one step close.

en: The U.S. House of Representatives prepares to forward the article of impeachment to the Senate.
pcm: Di House of Representative for inside U.S dey prepare to forward di article of impeachment to di senate.

en: Carrying the charge of incitement to sedition, the article is to be read before the second chamber of Congress at 7 p.m. on Monday evening (
pcm: Carrying di charge of incitement o sedition, dem go read di article for inside di second chamber of congress at 7 p.m on monday evening (

en: Trump is facing an unprecedented second impeachment trial based on a charge of incitement of insurrection over the deadly storming of the Capitol by pro-Trump rioters on January 6.
pcm: Trump dey face unprecedented second impeachment trial base on charge say im incite pipo make pro-Trump rioters for stand up and storm Capitol for January 6.

en: According to impeachment rules, the arrival of the indictment article at the Senate formally triggers the start of the impeachment trial, which will be the first faced by a president after leaving office.
pcm: According to wetin dey inside impeachment rule dem, as di indictment article dey arrive na im go trigger di start of impeachment trial, na im go be di first wey president wey don komot for office go face.

en: However, Senate leaders have agreed to modify the rules by having the impeachment article delivered on Monday evening and then delaying the actual start to Feb. 8.
pcm: However, senate leader dem agree to modify di rule to take deliver di impeachment article for Monday evening and dem go delay di actual start to Feb. 8.

en: The Capitol attack
pcm: Di attack for Capitol.

en: A violent mob of his supporters attacked the Capitol just after he used fiery rhetoric at a rally to promote baseless claims of election fraud.
pcm: Violent pipo for im supporters be attack di Capitol just afta im use fiery rhetoric for rally to take promote election fraud wey no get base.

en: The attack, which sought to halt lawmakers certification of now-President Joe Biden's victory in the November election, left at least five people, including a police officer dead.
pcm: Di attack wey wan hold di certification of di president now Joe Biden win for di November election, kill at least five pipo including police officer.

en: In the Senate, a two-thirds majority is needed to convict.
pcm: For inside di senate, dem need two-thirds majority to convict.

en: It is unclear how many Republicans might join the Democrats in such a vote, which could also bar Trump from holding office again.(dpa/NAN)
pcm: E dey unclear how Republicans fit join di Democrats for dat kind vote, wey fit also bar Trump from holding any office again. (dpa/NAN)

en: Court convicts 39 tricycle, bike riders without permit
pcm: Court convict 39 tricycle, bike riders without permit

en: A mobile court sitting in Benin has convicted 39 people for operating tricycles and motorcycles without rider's permit.
pcm: One mobile court wey dey sit for inside Benin don convict 39 pipo say dem dey operate tricycle and motorcycle and dem no get permit.

en: The prosecutor, Mrs P O. Ovbiagele, had told the court that the 39 people were apprehended within Benin-Agbor road axis, riding their bikes and tricycles without permit.
pcm: Di prosecutor, Mrs P O. Ovbiagele don tell di court say dem catch di 39 pipo around Benin-Agbor road side, wey dem dey ride bike and tricycle without permit.

en: According to Ovbiagele, the offence is punishable under section 9(4) and 27 of the Second Schedule of the Edo Traffic Control and Management Agency Law, 2010.
pcm: According to Ovbiagele, di offence get punishment under section 9(4) and 27 of di second SChedule of di Edo Traffic Control and Management Agency Law, 2010.

en: The accused persons pleaded guilty to the offence and asked for leniency.
pcm: Di pesin dem wey dem accuse beg say dem dey guilty and make dem dey soft wit dem.

en: The Chief Magistrate, Mutairu Oare, thereafter, convicted the 39 persons and ordered them to pay N5,000 fine each, and obtain the rider's permit within 24 hours.
pcm: Di chief Magistatrate, Mutairu Oare, thereafta, convict di 39 persons dem and he order dem say make dem pay N5,000 fine per person, and make dem go get di rider permit withing 24 hours.

en: According to him, if they fail to obtain the permit, parking fees of N1,000 would be charged on their impounded bikes and tricycles on a daily basis.
pcm: According to am, if dem no gree get di permit, dem go charge parking fee of N1,00 on top di bike and tricycle dem wey dem impound on daily basis.

en: Oare also said that after six weeks of non-compliance, the tricycles and bike would be forfeited to the state government.
pcm: Oare be also tok say six week dem and dem no comply, dem go forfeit di tricycle and bike to di state goment.

en: Gunmen kill traditional ruler, 3 others in Benue
pcm: Gunmen dem don kill traditional ruler plus 3 oda pipo inside Benue

en: Gunmen on Wednesday killed a traditional ruler, Chief Hyacinth Ajon and three other people in separate incidents in two Local Government Area of Benue State.
pcm: Gunmen for Wednesday be kill traditional ruler, chief Hyacinth Ajon plus three oda pipo for separate incident inside two local goment area for Benue State.

en: The deceased traditional monarch was said to have been killed alongside one, Benjamin Anakula in Tse Zoola community of Makurdi LGA while two others whose names were not given were also killed in Guma area of the state.
pcm: Di traditional  monarch wey die say dem kill wit one person, Benjamin Anakula for Tse Zoola community of Makurdi LGA as dem take kill two oda pipo wey dem no give dem name for Guma area of di state.

en: Eldest man in the community, Aho Zoola, alleged that gunmen suspected to be herders attacked the villagers at about 2:00am, shot sporadically and killed the two people.
pcm: Person wey old pass for di community, Aho Zoola, allege say gunmen wey dem suspect say dem be herders attack di village around 2:00 am, dem dey shoot anyhow, and dem kill di two pipo.

en: according to the report of one of Governor Samuel Ortom's media aide, narrated that the attack on their rural abode came to them as a surprise because they never had any issues with herders.
pcm: According to report from one among media aide of Governor Samuel Ortom, im narrate say di attack dem do for dem rural abode na surprise for dem bikos dem no get any issue wit herder dem.

en: The media aide, Jimmin Geoffrey, had stated that the governor was returning from a burial in the area when he had a stop over to sympathise with the villagers who are already displaced from their homes and assured them that he would do everything possible to get security agencies to the area.
pcm: Di media aide wey be  Jimmin Geoffrey, don state say di governor be dey return from one burial inside di area when im stop by to take pity wit di villager dem wey no get place to stay again and e assure dem say e go do evritin wey dey possible to take bring security pipo to di area.

en: Similarly, the Chairman of Guma LGA, Caleb Aba, told newsmen in Makurdi by telephone that the two other people were killed on Wednesday in Mbayer-Yandev council ward of Guma.
pcm: Similarly, di chairman for inside Guma LGA, Caleb Aba, be tell newsman dem for inside Makurdi on to telefone say na Wednesday dem kill di two oda pipo for inside Mbayer-Yandev council ward of Guma.

en: Aba however fingered suspected herders behind the killings in his domain.
pcm: Aba however be point finger to herder wey im suspect behind di killin for im domain.

en: Dr Mahmud Tukur: Tribute to distinguished accomplishment
pcm: Dr Mahmud Tukur: Tribute to distinguished accomplishment

en: In the end, it is not the years in one's life that count, but the life in one's years Abraham Lincoln
pcm: For di end, no be year for pesin life count, but di life wey dey inside pesin years   Abraham Lincoln

en: The limited space available here is certainly not enough to describe the late Dr Mahmud Muhammad Tukur, a Nigerian politician and former Minister for Commerce and Industry during the administration of General  Muhammadu Buhari.
pcm: Di small space wey dey here no reach to describe di late Dr Mahmud Muhammad Tukur, politician for inside Nigeria and former minister on top commerce and industry matter  for di administration of General  Muhammadu Buhari.

en: Tukur, who belonged to a small clique of policy advocates in Northern Nigeria, died on April 9, 2021, at the age of 82 years.
pcm: Tukur wey follow among one small clique of policy advocates for Northern Nigeria, die for April 9, 2021, for 82 years old.

en: He has since been buried in Yola, Adamawa State.
pcm: Dem don bury since for Yola, inside Adamawa State.

en: Dr Tukur was the 1st indigenous Director of the Institute of Administration, Kongo, Zaria.
pcm: Dr Tukur na di 1st indigenous Director of di Institute of Administration, Kongo, Zaria.

en: He took the mantle from Prof. S.S. Richardson in 1967 until 1975 when he became the first Vice-Chancellor of the Bayero University Kano.
pcm: He kolekt di mantle from Prof. S.S. Richardson for 1967 go reach 1975 when im bekom first vice-chancellor of di Bayero University for Kano,

en: Now recall it was the late Sir Ahmadu Bello, the Sardauna of Sokoto, who upon attaining independence of Northern Nigeria, declared before Sir Garwin Westray Bell the last Governor-General in 1957 at the Lugard Hall Kaduna, that the commitment of training the manpower in the North, which according to him On them, we will rely on the attainment of improving the health, prosperity and happiness of our people without discrimination on grounds of tribe or creed of which Dr Tukur and a few distinguished others were the foundation recruits.
pcm: Now recall say na  late Sir Ahmadu Bello, di Sardauna of Sokoto, who when im attain independence of nothern Nigeria, declare for front of Sir Garwin Westray Bell wey be di last Governor-General for 1957, for di Lugard Hall inside Kaduna, say di commitment to train di manpower for di north, which according to dem, we go rely on top di attainment of improving di health, prosperity, hapines of awa pipo wey discrimination no ge dey on ground of tribe or creed of which Dr. Tukur and small oda nomba wey dey distinguished be di  pipo wey dem first recruit.

en: Some have said the journey of President Muhammadu Buhari into politics is incomplete without Tukur.
pcm: Some don tok di journet of Presido Muhammadu Buhari into politics no go complete without Tukur.

en: Yes, no doubt, the description of Tukur as being among the intellectual powerhouse of the president is true since his contemporaries included Mamman Daura, Liman Ciroma, Adamu Ciroma, and Hamza Rafindadi Zayyad.
pcm: Yes, doubt no de, di description wey dem give Tukur say im dey among di intellectual powerhouse na true since im na contemporary wit pipo like Mamman Daura, Liman Ciroma, Adamu Ciroma, and Hamza Rafindadi Zayyad.

en: Mahmud Tukur was a firm, tenacious and resolute man who led an impactful life, a man of deep conviction and inner strength, who served the North incorruptibly and enhanced the betterment of the country's democracy.
pcm: Mahmud Tukur be firm, tenacious and resolute man wey lead life wey get impact, man wey get deep conviction and inner streght, wey serve North without corruption and e enhance di betterment of democracy for di kontri.

en: Under his tutelage as Director, Institute of Administration, Zaria, he supervised and superintended the building of a crop of the intelligentsia in the North and was deeply committed with a strong sense of duty to the building of a Nigeria that is equitable.
pcm: Under am as Director, Institute of Administration, Zaria, im supervise and superintend di building of di intelligentsia fo North and e be dey deeply committed wit strong sense of duty to take build Nigeria wey dey equitable.

en: We can safely deduce then, that an entire genre of the past and current civil servants, private sector executives and political elites in the North passed through the hands of the late scholar who affected every facet of education and saw to the manpower upliftment of not only his the region but Nigeria at large.
pcm: E dey safe to deduce then, say entire genre of civil servants dem past and current, executives dem for private sector and political elite for di North be pass through di hand of di late scholar wet affect evri facet of education and see to di upliftment of manpower no be only for im region but for Nigeria in general.

en: President Muhammadu, in a tribute to Tukur, said Dr Mahmud Tukur's service to the nation will be remembered by generations.
pcm: President Muhammadu, for inside tribute to Tukur, tok say geberation dem go remember  Dr Mahmud Tukur service to di nation.

en: He had a passion for a prosperous, economically strong and united Nigeria.
pcm: E get passion for Nigeria wey go dey prosper, get strong economy and dey unite.

en: He was a proud nationalist.
pcm: Na proud nationalist e be.

en: Buhari recalled that as Minister of Trade in his first coming as military Head of State, Dr Tukur introduced a lot of schemes that revived the local industry, boosted exports and gave real meaning and effect to import substitution in regenerating the indigenous manufacturing sector of the economy.
pcm: Buhari remeber say as Minister of Trade for im first comin as Head of States, Dr Tukur be introduce plenty scheme wey revive di local industry, e boost export and give real meanin and effect to import substitution to regenerate di indigenous manufacturin secor for di economy.

en: He prayed to Almighty Allah to accept him in Aljannah Firdaus and give the family, friends, the Adamawa Emirate Council and the people of the state the strength to bear this great loss.
pcm: He pray give Almighty Allah to accept am for Aljannah Firdaus and give im family, friends, di Adamawa Emirate Council and di pipo for inside di state di strenght to bear di great loss.

en: Indeed Tukur's enviable position and competence increased his public profile in Nigeria.
pcm: Indeed, di enviable position and competence of Tukur be increase im public profile for Nigeria.

en: It indeed takes many good deeds to build a good reputation, therefore the contributions of Tukur in the development of the education sector during his stint at Bayero University and his tireless efforts in the peacebuilding process and socio-economic development of Northern Nigeria can never be forgotten.
pcm: Indeed e go take to do plenty good things to take build good perutation, therefore di contribution wey Tukur put to take develop di education sector durin im time for Bayero University and im tireless effort on top peacebuilding process and socio-economic development of Norther Nigeria no sometin wey dem fit forget.

en: Late Tukur, born in 1939 in Yola, Adamawa State, obtained his First Degree in International Affairs and Political Science at the University of Wales (where he was the recipient of the Elizabeth Morris Memorial Prize for graduating first in his class).
pcm: Late Tukur, wey dem born for 1939 inside Yola, Adamawa State, get im first degree for International Affairs and Political Science for di University of Wales  (wia im receive Elizabeth Morris Memorial Prize as im graduate first for im class).

en: He also obtained a Master's Degree in Public International Affairs at the University of Pittsburgh and a PhD. in Public Management at Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria, Kaduna.
pcm: He also obtain Master's Degree in Public International Affairs for di University of Pittsburgh and  PhD. in Public Management for Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria, Kaduna.

en: He also studied at Northwestern and Oxford Universities.
pcm: He also study for Northwestern and Oxford university dem.
