en: Phase one is to provide the basic amenities in bringing the herders back into a cluster.
pcm: Phase one na to provide di basic amenity dem to bring di herder dem back into cluster.

en: The economic benefits are that it will attract investors over the world.
pcm: Di economic benefit be say e go attract investor dem all ova di world.

en: It will bring the production of meat, which in turn provides revenue.
pcm: E go bring di production of meat, wey go later provide revenue.

en: It will open job opportunities for veterinary doctors, agricultural extension workers, companies that can come in to engage in milk, cheese and manure production, bio gas, bone processing, hide and skin processing, animal feed from the blood, in combination with other ingredients, then pasture production from farmers.
pcm: E go open job opportunity for veterinary doctor dem, agricultural extension worker dem, company wey fit kom dey do milk, cheese nd manure production, bio gas, bone processing, hide and skin processing, animal feed for di blood, to combine am wit oda ingredients, then pasture production from farmer dem.

en: Planned $250m funding for national carrier unsettles operators
pcm: Di $250m fundin wey dem plan for national acrrier dey unsetle operator dem

en: A projection by the federal government to raise $250 million for the proposed national carrier is raising questions among operators in the aviation industry, Daily Trust reports.
pcm: One projection by federal goment to raise $250 million for di national carrier wey dem propose don dey make operator dem dey ask question for inside di aviation industry, as Daily Trust report am.

en: According to a document released last week by the aviation ministry, the federal government expects private investors to raise $250m for the proposed carrier as it insisted the project would be delivered before 2023.
pcm: According to one document weu aviation ministry release last week, di federal goment expect make private investor dem raise $250m for di carrier wey dem dey propose as dem insist say dem go deliver di project before 2023 kom.

en: In the document which gives an update on the national carrier project and other sub-projects in the roadmap, the Ministry of Aviation explained that the project development phase has been completed.
pcm: For inside di document wey give update on top di national carrier project and oda sub-project inside di roadmap, di Ministry of Aviation explain say dem don complete di  project development phase.

en: The government explained that the next phase would be the placement of Request for Qualification (RFQ) in local and international media.
pcm: Di goment explain say di next phase go be di placement of Request for Qualification (RFQ) for local and international media.

en: $250m approximately is to be raised to start up the airline by private investors, the document stated.
pcm: $250m approximately na im private investor  go raise to take start up airline

en: But stakeholders  doubt the feasibility of the project, saying investors might be unwilling to put their money in such a venture.
pcm: But stakeholder doubt di feasibility of di project, dem tok say investor fit no get will to put dem money for such venture.

en: Rather, some of them called on the government to harvest the facilities of the airlines under its management to set up the national carrier.
pcm: Rather, some of dem call on di goment to harvest di facility of di airline under dem management to set up di national carrier.

en: The Managing Director, Flight and Logistics Solutions, Amos Akpan said it would be an uphill task for private investors to invest $250m in establishing a national airline.
pcm: Di Managing Director, Flight and Logistics Solution, Amos Akpan tok say e go be big task for private investor dem $250m to take establish national airline.

en: He attributed the difficulty to several factors such as return on investment (ROI), business environment, among others.
pcm: He attribute di difficulty to plenty oda factor like return on top investment (ROI), business environment, and oda dem.

en: He said, Positioning to attract investment is more critical now.
pcm: He tok say, to take position to attract investment dey more critical for now.

en: If the gestation of investment runs into the next government coming in 2023, will it affect the agreements established with this government?
pcm: If di gestation of investment run enter di next goment wey dey kom for 2023, shey e go affect di agreement wey dem don establish wit dis goment?

en: Nigerians still experience discriminatory aircraft leasing agreements and insurance programmes.
pcm: Nigerians dem still dey experience discriminatory aircraft leasing agreement and insurance program dem.

en: We are still trying to effect the implementation of no duty on aircraft spare parts.
pcm: We still dey try to effect di implementation of no duty on top aircraft spare part dem.

en: The forex regime is yet to accommodate airline operators.
pcm: Di forex regime neva accommodate airline operator dem.

en: Interlining and cooperation is still at the concept stage.
pcm: Interlining and cooperation still dey di  concept stage.

en: Let's fix the platform or foundation first before we can build or launch on it.
pcm: Make we fix di platform or foundation first before we go fit build or launch on top am.

en: In his remarks, aviation analyst and Head of Research Zenith Travel, Olumide Ohunayo, stated that there is no amount too small for a national carrier if there is high credibility and contact with lessors, aircraft manufacturers and other airlines.
pcm: For im remark, aviotion analyst and Head of Research Zenith Travel, Olumide Ohunayo, state say no amount too small for national carrier if high credibility dey and contact with lessors, aircraft manufacturers and oda airline dem.

en: Group Captain John Ojikutu (rtd), an aviation analyst, wondered what $250m would do for the project and the would-be investors.
pcm: Group captain John Ojikutu (rtd), wey be aviation analyst, wonder wetin $250m go do for di project and di would-be investor dem.

en: Private investors will include foreign and local; how much is $250m in a national carrier or how many aircraft would that buy?
pcm: Private investor dem go include foreign and local; how much be $250m for national carrier or how many aircraft dat one go buy?

en: How much would government investment of 10% be in the national carrier?
pcm: How much di goment investment of 10% go be inside nationa carrier?

en: If we want a national carrier let it be now
pcm: If we want national carrier make am now

en: or we better go for a flag carrier and the government take a rest from the journey it started in 1993 when the national carrier became a government airline.
pcm: or make we beta go for flag carrier and di goment go take rest from di journey wey im start for 1993 wen di national carrier bekom goment airline.

en: But another analyst, Mr. Chris Aligbe, said raising $250m for the project would not be difficult, noting that there are many investors who are willing to put in their money on the project.
pcm: But anoda analyst, Mr. Chris Aligbe, tok say to raise $250m for di project no go dey difficult, e note say many investor dem dey and dem dey will to put dem money on top di project.

en: According to him, the $250m would be more than enough to start off the project depending on the strategy being adopted.
pcm: According to am, di $250m go dey more than enough to start di project depending on di strategy wey dem dey adopt.

en: Almost 500 bags of onions looted from attacked Imo truck — Market leader
pcm: Almost 500 bags of onions na im dem tifitif for inside Imo Market oga-patapata truck wey dem attack.

en: Halilu Mohammed is the Secretary of Onions Dealers Association in Imo State.
pcm: Halilu Mohammed na im be di Secretary of di joinbodi of Onion dealer dem for Imo.

en: In this interview, he narrated how suspected members of the outlawed Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) attacked and confiscated two trucks transporting onions to the eastern part of the country.
pcm: For Inside dis tori, he yan how pipo wey dem suspect say dem be member of Indigenous Pipo of Biafra (IPOB) take attack and marsh-leg ontop two truck wey carry onion go east of di kontri.

en: Can you tell us how the incident happened?
pcm: You go fit yan us how di mata take hapun?

en: Well, there were two trucks conveying onions from Kano State.
pcm: Well, e get two trucks weykari onion from Kano State.

en: These people stopped the vehicles and seized the drivers and the vehicles and they later drove the vehicles to one side where they ransacked and sold all the onions before we could get the security agencies to get to the area.
pcm: Di pipo stop di moto, kom hold driver and di moto for hand, dem kom drive di moto go one corner wia dem dey rebag and dem sell di onions finish before security pipo rish di area.

en: Each bag of the onion costs at least N15,000 at market price but they sold each of the bags at N9,000.
pcm: One bag of onions be, e small patapata N15,000 for market but dem sell dem N9,000 for one bag.

en: Who are those people that carried out the attacked?
pcm: Na which pipo do di attack?

en: Of course they were Biafran militants (IPOB), who were marching with their flags.
pcm: Na Biafria Area-bois (IPOB), wey dey wakawaka wit dia flag.

en: They carried out the attack, looted the goods and sold each and every of the onions conveyed in the vehicle.
pcm: Dem attack, tif and sell all di market, all di onion wey dey inside di moto.

en: Where did they carry out the attack?
pcm: Na wia dem take do di attack?

en: The attack was carried out at the market where these vehicles were stopped and ransacked.
pcm: Na market dem do di attack, wey dem stop and tiftif for di moto.

en: They gave out a price and sold each bag of the onions at the price of N9,000 and went away with the money.
pcm: Dem tok price kom sell all di onion N9,000 for one bag and dem carry di moni japa.

en: Before security agencies arrived, they have already sold out all the onions in one vehicle.
pcm: Before security pipo come, dem don sell all di onion inside di moto finish.

en: It was after security agencies have arrived then we moved the other vehicle to a safer place so that they do not attack again and possibly go with the vehicle.
pcm: Na wen security pipo kom na im we shift di second moto go corner wey gbege nor dey, make dem nor attack again or carry d moto japa patapata.

en: Who owns the goods?
pcm: Who get di market?

en: The onions belonged to one Alhaji Bello who also owned the trucks conveying the onions loaded from Kano to Imo state.
pcm: Na Alhaji Bello get di onion plus di truck wey carry am from Kano to Imo state.

en: What is the estimated value of all the onions in each vehicle?
pcm: Wetin di onion wey dey inside di moto fit rish?

en: We have estimated each of the vehicles was conveying at least 470 bags of onions.
pcm: We don calcu say e small patapata one moto dey carry 470 bag of onion.

en: And each of the bag of onion is sold at a market price of N15,000.
pcm: And nah N15,000 dem dey sell one bag of onion for market.

en: What is the implication of this incident and what effect could it have on business in that area?
pcm: Wetin dis mata fit kos and how e fit take affect business for dat area?

en: The incident has already affected both the people in that area as well as those traders who engage in such businesses.
pcm: Di mata don affect pipo wey dey di area join wit pipo wey dey sell di market.

en: Now, people are already in fear, and those drivers have lost the peace of mind to convey onions to Imo state.
pcm: Now pipo don dey fear and dos drivers dem to get mind carry onion go Imo state.

en: Everyone is scared of the probable danger.
pcm: Evribodi dey fear di kasala.

en: We have so many vehicles on ground that refused to convey onions to Imo state.
pcm: We get moto ful ground wey nor greekari onion go Imo state.

en: What actions are you taking?
pcm: Na wetin una dey do?

en: Well, we are keeping in touch with our leaders, our traditional rulers and government to look into the situation for appropriate action.
pcm: We dey follow we oga dem dey talk, we traditional rulers dem wit goment say make dem touch line di mata to do somtin put.

en: How are northerners in the eastern part coping with the unrest in these areas?
pcm: How North-pipo wey dey east take dey, wit dis kasala for dat area?

en: Now everything seems to be normal.
pcm: E be like say evrithing  don normal.

en: The tension is subsiding unlike when the incident happened.
pcm: Di garagara don go down, e nor be like wen di mata take hapun.

en: Gunmen kill pregnant woman, abduct lawmaker in Nasarawa
pcm: Jaguda-pipo kill one women wey get belle, kidnap lawmaker.

en: Gunmen have reportedly killed a pregnant woman in an attack on Abebe village in Keana Local Government Area of Nasarawa State.
pcm: Jaguda-pipo na im dem tok say dem kill one women wey get belle for inside one attack for Abebe village, for Keana Local goment  Area, inside Nasarawa State.

en: It was gathered that the incident happened in the early hours of Saturday when the assailants stormed the village with sophisticated weapons and shot sporadically, causing pandemonium as residents scampered for safety.
pcm: Dem say di mata hapun early momo on Saturday, wey di jaguda enta di village wit bigbig weapon, kom dey shoot shoot, wey kom  kos gbege as di village-pipo dey run for dia life.

en: The President, Tiv Development Association, Comrade Peter Ahemba, who confirmed the incident, alleged that the attacks and killing of Tiv people of Nasarawa State in the last two months was targeted at chasing them out of the state.
pcm: President of Tiv Development Association, Comrade Peter Ahemba, wey konfam di mata, tok say di attack and as dem dey kill Tiv pipo for Nasarawa na to chase dem comot for di state.

en: In another incident, gunmen have reportedly abducted a member of the Nasarawa State House of Assembly, Mr. Ismail Danbaba, his driver and two other persons.
pcm: For inside anoda mata, jaguda pipo don kidnap one member of Nasarawa State House of Assembly, Mr. Ismail Danbaba wit in driver and anoda two pipo.

en: It was gathered that Danbaba, who represents Nasarawa Central constituency in the State Assembly, and three others, were abducted on Saturday evening while travelling to Jos, Plateau State capital for a workshop.
pcm: E hapun say Danbaba wey dey represent Nasarawa Central constituency for di State Assembly, and anoda three pipo na im dem kidnap for Saturday evenin as dem dey travel go Jos, di capital of Plateau for one workshop.

en: A member of the states parliament, Mr. Mohammed Omadefu, who confirmed the incident in Lafia, said the incident happened along Akwanga/Jos road, close to a forest in Sanga Local Government Area of Kaduna State.
pcm: One member of di assembly pipo Mr. Mohammed Omadefu wey Konfam di mata say na Akwanga/Jos road, wey near Sanga Local goment  Area for Kaduna State di mata take hapun.

en: Omadefu told our correspondent that the abductors had contacted the states House of Assembly but were yet to make any demand.
pcm: Omadefu tell awa  news pipo say di kidnappa don follow di assembly pipo talk, but dem neva tok wetin dem go kolet.

en: When contacted, the Police Public Relation Officer, Nasarawa State Command, ASP Rahman Nansel, said since the incident didnt happen in Nasarawa State, he would not comment on that.
pcm: Wen dem ask di tori, di Public Relation Officer for di police command, Nasarawa State, ASP Rahman Nansel yan say as di mata nor take hapun for Nassarawa, e no go shuk mouth.

en: Please contact the Police Public Relation Officer in Kaduna State.
pcm: Abeg follow di Public Relation Officer for Kaduna talk.

en: Nasarawa State Command is not aware of any such incident, he said.
pcm: E tok say Nasarawa State Command nor hear about di mata.

en: Cement scarcity: Dangote to revive Gboko plant
pcm: Cement wey cost; Dangote wan raise Gboko plant up.

en: The management of Dangote Cement is set to improve cement availability in the market as it plans to revive its Gboko plant which shut down over four years ago.
pcm: Di management of Dangote Cement don redi to make cement plenty more more for market as dem wan raise Gboko plant up, wey stop to dey work four years ago.

en: The Group Sales and Marketing Director (GSMD) of Dangote Cement, Rabiu Umar, stated this Thursday in Kano while interacting with building industry professionals.
pcm: Di Group Sales and Marketing Director (GSMD) of Dangote Cement, Rabi Umar na im tok dis one on Thursday wen e dey follow professional dem for building industry dey yan.

en: The company has been up and doing to ensure an effective restoration of cement supply across the states.
pcm: The company don wake and dey work to make cement plenty yafuyafu across di state dem.

en: Dangote Cement will soon inject 2000 trucks into the cement supply chain as well as the revival of the Gboko plant and extension of a production plant line.
pcm: Dangote wan add 2000 trucks put wetin dem dey supply as dem wan raise Gboko Plant and add put wetin dem dey produce.

en: The Registrar, Council for the Regulation of Engineering in Nigeria (COREN), Prof. Joseph Odigwe, told the participants that Nigerias cement industry has been producing cement that is of international standard.
pcm: Di Oga patatata for Council for di Regulation of Engineering in Nigeria (COREN), Prof. Joseph Odigwe tell pipo wey folo say Nigeria Cement industry dey produce cement weyrish international standard.

en: Engr. Aliyu Aliyu, said Dangote cement has gained the confidence of cement users in the country, adding that there is a need for brand specification to allow its effective use.
pcm: Engr. Aliyu Aliyu, tok say Dangote cement don gain di mind of pipo for di contri, he add say  brand specification go good so dat pipo go fit dey use am wella

en: 3 names disappear from U.S. Intel Report on Khashoggi after initial release – Reports
pcm: 3 name disappear comot for U.S. Intel report ontop Khashoggi after Report wey dem first give ontop release.

en: The U.S. intelligence community has replaced its long-awaited report on the murder of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi, with another version that no longer includes the names of three men initially considered as complicit, CNN reported on Monday.
pcm: Di U.S. Intelligence community onto di report wey dem dey wait since don carry anoda version of report wey no carry di name of three men replace d beforebefore ontop di kill wey dem kill Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi. CNN yan on monday say; E don dey dey one kain.

en: On Friday, the U.S. intelligence community declassified a report saying that the Saudi crown prince had approved the operation that killed Khashoggi in 2018.
pcm: On Friday, di U.S. intelligence community drag one report comot, dem say di Saudi crown prince don approve di operation wey kill Khashoggi in 2018.

en: Later that day, the U.S. Treasury announced sanctions against former deputy head of Saudi intelligence, Ahmed al-Asiri, and the crown princes personal protective detail.
pcm: Later dat day, di U.S. Treasury announce punishment give di former deputy head of Saudi intelligence, Ahmed al-Asiri, and di personal protective detail of di crown prince.

en: Saudi Arabia, in turn, has strongly refuted the information about the alleged role of the kingdoms leadership in the incident, adding that the kingdom had already convicted and sentenced those responsible for the killing.
pcm: Saudi Arabia, don yan back say di information wey say di kingdom leadership get hand for di mata na lie, dem add say di kingdom don send pipo we wey get hand for di mata go prison.

en: According to the broadcaster, the three men, whose names were removed from the report, participated in, ordered, or were otherwise complicit in or responsible for the death of Jamal Khashoggi.
pcm: As news pipo take yan am, di three men wey dem comot dia name for di report sabi somtin or get hand for di death of Jamal Khashoggi.

en: The first name is Abdulla Mohammed Alhoeriny, who is the brother of General Abdulaziz bin Mohammed al-Howraini and heads the Presidency of State Security, the broadcaster reported, citing a person familiar with the inner workings of Saudi intelligence.
pcm: The first name na Abdulla Mohammed Alhoeriny, wey be di broda of General Abdulaziz bin Mohammed al-Howraini wey still be oga for Security for di State, as di news pipo take tok, dem still tok persin wey sabi how Saudi Intelligence dem take dey work.

en: Abdulla is named in Saudi reports as the assistant chief of state security for counterterrorism.
pcm: Dem mesion Abdulla name join di tori as pesin wey dey assist di Oga patapata of state security ontop counterterrorism.

en: The two other names that subsequently disappeared are Yasir Khalid Alsalem and Ibrahim al-Salim, CNN said, adding it was not clear who they were.
pcm: The two oda name wey later disappear comot be Yasir Khalid Alsalem and Ibrahim al-Salim, CNN yan say, who dem be no dey clear.

en: The Office of the Director of National Intelligence declined to clarify to the broadcaster why the names were initially included in the report, while a senior U.S. administration official said on Friday before the change was noticed that there was no new information in the report.
pcm: The Office of di Director of National Intelligence declined to clarify to di broadcaster why di names were initially included in di report, while a senior U.S. administration official said on Friday before di change was noticed dat there was no new information in di report.

en: We put a revised document on the website because the original one erroneously contained three names which should not have been included, an ODNI spokesperson told CNN.
pcm: We comot di document wey dey website becos di one wey dey before do mistake carry three names wey nor suppose dey. One ODNI spokespersin na im yan CNN like that.

en: Khashoggi went missing in 2018 after entering the Saudi consulate in Istanbul.
pcm: Khahoggi miss in 2018 after im enter Saudi travel house for Istanbul.

en: Riyadh initially denied any knowledge of Khashoggis whereabouts but eventually admitted that he had been killed inside the diplomatic mission.
pcm: Riyadh first tok say im nor sabi anytin about wia Khashoggi dey but kom later gree say na kill dem kill am for inside on mission we dey diplomatic.

en: The Saudi government sentenced several people over their role in Khashoggis murder and has repeatedly denied allegations that members of the royal family were involved in the incident.
pcm: Saudi goment send many pipo go gbaga ontop kill wey dem kill Khashoggi as dem deny allegations say member of di royal family get hand for di mata.

en: The position of Saudi Arabia has already been supported by a number of Arab states, including the United Arab Emirates, Bahrain and Kuwait, as well as by the Arab League.(Sputnik/NAN)
pcm: Wetin Saudi Arabia tok don dey support by a many kontri for Arab, plus United Arab Emirates, Bahrain and Kuwait, wit Arab League join.

en: Reasons wheat price will remain high
pcm: Reason why wheat still dey cost.

en: For decades, the wheat story in Nigeria has not been positive despite various federal government pronouncements and task forces set up to scale up wheat production.
pcm: For uncountable years, di tori of wheat for Nigeria dey dey well even as federal goment and task force take tok say take add join wheat wey dem dey produce.

en: The challenge forced many wheat farmers to direct their energy more towards rice which enjoys favourable policies and funding.
pcm: Di shallenge now don force many farmers wey dey plant wheat carry dia power go dey plant rice wey dey enjoy funding and policies wey sweat body.

en: The local demand for wheat has grown to over 6 million tonnes (MTs) in 2021 due to a growing population estimated at over 200 million.
pcm: Wheat wey dem dey demand for we domot don rish over 6 million tonnes (MTs) as we take dey plenty more more wey dem estimate say na over 200 million.

en: For instance, the demand by flour millers is estimated at 5.1 MTs, while other users outside the processors use about 1m MTs.
pcm: For example, di demand of pipo wey dey do flour dey na like 5.1 MTs while odas wey still dey use am dey use about 1m MTs.

en: The current rice production according to an estimate from the Wheat Farmers Association of Nigeria (WFAN) is about 420,000 MTs, with production estimated to reach over 600,000 MTs when harvest begins in the next two months.
pcm: Di rice wey dem dey produce now as Wheat Farmers Association of Nigeria (WFAN) take estimate am na 420,000 MTs, and e go climb rish 600,000 MTs wen dem start to dey plug rice next two months.

en: Few months ago, the price of wheat hit N32, 000 per 100kg bag, forcing prices of flour and other household consumables like bread to go up.
pcm: Few month ago, di price of wheat rish N32,000 for one 100kg bag wey force flour and wetin dem dey carry am do like bread put money.

en: Domestic production of wheat is moving at a very slow pace because there are many issues that make it be on a declining trajectory since 2018.
pcm: As dem take dey produce wheat dey waka slow because e get one wahala wey dey am drag am since 2018.

en: ABP not rolling
pcm: ABP not role.

en: Since 2018, wheat farmers stopped benefitting from the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN)
pcm: Since 2018, farmer wey dem plant wheat, dem nor enjoy wetin Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) dey give dem again

en: Anchor Borrower Programme (ABP) after accessing about N2.3 billion that year.
pcm: Anchor Borrower Programme (ABP) after dem enjoy about N2.3 billion dat year.

en: This year, about 285,000 farmers have been validated by the CBN, but their issue with their financial institution over the 2018 poor loan recovery rate, which was about 40 percent, is counting against them.
pcm: This year about 285,000 farmers na im CBN done put hand but di moni palava wey show face as dem dey recover moni wey dem borrow for 2018, wey be about 40 percent, nor help mata.

en: The President of WFAN, Alhaji Salim Mohammed Sale, told Daily Trust that they were not participating in the ABP despite having about 285,000 farmers cleared and qualified for it.
pcm: The President of WFAN, Alhaji Salim Mohammed Sale, tell Daily Trust say dem no gree put dem for ABP even as dem get about 285,000 farmers wey dem don put hand and dey qualify.

en: Alhaji Sale said because of the poor recovery rate, the first participating financial institution withdrew from them and that their attempt to change to another bank was not accepted by CBN.
pcm: Alhaji Sale tok say as dem take dey recover take dey poor, first participating financial institution witidrewcomeot hand for mata and CBN nor gree make dem shange to anoda bank.

en: The same thing happened in 2019 when 11,000 farmers were cleared but did not access the fund because of the 2018 recovery rate.
pcm: Na di same hapun for 2019 wia dem don put hand for 11,000 farmers but dem not fit kolet di fund bicos of di recover of 2018.

en: Alhaji Sale further said, This year we engaged 285,000 farmers and CBN has validated the list.
pcm: Alhaji Sale still tok say, dis year dem engage 285,000 farmer dem and CBN don put hand for di list.

en: After speaking with Unity Bank, they said they were not interested in working with us, so we moved to Keystone Bank.
pcm: Afta we follow Unity Bank talk, dem say dem nor wan follow us work, we kom waka go Keystone Bank.

en: After meeting all the requirements necessary, Keystone wrote a letter looking for the cash backing of the programme, but there were challenges because we have one exposure which we were unable to pay…
pcm: Afta we don meet evri requirement, Keystone write letter to kolet moni for di programme, but some kain palava dey because e get one gbese wey we nor get moni pay for.

en: So we were told to go back to Unity Bank where we have the exposure.
pcm: So dem say make we waka go Unity Bank wia we get di gbese.

en: However, we highlighted three or four points; that they should continue with the programme with us so that one, we will have sustainability in wheat production; two, defaulting farmers are not the ones to be engaged in the programme so that it will serve as a lesson to them and it will encourage them to pay back and rejoin; three, we will have learnt from our past experiences in recovery and come up with something more effective in the recovery system; and four, deployment of mechanisation that will make the programme sustainable.
pcm: We draw out like three or four point say make dem continue di programme wit us so dat one; We go fit produce wheat wella; two, nor be di farmer wey march law dey go di programme so e go teach dem lesson and go make dem pay backcome join again; three, we go don learn from wetin don happun and we go bring something wey beta to take dey recover; four, to bring katapila wey go make di programme get head.

en: He pointed out that the best way was not to stop the programme completely, but to evolve other ways that would improve recovery, adding that not all rice, maize and cotton farmers paid all their loans, but that the programme still continued for those crops.
pcm: He tok di best way nor be to stop di programme patapata but to luk as dom fit take improve recovery, e add say nor be all farmer wey dey plant rice, maize and cotton pay all their gbese but programme still continue for dem.

en: He said this was going to affect wheat production, noting that even with the ABP, many farmers were still not willing to go into its production.
pcm: E tok say dis go affect to dy produce wheat, tok say, as di ABP take dey, plenti farmer no go still wan go into production

en: Alhaji Sale explained that, It was the association that brought courage for farmers to go into production because of the agreement between them and the offtakers.
pcm: Alhaji Sale tok say,na di joinbodi dey give farmers mind go plant becos of di agreement wey dem get wit pipo wey dey buy.

en: You cannot grow something that you do not have a market for.
pcm: You nor fit plant somtin wey u nor go fit sell.

en: We tried and created the market between us and the millers.
pcm: We try make market dey between we anddimillers.

en: Even individuals in wheat farming come through the association to sell the product to the milling plants; and they find it very easy.
pcm: Even each persin deycome tru di joinbodicome sell dia market to milling plants and dem dey find am easy.

en: Now that they are not in the programme, the farmers find it very difficult to sell the product in the market.
pcm: Now we di programme nor dey, di farmer dey find am hard to sell their market inside di market.

en: Two, there is insufficiency already in the subsector of wheat.
pcm: Two, E norish don dey for subsector of wheat.

en: The only way you can reduce that and cut down the import bill we are paying is by engaging multiple farmers to produce.
pcm: Di only way wey you fit take cut import moni wey we dey pay down na to tok to plenty farmer make dem produce.

en: Seeds looted in Jos
pcm: Seed wey dem tif for Jos

en: Daily Trust gathered from reliable sources at the Federal Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development that during the #EndSARS protest, about 3,600 bags of improved wheat seeds were looted.
pcm: Daily Trust gather from reliable sources for di Federal Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development say during di #EndSARS protest about 3,600 bags of wheat seed wey don dey improve nah im dem tif.

en: The grains were stored in Jos, the Plateau State capital, because of its conducive weather.
pcm: Na for Jos di capital of plateau dem put di food because di weather march am for bodi.

en: Since the looting, no farmer has received any assistance in terms of cash and planting materials.
pcm: Since dis tiftif mata, nor farmer don see any assistance collect whether cash of material to take plant.

en: Despite insufficient certified seeds, some farmers get seeds through the community seed production system whereby each farmer saves seeds against the following production season.
pcm: Even as seed nor deyrish, some farmers dem dey get seed tru di community seed production system wia farmers go save seed to take plant d following season.

en: There should be stability in food prices – CEO, Titan Farms
pcm: Price of food suppose dey one place CEO, Titan Farms.

en: Following the skyrocketing inflation in the country, an Ibadan-based rice farmer and the Chief Executive Officer of Titan Farms, Engr Gbenga Eyiolawi, has urged government at all levels to ensure price stability in food items across the country.
pcm: As tins take cost fot di kontri, one Rice farmer wey base for Ibadan and di Chief Executive Officer of Titan Farms, Engr Gbenga Eyiolawi, don beg goment fordilevel say make dem try make price of food dey one place for di kontri.

en: Eyiolawi said instability in the prices of food items has serious effects on the budget and expenditure of families and households, urging government at all levels to be more responsible and responsive to their responsibilities.
pcm: Eyiolawi yan say as price of food nor take dey one place, e dey koba plan and budget of family as e dey beg goment for all level make dey more responsible, make dem dey amswer put for di thing wey nor beta.

en: Speaking during the launch of Titan Farms City, an affiliate of Titan Farms, a combination of real estate and agriculture, he said his company would ensure an all-year-round supply of food items in affordable prices.
pcm: E dey yan durin for di time wey dem dey launch Titan Farm City, we joinbodi wit Titan Farms, wekari estate and agriculture togeda, he yan say imcomepany for see say dem supply food year round and for price wey rukuruku.

en: Titan Farms City, which is a marriage between real estate and agriculture, is where we cultivate, instead of just processing.
pcm: Titan Farm City wey join join real estate and agriculture na wia  we dey plant instead of only to process.

en: At present, we only process.
pcm: As e dey now, na only process we dey dey do.

en: Of course, we want to ensure an all-year-round supply; so, all our produce are to be processed right here, he said.
pcm: Na so, we wan ensure di supply of food year round; so nor all are food go dey process for here.

en: On how to address the rising cost of food items, he said, We cannot give an immediate solution to the challenge, but we can do a projection of what would be a solution in the nearest future.
pcm: On top how to tackle food wey dey cost, he tok say, we nor fit bring kiakia solution, but we fit do wetin for be solution for near future.

en: That is why we have the Titan Farm City to ensure that there is enough availability of stock and raw materials for processing, and to ensure uniformity of prices over a period of time.
pcm: Na why we get Titan Farm City to see say market and raw material for processin dey yafuyafu, make dem still see say price dey di same for many time.

en: We are working and collaborating with existing farmers.
pcm: We dey work and we dey do collabo wit farmer wey don dey before.

en: At present, we have 52 farms that have signed agreements with us to help them process their harvests.
pcm: As e dey, we get wey do put hand for paper wit us to help dem process their havest dem.

en: Gunmen attack bullion van, cart away undisclosed amount of money
pcm: Jaguda pipo attack bullion van,kari moni wey dem nor tok di amount go.

en: Two people are feared killed after armed men attacked a bank bullion van at Elemosho Village along Akure-Ondo Expressway in Ondo East Local Government Area of Ondo on Thursday evening.
pcm: Two pipo die after jaguda pipo attack bullion van of one bank for Elemosho Village along Akure-Ondo Expreeway for Ondo East Local goment  Area inside Ondo on Thursday evening.

en: Witnesses said the robbers came in a Lexus car, waylaid and attacked the bullion van headed toward Akure around 5pm and made away with an undisclosed amount of money.
pcm: Witiness dem yan say di jaguda pipo carry Lexus come, stop and attack dis bullion van wey dey go Akure around dat kain 5pm and demkari moni wey dem nor tok di amount go.

en: Three people were shot in the operation, which last minutes before the gunmen ran into the bush, witnesses said.
pcm: Witiness dem tok say; Dem shot three pipo for inside di operation wey take some minutes before di jaguda run enta bush.

en: One of the victims was alive while it was not sure whether the other two survived it, a witness said.
pcm: One ofdiwitiness tok say one of di victim dey alive but im nor dey sure whether di other two dey alive.

en: Residents also fled into the bush in the wake of the sporadic shooting.
pcm: Pipo wey dey live there run enta bush as shoot shoot dey plenti more.

en: Two of three vehicles in a convoy were riddled with bullets in the attack.
pcm: Bullet enta inside two for inside di three moto wey join-waka.

en: The eyewitness added that the men of the Ondo State Security Network Agency, Amotekun, were invited to the scene and took one victims to the hospital.
pcm: Pesin wey see am korokoro tok join say dem call Ondo State Security Network Agency pipo Amotekuncome there and demkari di victim go hospital.

en: Commander of the Amotekun, Adetunji Adeleye, confirmed the incident.
pcm: Kommander of di Amotekun, Adetunji Adeleye, say trutru di mata hapun.

en: When we got the information, my men moved in there and met one of the persons that were shot at the scene and we have taken him to the hospital.
pcm: Wen me hear di tori, my men enta dia and dem see one pesin wey dem shoot for di place and wekari am go hospital.

en: There has been no casualty, he added.
pcm: E add join say; nor one die.

en: Similarly, the state Police Public Relations Officer, Mr Tee-Leo Ikoro said the robbers had ran away before police arrived the scene.
pcm: Like so,di,distate Police Public Relations Officer, Mr Tee-Leo Ikoro tok say di jaguda pipo don tear race befor police enta di place.

en: He said the command had commenced investigation into the incident and the detectives from the command had been on the trail of the robbers.
pcm: E say dicomemand do begin dey touchline di mata and di touchline pipo from dicomemand don dey follow di jaguda pipo for leg.

en: First UAE ambassador to Israel takes up post
pcm: First UAE ambassador to Israel kolet post.

en: Israels president on Monday formally received the first-ever ambassador from the United Arab Emirates to the Jewish state, following last years historic agreement between the countries to normalise ties.
pcm: The president  of Isreal on Monday, koletdifirst-for dis life ambassador from di United Arab Emirates to di Jewish state follow di historical agreement for di two countries to make thingscome normal.

en: UAE envoy, Mohamed Al Khaja, who arrived in Israel earlier Monday, delivered his credentials to Israeli President, Reuven Rivlin, at a ceremony in Jerusalem.
pcm: UAE envoy, Mohamed Al Khaja, weyrish Israel early momo on Monday,kari im credential give prasido of Reuven Rivlin, for one ceremony for Jerusalem.

en: After greeting Khaja in Arabic, Rivlin said: The entire Israeli people welcome you with joy.
pcm: After imkari Arabic salute Khaja, Rivlin say: All Israeli pipo welkom you wit joy.

en: This will be your most important mission – to welcome the hands reaching out to you… treaties are signed by leaders, but real, sustained peace is made between peoples, face to face, the president said.
pcm: Na dis ko be di koko of your mission na, to welkom di hand wey deyrish you, di president  yan say na leaders dem sign we gree we gree but di big peacecome from di pipo, face to face.

en: Khaja said he would work tirelessly to strengthen the political ties between our two countries, in the service of our peoples and regional stability.
pcm: Khaja say im gokari body work to put power join di tie wey in dem, to take serve di pipo and to put power join dia region.

en: The UAE was the first country to agree to establish full diplomatic relations with the Jewish state under the Abraham Accords, a pact brokered by former US President Donald Trump.
pcm: Na UAE first gree to start full rapor wit dis Jewish state under di Abraham Accords, a pact brokered by former US president  Donald Trump.

en: The agreement made the UAE only the third majority Arab nation to form official ties with Israel, following Egypt in 1979 and Jordan in 1994.
pcm: Di we-gree-we-gree make UAE be di third plenti Arab nation to rob hand wit Isreal, follow Egypt for 1979 and Jordan for 1994.

en: Bahrain, Morocco and Sudan have subsequently joined the Abraham Accords.
pcm: Bahrain, Morocco and Sudan don join di Abraham Accords now.

en: The agreements broke with a longstanding Arab consensus that there should be no normalisation with Israel until it reaches a comprehensive peace deal with the Palestinians.
pcm: Dis we-gree break di long Arab consensus wey say nor make we-gree nor dey for any Arab wit Isreal until dem go do ogbonge peace tok wit di Palestinians.

en: Earlier Monday, Khaja met Foreign Minister Gabi Ashkenazi in Jerusalem, who wished him success in his historic mission.
pcm: Earlimomo on Monday, Khaja meet Foreign Minister Gabi Ashkenazi for Jerusalem, wey wish am success in im mission wey make history.

en: Khaja told Ashkenazi he was very proud and honoured to be the first Emirati ambassador to the State of Israel.
pcm: Khaja tell Ashkenazi say im dey very proud to be di first ambassador di di State of Israel.

en: Israel opened its UAE embassy in January, with veteran diplomat Eitan Naeh heading the Abu Dhabi mission.
pcm: Israel open im UAE embassy for January, as  sabi man Eitan Naeh take head dis Abu Dhabi mission.

en: Israel and the UAE have already signed treaties on direct flights and visa-free travel, along with accords on investment protection, science and technology.
pcm: Isreal and UAE don sign we-gree on direct waka and visa-free travel wit oda na we-we on investment protection, science and technology.

en: On Tuesday, Khaja was scheduled to visit Yad Vashem, Israels national Holocaust memorial and education centre.(AFP)
pcm: On Tuesday, Khaja don dey plan to visit Yad Vashem, Israels national Holocaust memorial and education centre.(AFP)

en: US Congress certifies Joe Bidens election win
pcm: US Congress confam Joe Biden election win.

en: The US Congress, on Thursday, certified Joe Biden as the next US president, dealing a blow to Donald Trump, whose supporters stormed the Capitol hours earlier, triggering unprecedented chaos and violence in the seat of American democracy.
pcm: The US Congress, on Thursday, don confm Joe Biden as di next US president , wey slap Donald Trump wey im supporters burst entadicapitol earli momo, and dey cause kasala and gbege for inside dat place wey America democracy sitdown put.

en: Lawmakers in the Senate and House of Representatives successfully beat back Republican efforts to deny Biden the electoral votes from swing states Arizona and Pennsylvania.
pcm: Lawmaker Senate and House of Representatives now do push backdieffort of di Republican to deny di pipo votes from swing states Arizona and Pennsylvania.

en: After a mob breached the US Capitol and sent lawmakers scrambling for safety, members of Congress returned shaken but undeterred to fulfill their duty in certifying Bidens 306-232 Electoral College win.
pcm: Afta angri pipo burst enta di US Capitol to send lawmakers as dem sef run for dia lives dis member of Congress don go back to do dia job as dem comefam Biden win of 306-232 for Electoral College.

en: Lawmakers voted down the two challenges to Bidens victory, with several Trump loyalists reversing course in the wake of the violence that drew shock around the world.
pcm: Lawmakers do votecomeot di two tackle wey dey Biden winin, as Trump supporter demcome spoil mata wit violence wey surprise pipo dem for di around di world.

en: Egged on in an extraordinary rally across town by an aggrieved Trump, a flag-waving mob broke down barricades outside the Capitol and swarmed inside, rampaging through offices and onto the usually solemn legislative floors.
pcm: Rally start for all di town by Trump supporter dem, pipo wey dey vex wey stillkari flag dey wave break break barricade wey dey outside ti Capitol and dey enta inside beging dey scatascata offices and were lawmakers dey sitdown put.

en: Security forces fired tear gas in a four-hour operation to clear the Capitol.
pcm: Security pipo shootshoot teargas inside dis four hours gbege to clearclear di Capital.

en: Police said that one woman, reportedly a female Trump partisan from southern California, was shot and killed and that three other people died in the area in circumstances that were unclear.
pcm: Police yan say, one woman wey dem tok say na Trump supporter from southern California n aim dem shoot die and  anoda three pipo still die for inside wetin nor dey clear for eye.

en: Red-hot Iheanacho, Onuachu, Osimhen make Super Eagles list for Cameroon friendly
pcm: Iheanacho wey dey hot, Onuachu, Osimhen enta Super Eagles list for Cameroon friendly.

en: Technical Adviser of Nigerias
pcm: Technical Adviser fo Nigeria .

en: Senior National Football team, Gernot Rohr, has drawn up a provisional squad list of 31 players for the Super Eagles prestige international friendly game against five-time African champions Cameroon in Austria on Friday, 4th June 2021.
pcm: Football team of di senior, Gernot Rohr, don do squad list of 31 players for di Super big international friendly against five-time African champions Cameroon for Austria on Friday, 4th June 2021.

en: The game will take place at the Wiener Neustadt in the Austrian capital, Vienna starting from 8.30 pm Austria time.
pcm: Na Wiener Neustadt for di Austrian capital, Vienna start from 8.30 pm Austria time n aim di game go hapun

en: The duo of Kelechi Iheanacho (Leicester City, England), Victor Osimhen (Napoli, Italy) and Paul Onuachu (KRC Genk, Belgium), who are in top form for their respective clubs, top the list unveiled on Friday which also has Captain Ahmed Musa.
pcm: The joinbodi of Kelechi Iheanacho (Leicester City, England), Victor Osimhen (Napoli, Italy) and Paul Onuachu (KRC Genk, Belgium), wey dey fly for up for dia different club dem, dey up as dem take upon di list on Friday as e still get Captain Ahmed Musa join.

en: Other top players in the list are deputy captain William Ekong, goalkeeper Maduka Okoye, defenders Kenneth Omeruo and Chidozie Awaziem, midfielders Wilfred Ndidi and Oghenekaro Etebo and forward Samuel Chukwueze.
pcm: Oda big player dem for di list na deputy captain William Ekong, goalkeeper Maduka Okoye, defenders Kenneth Omeruo and Chidozie Awaziem, midfielders Wilfred Ndidi and Oghenekaro Etebo and forward Samuel Chukwueze.

en: Super Eagles youngsters, Victor Osimhen (L) and Samuel Chukuweze celebrate after winning bronze at the 2019 AFCON in Egypt.
pcm: Super Eagles small pikin dem, Victor Osimhen (L) and Samuel Chukuweze jubilate afta dem win bronze for di 2019 AFCON for Egypt.

en: Portugal-based Abraham Marcus is called for the first time and Enyimba FCs energetic forward Anayo Iwuala, whose tenacity and drive has helped the Peoples Elephant to the quarter-finals of the CAF Confederation Cup, has an opportunity to fight for a place and continue on his international footprints, following cameo appearances against the Benin Republic and Lesotho in AFCON qualifiers in March.
pcm: Abraham Marcus wey base for Portugal na im dem don call for di first time wit Enyimba iron body forward Anayo Iwuala wey im power don helpdiPipos Elephant qualify enta quarter-finals ofdiCAF Confederation Cup don get chance to drag space to continue dey leg for international as dem take show against Benin Republic and Lesotho inside AFCON qualifiers for March.

en: The provisional list of 31 will be whittled down to 23 before the Super Eagles fly to Vienna for the clash with perennial rivals Indomitable Lions.
pcm: Di big list of 31 na im dem go bring downrish 23 beforediSuper Eagles fly go Vienna for di battle wit teytey rivals Indomitable Lions.

en: Cameroon wrestled down the Eagles for three of their five AFCON titles (1984, 1988, 2000) but have not beaten Nigeria in regulation time since a 1-0 triumph in a 1990 FIFA World Cup qualifying match at the Stade Omnisports in Yaounde on 27th August 1989.
pcm: Cameroon march di Eagles thruway for three inside dia five AFCON title (1984, 1988, 2000) but dem never beat Nigeria for di Time gangan for match since dem win 1-0 for one 1990 FIFA World Cup qualifying match for di Stade Omnisports for Yaounde on 27th August 1989.

en: The Eagles lashed the Lions 4-0 in a 2018 FIFA World Cup qualifying match in Uyo in September 2017 and were forced to a 1-1 draw in the reverse fixture in Yaounde, setting the stage for Nigerias qualification for the finals in Russia.
pcm: Di Eagles flog di Lions 4-0 for one 2018 FIFA World Cup qualifying match for Uyo for September 2017 and deykari by force enta 1-1 draw for dicome back for Yaounde, wey make Nigeria qualify enta patapata for Russia.

en: Francis Uzoho (APOEL Nicosia, Cyprus); John Noble (Enyimba FC); Maduka Okoye (Sparta Rotterdam, The Netherlands); Ikechukwu Ezenwa (Heartland FC)
pcm: Francis Uzoho (APOEL Nicosia, Cyprus); John Noble (Enyimba FC); Maduka Okoye (Sparta Rotterdam,diNetherlands); Ikechukwu Ezenwa (Heartland FC)

pcm: Kenneth Omeruo (CD Leganes, Spain); Kevin Akpoguma (Hoffenheim, Germany); Chidozie Awaziem (FC Boavista, Portugal); William Ekong (Watford FC, England); Olaoluwa Aina (Fulham FC, England); Jamilu Collins (SC Padeborn 07, Germany); Zaidu Sanusi (FC Porto, Portugal); Tyronne Ebuehi (FC Twente,diNetherlands); Oluwasemilogo Ajayi (West Bromwich Albion, England)

en: Midfielders: Oghenekaro Etebo (Galatasaray FC, Turkey); Wilfred Ndidi (Leicester City, England); Abdullahi Shehu (Omonia Nicosa, Cyprus); Joseph Ayodele-Aribo (Glasgow Rangers, Scotland); Abraham Marcus (CD Feirense, Portugal)
pcm: Midfielders: Oghenekaro Etebo (Galatasaray FC, Turkey); Wilfred Ndidi (Leicester City, England); Abdullahi Shehu (Omonia Nicosa, Cyprus); Joseph Ayodele-Aribo (Glasgow Rangers, Scotland); Abraham Marcus (CD Feirense, Portugal)

pcm: Forwards: Ahmed Musa (Kano Pillars FC); Alex Iwobi (Everton FC, England); Sadiq Umar (Almeria FC, Spain); Samuel Chukwueze (Villarreal FC, Spain); Victor Osimhen (Napoli FC, Italy); Kelechi Iheanacho (Leicester City, England); Moses Simon (FC Nantes, France); Henry Onyekuru (Galatasaray FC, Turkey); Anayo Iwuala (Enyimba FC); Peter Olayinka (Slavia Praha, Czech Republic); Terem Moffi (FC Lorient, France); Paul Onuachu (KRC Genk, Belgium); Simy Nwankwo (Crotone FC, Italy)

en: Drawing Nigeria back from the brinks
pcm: E dey drag Nigeria comeot for up.

en: The worsening security challenges in the country seem to be getting out of hand.
pcm: Security mata wey don spoil for di contri don pass normal.

en: Many who have so far commented on the issue have painted pictures of hopelessness.
pcm: Pipo wey don tok on top di mata don tok say hope nor dey.

en: To say the least, it has reached a point of despair and as human beings, Nigerians are beginning to doubt if we can survive it and live together once again in a peaceful society.
pcm: To tok di wan wey small, e don shoke as persin, Nigeria pipo don dey doubt if we fit survive am and live togeda again as area wey get peace.

en: Prominent personalities in the country seem to have given up hope which has led to their conclusion that the only way out of the quagmire is for the federal government to seek foreign assistance to be able to tackle the security challenges.
pcm: Big big pipo inside di kontri n aim e be like say dem doncomeot mind wey make dem tok say di only way wey tocomet dia palava na for federal goment to find foreign assistance to fit tackle security kasala.

en: The main opposition political party in the country, the PDP, had also added voice in telling the All Progressives Congress, APC-led government at the centre that Nigeria needs external help to address the festering insecurity in the country.
pcm: Di opposition political parti inside di contri, PDP, join mouth put dey tell All Progressives Congress,APC we dey led say Nigeria need outside help to fit tackle security kasala wey don dis.

en: On his part, the immediate past President of the Senate, Bukola Saraki, said President Muhammadu Buhari is overwhelmed by the security challenges, insisting that the federal government needs urgent help and must seek such without wasting time.
pcm: As e dey tok im own, di president  of senate wey just pass, Bukola Saraki say president  Muhammadu Buhari don dey taya ontop di security kasala, he de tanda say federal goment need sharpsharp help and make dem find am wit out nor waste time.

en: He also advised the president to bring together all former presidents and heads of state, serving and former chief justices, serving and former presiding officers of the National Assembly, serving and former heads of security agencies, traditional rulers with relevant experience, leaders of the private sector, development partners, friends of Nigeria in the international community and all others who can help in finding solutions to the problem at hand.
pcm: He also advise  di president  say make ekari all beforebefore president  and heads of state, beforebefore and nownow chief justices, serving and oga dem for National Assembly, beforebefore and nownow oga dem for security agencies, traditional rulers dem wey get experience wey good, oga for private sector dem, development partners, friends of Nigeria for internationalcomemunity wit odas wey fit find solution for dimata wey dey ground.

en: The ex-senate leader further called on the National Assembly to be more assertive in finding solutions to this issue of insecurity adding that the legislature would not be helping the Buhari administration if they did not become more insistent and decisive in their approach to getting the security crisis tackled immediately.
pcm: Dis beforebefore Senate president  still call di National Assembly say make dem find solution to di issue of insecurity as im add say di legislature nor gep dey help dis Buhari administration if dem nor add to dia tanda and decision for dia approach to take see di security palava tackle kiakia.

en: The National Leader of the All Progressives Congress, APC, Sen. Bola Ahmed Tinubu, said that Nigeria needs unity to surmount the current security challenges, observing that every nation will go through difficult times and we must unite to succeed.
pcm: Di National Leader of di All Progressives Congress, APC, Sen. Bola Ahmed Tinubu, say Nigeria need joinhand to tackle di security shallenge,dey tok say evri contri go pass tru hard time and we must dey united to take succeed.

en: He added that no president wants a country in chaos, noting that only a concerted and united response will end the numerous security challenges.
pcm: He had put say nor president  wan make kontri dey inside palava, e note say na only join hand response fit end dis plenty security kasala.

en: The best way is what we are doing; coming together to reduce banditry, to move for unity and be able to bring a better Nigeria to the people.
pcm: Di best way na wetin we dey do. Tocome togeda take reduce banditry, to move for unity and fit to  bring a beta Nigeria give pipo.

en: The welfare of our people is extremely important.
pcm: The welfare of awa  pipo dey very important.

en: And yes, every nation will go through these curves and difficult times.
pcm: And yes, everi contri go pass di hard and difficult time.

en: How we communicate it to the people, what are the areas to help make it easier for people to bear; those are ideas on how to be able to change the leadership of the country, he explained.
pcm: How we take dey tell am to pipo, na which area to take make am easy for pipo; na dem dat area on top how to fit change di leader for di contri; na im he tok.

en: The truth, however, is that the situation is not yet too bad as is being projected by many stakeholders.
pcm: The truth be say, mata neva spoil too spoil as many stakeholders take dey show am.

en: All hopes are not yet lost.
pcm: Hope neva lost finish.

en: This is not to say that they are not right in their observations and recommendations.
pcm: Di one nor be say dem nor dey right for wetin dem see and wetin dem tok.

en: The situation can be salvaged through collaboration with all stakeholders especially the traditional rulers, religious leaders, synergy among security agencies and the ability of the federal government to provide a level-playing field devoid of ethnic, religious or political interests.
pcm: We fit savage dimata wit colabo wit all stakeholders especiallyditraditional rulers dem, religious leaders,joinjoin among security pipo and for federal goment to fit provide solution of tribe abi political interest.

en: Time has come when the role of traditional rulers in peace keeping must be recognised at all levels.
pcm: Time doncome again wey be saydiwork of tradional ruler to make peace must dey recognized for every corner.

en: They are the custodians of the peoples culture and to some extent, their religion.
pcm: Na dem get culture of di pipo fo hand and dia religion to one place.

en: Traditional rulers, because of their closeness to the people, can play a great role in solving the security challenges if properly mobilised and engaged at local government, state and federal levels.
pcm: Traditional rulers becos of say dem dey close to di pipo, fit do big tin to take solve di security gbege if dem gather and follow dem tok wella from local goment go statecomerish federal.

en: If the traditional rulers at various localities across the country are fully engaged, they can  be the major source of information to the security agencies in terms of identifying any criminal elements lurking around their domains because they know who is who in those areas.
pcm: If dem follow traditional ruler dem for every angle for di state yarn wella, dem fit be di koko of wia  secutity pipo go dey get information as to take know criminal tin wey dey dia area because dem sabi dem wey dey di area

en: There is also the need for security agencies to work together in the fight against insecurity in the land.
pcm: E dey needed for security agencies to work together as to take fight insecurity for di land.

en: There must be a uniting force among them so that at any point one agency must not be away from what the other is doing to avoid not only duplication of duty but also to be on the alert based on information passed across various formations.
pcm: To joinhand must dey among dem so dat one side gocomeot ahnd from wetin d other side dey do to avoid to dey two work and to shine eyes put information wey dem sendcome from every angle.

en: The ugly incident that took place in Maiduguri some days ago where a fighter jet belonging to Nigerian Air Force bombed soldiers going to repel Boko Haram attack is a clear indication of lack of proper information and coordination among the two agencies.
pcm: The bad mata hapun for Maiduguri some days ago as fighting jet we be dem Nigeria Airforce own take bomb Nigeria Soldiers wey dem go double cross boko haram na mata we open say beta information and coordination between two agencies nor dey.

en: All the relevant agencies at the theater of war must be up and doing in information gathering and sharing among themselves to know when, where and how to strike when the enemy approaches or at most to, through such information, nip in the bud plans of such an enemy and prevent them from approaching not to talk of striking.
pcm: All di agencies wey be koko for war mata must dey gather tori and spread am to dia sef to take sabi wen, wia  and how enimies wan tackle wit di tori, dia plan go scatter and dem nor go fit attack not to tok of say dem go attack.

en: Religious leaders through their various organisations such as Christian Association of Nigeria, CAN, Supreme Council of Islamic Affairs, SCIA, Pentecostal Fellowship of Nigeria, PFN, among others, must also be engaged and enlightened on what to preach to their followers and how to monitor their activities.
pcm: Religious leaders tru dia various organisations like Christian Association of Nigeria, CAN, Supreme Council of Islamic Affairs, SCIA, Pentecostal Fellowship of Nigeria, PFN, and others must dey follow and eye open ontop wetin dem go preach give dia pipo and how to take follow follow dia ways.

en: These men of God are respected by their followers to the extent that whatever they preach is always swallowed hook and sinker whether such utterances would cause chaos or not.
pcm: Dis men of God dem dey dey respect by dia piporish level say anything wey dem tok dem dey swallow go down whether di word go cause gbege or e nor go cause gbege.

en: They should be properly mobilised and sensitised on the dangers of wrong preaching that could pitch the various religious sects against each other.
pcm: Make dem mobilise dem well and sensitise dem on top danger wey dey for wrong preaching wey fit make one religion pipo dey fight di other.

en: Examples abound where crises have erupted from worship centres due to what the leaders must have told their followers to do, either to retaliate one perceived injustice or the other.
pcm: Examples deon dey wey be say wen palava start from place wey dem dey worship becos of wetin leaders dem tell dia pipo say make dem do, whether to fight back because of one injustice or  anoda one.

en: With proper sensitisation, such would not happen because they must have been educated on what to preach and what not to preach while with their followers.
pcm: Witi beta training, dat kai tin nor go hapun becos dem go don train dem ontop wetin dem go preach and wetin dem nor go preach for dia pipo.

en: It is pertinent to state here, however, that all these would come to nothing if government at all levels fail to provide a level-playing field for peace to reign.
pcm: E dey koko to tok am here say all dis nor gocome for vain if goment for every level nor bring wey for peace to dey.

en: Governments at all levels must strive to provide basic amenities that could engage the youths and take their minds away from crime.
pcm: Goment for every level must provide beta beta tins wey youths go dey do to takecomeot their mind from crime.

en: In trying to solve the security challenges, governments must always ensure that they do not take sides based on ethnic, religious or political differences when addressing issues of security breaches.
pcm: As to dey try solve security yawa, goment sef suppose see say dem nor do partial ontop tribe, religion or politics as dem dey try solve security kasala.

en: Perpetrators of crime must be treated equally according to laws of the land no matter who is involved.
pcm: Pipo wey do crime must dey treat disame disame as di law of di land we im dey take be.

pcm: Example of treating some criminals wit small hand na di arrest of some pipo wey dey do Bureau De Change for Kano wey dem say dem dey sponsor Boko Haram gbege.

pcm: Babafemi yan say dem arrest di two of dem on Sunday, 16 May, 2021.

en: According to him, on the same day, a team of NDLEA operatives from Ondo State Command also arrested one James Godspower with 36.5kg of cannabis sativa in Faloye, Ogbese, Akure North LGA of Ondo State.
pcm: As wetin e tok, dat same day, a team of NDLEA operative from Ondo Statecomemand still arrest one James Godspower wit 36.5kg of cannabis sativa in Faloye, Ogbese, Akure North LGA for Ondo State.

en: The Africa we strive for is possible in unity and solidarity
pcm: Di Africa wey we dey try dey possible inside one-hand and we-we.

en: By Mevlüt Çavusoglu
pcm: By Mevlüt Çavusoglu

en: I would like congratulate all our African friends on May 25 in commemoration of the Africa Day wholeheartedly.
pcm: I go like congratulate all we African friends on May 25 to mark di African dayrish down-down for mind.

en: We remember with appreciation the African countries coming together under the roof of the Organisation of African Unity (OAU), later African Union (AU), on May 25, 1963, predicating on independence and freedom, and displaying a common consciousness based on solidarity and unity.
pcm: We remember as we dey appreciate di African Kontri countries weycome together underdished of Organization of African Unity (OAU), wey later be African Union (AU), on May 25, 1963, predicating on independence and wey stand for independence and freedom, and dey show di same sence on top we-we and one hand.

en: The success story reached in the following decades in this spirit and understanding gives us hope for a bright future of the continent.
pcm: The success tori wey demrish for di pass 10 years for dis spirit and understanding give us hope for bright future fordicontinent.

en: Without a colonial past and having attained its full independence with its struggle against the occupation forces during the War of Independence, Turkey is one of the countries that best grasps the meaning of this day.
pcm: As colonial nor take get hand and as dem get full independence witiout wahala against occupation forces wen dem dey fight for independence, turkey dey among one ofdikontri wey first to quick take dem koko of di mata.

en: We are happy to share today this common joy, conscious of the importance of remembering the struggle for independence by the peoples of Africa for freedom, equality and justice, and evoking the founding goals of the AU.
pcm: We dey hapi  today to share dis disame-disame joy, we dey ontop to di koko for remember ofdiwahala to take kolet independence by Africa pipo for freedom, equality, justice and bi wetin AU care dey look for eyes.

en: Our approach to African countries completely matches the founding principles of the AU and is built on a holistic, inclusive, equal partnership on the basis of mutual respect and win-win strategy.
pcm: Our way to Africa pipo countries dem tali wit dia principles dem of AU and dem build am ontop to do join-join wey pass wetin dey ground, we go dey for all ontop to respect and for win-win idea.

en: We share the spirit of 1963 and the vision of Africa and attach great importance to Agenda 2063 and UN 2030 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
pcm: Na di same 1963 spirit wekari and di vision of Africa and ecome attach great importance to agenda 2063 and UN 2030 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

en: In our concerted journey, which gained momentum with our observer membership status to the AU in 2005, we have covered plenty of ground with the First Turkey-Africa Partnership Summit that we hosted in Istanbul, and by being declared a strategic partner of the union in 2008.
pcm: Inside awa  ogbonge journey wey gain power wit awa  membership status for awa  observer dem for AU for 2005, we don covered plenty ground wit di First Turkey-Africa Partnership Summit wey bin host for Istanbul, and as dem bin declare us  strategic partner of di union for 2008.

en: After the Second Turkey-Africa Partnership Summit held in Malabo in 2014, our ties with African countries have become stronger.
pcm: After di Second Turkey-Africa Partnership Summit wey we bin do for Malabo for 2014,our rope wit African countries demcome strong more more.

en: We hope to host the third summit in our country in September, which we believe will offer opportunities for a strong and comprehensive cooperation between Turkey and Africa.
pcm: We dey hope to host third summit for we kontri for September wey we believe say e go bring chance for cooperation wey strong and big between Turkey and Africa.

en: We continue to contribute to peace and stability and economic and social development in Africa through our public institutions, Non-Governmental Organisations (NGOs) and the private sector.
pcm: We continue to dey contribute put for peace and strong-leg and economic and social development for Africa tru awa  public institutions dem, Non-Governmental Organisations (NGOs) dem and di private pipo.

en: Our Africa Initiative and Africa Partnership policies, considered among the most successful initiatives of our foreign policy, constitute an added value to our relations with the continent.
pcm: Our Africa Initiative and Africa Partnership policies; dem see am among or foreign policy initiative wey dey success pass,come add value join as we dey relate wit  di continent.

en: We can see this constructive effect in many areas such as trade, investment, culture, security, military cooperation and development, and especially in our intensifying and developing political relations with Africa in the last decade.
pcm: We don see di beta sence for area like trade, investment, culture, security, military cooperation and development, and especially as we put mind and as we dey develop political relations wit Africa for ten years wey pass.

en: We are pleased to observe that African countries also attach importance to strengthening cooperation with our country.
pcm: We dey happi to see say Africa pipo countries dem sef see beta inside make dem tight to cooperate wit awa  kontri.

en: We continue to integrate Turkey and Africa in all areas.
pcm: We go continue to dey join join Turkey and Africa for every mata.

en: While the number of our diplomatic missions in the continent was only 12 in 2002, we increased this number to 43, with our embassy opened in Togo last month.
pcm: As diplomatic mission for di continent nor pass 12 for 2002, we increasedinumber to 43, as awa  embassy open for Togo last month.

en: African countries also increased the number of their embassies in Ankara from 10 in 2008 to 37.
pcm: African countries dem sef  top embassies wey dem get  for Ankara from 10 in 2008 go 37.

en: Turkey, which is the fifth country in the world in terms of the number of diplomatic missions, continues to bring the issues of Africa to the agenda at the global level with its wide diplomacy network, and also continues to cooperate with African countries in regional and international platforms.
pcm: Turkey wey dey fifth for world inside di countries dem  wey get diplomatic mission pass continue to dey bring Africa mata enta agenda for global level wit im big sense and e continue to dey cooperate wit Africa pipo countries dem for regional and international platforms.

en: We continue to develop our commercial and economic relations with a win-win approach.
pcm: We continue to dey develop awa  commercial and economic relations wit win-win style.

en: Despite pandemic conditions, we managed to keep our trade volume close to the previous years data
pcm: Despite say pandemic dey, we bin try make awa  trade volume dey close to last year own.

en: The total value of our direct investments in Africa has exceeded $6bn.
pcm: Di total for awa  investment  inside Africa we kom direct pass $6bn.

en: Our Turkish contractors contribute to Africas development by undertaking more than 1,150 projects.
pcm: Our turkey pipo kontrator  contribute give Africa develop as dem stand for project wey pass 1,150.

en: We appreciate the African Continental Free Trade Area Agreement (AfCFTA), which is considered the most important project of Agenda 2063.
pcm: We thanksdiAfrican Continental Free Trade Area Agreement (AfCFTA), wey dem see as project wey dey important pass for Agenda 2063.

en: We are ready to share our experiences with our African friends and provide support in this regard.
pcm: We dey redi to tell awa  friends inside Africa pipo about awa  experience, make we still do supports for di tin.

en: Development and humanitarian aid of Turkey continues to contribute to the creation of favourable conditions for the establishment of a prosperous Africa.
pcm: Development and humanitarian aid of Turkey continue to dey contribute give to create condition wey sweet body to establish Africa wey go dey prosperous.

en: The official development aid provided by our public institutions to Africa between 2005 and 2019 has reached almost $3.5bn.
pcm: This Ogbonge develop dey awa  public institution dem bin provide to Africa between 2005 to 2015 donrish almost $3.5bn

en: In line with the Addis Ababa Action Agenda commitments, our total development aid for 46 Least Developed Countries (LDCs), 33 of which are in Africa, was $8.7bn between 2009 and 2019.
pcm: Follow di action agenda commitments, awa  total develop for 46 Least Developed Countries (LDCs), wey 33 dey for Africa na $8.7bn between 2009 go 2019.

en: We are also pleased that the sustainable development projects of the Turkish Cooperation and Coordination Agency (TİKA), which representation office number has reached 22 in Africa and which bilateral official development assistance for the continent exceeded $500m, are embraced throughout the continent.
pcm: We still hapi  say di sustainable development projects ofdiTurkish Cooperation and Coordination Agency (TİKA), wey dem office wey dey represent dem donrish 22 for Africa dem develop assistance for di continent don pass $500m dey accept everywhere for di continent.

en: The Turkish Maarif Foundation (TMF) has been providing education services to more than 14,000 students with 144 schools and 16 dormitories all over Africa.
pcm: Turkish Maarif Foundation (TMF) don provide education to 14,000 students dem wit 144 schools and 16 dormitories all over Africa.

en: The number of our African students who graduated with the Turkiye Scholarships programme has exceeded 15,000.
pcm: Di nomba of awa  African students dem wey graduat wit di Turkiye Scholarships programme don pass 15,000.

en: Holding the honour of being the only foreign company that flies to the highest number of destinations, including 60 cities in Africa, Turkish Airlines continues to contribute to the reunion of Africa with the rest of the world.
pcm: Wey kom hold di honour to be di only foreign company dat wey don fly go many place, including 60 city for Africa, Turkish Airlines go continue to contribute put Africa todireunion wit di remaining of di world.

en: We did not leave our African friends alone during the COVID-19 pandemic.
pcm: We nor leave of Africa friends dem during  COVID-19 pandemic.

en: Within the framework of the pandemic, we provided medical equipment donations, cash donations or purchase permission assistance for the export and purchasing of medical supplies to 44 African countries.
pcm: Wen di pandemic dey , we do dem medical material donation, moni donation or pay collect assist to export and to buy medical material give 44 Africa pipo countries.

en: The approximate value of relief aid material we made to the region has reached $12m, and the amount of our financial aid has reached $6m.
pcm: The approximate of material to easy things wey we giverish $12m, anddiamount for awa  help to dey give moneyrish $6m.

en: Turkeys endeavours for developing vaccines against COVID-19 is also continuing.
pcm: Turkey work do develop vaccines against COVID-19 still dey continue.

en: We are determined to complete our vaccine activities in autumn and offer these to the service of all humanity, especially to African countries.
pcm: We hold am for mind to finish awa  vaccine tin for autumn make we kom offer am as service give pipo especially give Africa countries dem.

en: The theme of Silencing the Guns: Creating Conducive Conditions for Africas Development and Intensifying the Fight Against the COVID-19 Epidemic set for Africa Day celebrations to be held online this year due to the pandemic is in harmony with Turkeys humanitarian and entrepreneurial foreign policy agenda.
pcm: The topic To silence di Gun: To Create beta condition for development for Africa and put power join to fight against COVID-19 Epidemic wey dem set for Africa Day celebrations wey dem go do online dis year becos of di pandemic dey join-join wit Turkey humanitarian and entrepreneur foreign policy agenda.

en: Standing against all kinds of violence, advocating the resolution of disputes through dialogue, and conducting mediation activities when needed, our country strongly supports the goal of silencing the guns.
pcm: To tanda wit various violence, tok to settle wahala jejeli and to do program wey go dey remain for brain wen e need, awa  kontri support goal of silencingdiguns wit power.

en: Turkey, along with its different mediation and facilitation roles undertaken across the world, is also the Co-Chair of the Group of Friends of Mediation established under the UN, the OSCE and the OIC.
pcm: Turkey wit im program wey go dey remain for brain and facilitation role wey dem dey do for di whole world still be Co-Chair for program wey go dey remain for brain wey dem establish put for under UN, di OSCE and di OIC.

en: We believe that our joint effort with the AU, which is a member of the friends group in UN, will contribute to security and stability in Africa.
pcm: We believe say awa  joinbody effort wit di AU, wey be member fordifriends group in UN, go contribute put security and strong leg inside Africa.

en: With its innovative steps, Turkey shapes not only the diplomacy of today, but also that of the future.
pcm: With dis betabeta, nor be only today diplomacy Turkey dey shape, dem dey shape for di future too.

en: In 2019, we announced the Digital Diplomacy initiative by taking advantage of the transformative power of technology.
pcm: For 2019, we announce di Digital Diplomacy initiative as we take chance of di transformative power of technology.

en: We believe Africas recent focus on digitalisation for sustainable development is spot-on.
pcm: We believe di focus of Africa ontop digitalization for development wey go last dey correct.

en: Within this context, we have observed with pleasure that digital transformation is recommended to achieve Agenda 2063 targets and to ensure sustainable economic recovery in the Africas Development Dynamics:
pcm: Inside dis mata, we donkari eyes look wit pleasure  say digital transformation be koko to take achieve target for agenda 2063 and to see say economic wey im leg strong  dey kampe for di Africas Development Dynamics:

en: Digital Transformation for Quality Jobs report published by the AU this year despite COVID-19.
pcm: Digital Transformation for Quality Jobs dis tori dey publish by di AU dis year despite say COVID-19 dey.

en: We are ready to work with our African friends in the field of digital transformation.
pcm: We dey redi to work wit awa  Africa friends inside field for  digital transformation.

en: We will continue to be in unity and solidarity with African countries and the AU with the strength and inspiration we derive from our centuries-old historical, cultural and human relations with Africa.
pcm: We go continue to dey cooperate and stand wit Africa pipo countries dem anddiAU wit di power and inspiration wey dey see from inside awa  old history, culture and human relation wit Africa.

en: I avail myself of this opportunity to congratulate Africans on this day with heartfelt feelings.
pcm: I hapi  on my own to take congratulate Africa pipo today wit sweet mind.

en: Çavusoglu is the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Turkey
pcm: Çavusoglu be di Minister for Foreign Affairs for di Republic of Turkey

en: Blackmail counterproductive to development, economic growth  — Gov Emmanuel
pcm: Blackmail dey kill development and economic growth —  Gov Emmanuel

en: Akwa Ibom State Governor, Mr Udom Emmanuel, has urged the people to shun blackmail as such vices is inimical and counterproductive to economic growth and development with huge undesirable consequences.
