en: The Governor gave this charge when he led top government functionaries to a special Inter-Denominational Thanksgiving Service to mark the 6th anniversary of his administration on Sunday at Believers Assembly of Nigeria, Uyo.
pcm: Di Governor give dis beta spirit wen he front bigbig pipo for goment go one church thankgiving service wey be for every church denomination to take mark 6years of im tenure on Sunday for  Believers Assembly of Nigeria, Uyo.

en: let God take us to where we are going.

pcm: Make I wan una small, stop to dey spoil Governor name say im bin don build International Worship Center, you nor understand wetin I dey do, I dey raise altar wey go cancel all oda talk.

pcm: I dey raise di altar wey gokari us go wia  we dey go. Na so he yarn.

en: Speaking earlier on Saturday, in a state broadcast to mark his 6th anniversary, the Governor listed the many positive impact his economic and industrialization policy has had on the economy of the state, reiterating the determination of his administration to fulfill his campaign promises to the people with more vigour and determination, noting that he is in a hurry to industrialize and change the narratives of the state from being a purely civil service State to an industrialized entity.
pcm: As e dey speak morning for Saturday, for inside a state broadcast to take mark im 6th anniversary, di Governor list many beta impact wey im economy and industrialization policy don get ontop di economy for di state, as im still tok wetin him admistration get for mind to do im campaign promises dem to di pipo wit power and strong mind, say im dey hurry to industrialize and change watin di statekari for mind wey be goment  worker state to place wey dey industrialize.

en: Giving a sectoral breakdown of his achievements in office, the Governor said in the agricultural sector, he has kept his promise to ensure that the state produce enough food at affordable prices to feed the people.
pcm: As e dey tok im achievements for office one one, di Governor say for agricultural sector, im bin don do all wetin im promise to see say di state dey produce food for shekel moni to feed di pipo.

en: He recalled that his inauguration of the Technical Committee on Agriculture and Food Sufficiency have borne incredible fruits.
pcm: Im tok back say ontop im inauguration of di Technical Committee on Agriculture and Food Sufficiency don bring beta fruit.

en: Our staple food items such as garri, rice, yam etc are produced mostly by our people here.
pcm: Our own food like garri, rice, yam etc dey dey produce by awa  pipo for here.

en: From the rice mill in Ini Local Government Area, to the numerous garri processing mills scattered all over the three senatorial districts, to our low interest loans given to farmers, to the cassava plantation through the FADAMA 3 scheme, we are working to ensure that our people have enough food to eat at quite affordable prices
pcm: For di rice mill wey dey Ini Local goment  Area, enta plenty garri mill wey scatter put for di three senatorial district wey dey di area, enta small interest loan wey we give farmers to take plant casava through FADAMA 3 program, we dey work ontop make awa  pipo get food to dey chop wit sekele money.

en: Our investments in this critical sector goes beyond making food available for all, we are also leveraging in on our comparative advantage in agriculture through the establishment of a fully functional Directorate of Agriculture and Agro-Allied Investments, he stated.
pcm: Our investment for dis kind wahala time pass to see say food dey for everybody, we still dey try for di big change wey we don get for agriculture to take create Directorate of Agriculture and Agro-Allied Investments wey go dey function. Naso e yarn.

en: In the health sector, the Governor noted with delight that when he came in, most of the general hospitals were derelict as patients and hospital staff were battling snakes and other reptiles every day.
pcm: For health sector, di Governor tok wit joy say wen in bin kom in, many of di general hospitals dey very bad as sick pipo and staff dem for hospital dey digga snake and other animal wahala everyday.

en: He stated that his administration has equipped the Ibom Specialist Hospital with the most modern medical facilities compete with an ICU and these huge investments came in handy during the challenging months of the Covid-19 pandemic as the highly trained medical professionals performed exceedingly well to stem the spread of the deadly virus.
pcm: He tok say im tenure don buy material put for Ibom Specialist Hospital and most of dis new-school material  bin dey shallenge ICU and dis big moni work kom inside Covid-19 pandemic asdimedical pipo dem wey sabi work do well to see say dem cut di hand of dis dangerous virus.

en: Listing the achievements of his industrialization policy, Governor Emmanuel said, through the efforts of the Technical Committee on Foreign Direct Investments, he has attracted over twenty economically viable and employment – generating Industries to the state including the Coconut Virgin Oil Refinery, a digitalized flour mill which produces the flour we need for our confectioneries industry, the Metering company, the commencement of the Liberty Oil and Gas Free Zone, the Ground breaking ceremony for the construction of Sterling petrochemicals and Fertilizer production factory, the $1.4 billion Ammonia and Fertilizer plant, and Ibom Air which he noted has become a national sensation.
pcm: As in bin dey list di achievement of im industrialization policy, Governor Emmanuel tok say, through di effort of di Technical Committee on Foreign Direct Investments, im don get over twenty economic company pipo wey redi to work and employ — wey create industries for di state including di Coconut Virgin Oil Refinery, one digital flour mill wey dey produce flour wey we need for awa  small small foods industry, company wey dey measure, Liberty Oil and Gas Free Zone wey dem start,diopen ceremony wey shake ground to take construct Sterling petrochemicals and Fertilizer production factory, di $1.4 billion Ammonia and Fertilizer plant and Ibom Air wey im tok say everybody for di kontri dey tok am

en: Explainer: What you should know about cattle-ranching
pcm: Explainer: Wetin you suppose sabi konsain cattle-ranching.

en: With the incessant attacks between farmers and herders, state governments, mostly in the South, have resolved to ban open grazing and adopt ranching as an alternative to the age-long practice of herders roaming with their cattle to seek pasture for their herd.
pcm: With evri day attack between farmers and heldmen, state goment dem, especially from South don conclude to ban open grazing and to kolet ranching as watin dem go dey use instead of di wakawaka of herdsmen wit their cattle wey don long.

en: As the call for the adoption of ranching grows, herders, who are mostly drawn from the Fulani ethnic group, have expressed lack of knowledge on how the new system would work for them.
pcm: As dem say put voice out ontop to dey grow ranch, herdsmen wey be say na Fulani pipo plenty dia pass don tok open mouth ontop how di tin go work for dem as dem nor take abi.

en: This is evident in a statement made by the Sarkin Fulani of Iwo in Osun State, Alhaji Momodu Adamu, during a summit in which he stated that most Fulani are unaware of what ranching means.
pcm: Dis one dey inside one tori wey di Sarkin Fulani of Iwo for Osun State Alhaji Momodu Adamu yarn for inside one summit wia im bin dey tok say Many Fulani nor sabi watin ranching mean

en: Ranching is strange to us.
pcm: Ranching dey strange to us

en: We are willing to learn.
pcm: We bin wan learn.

en: We want the government to teach us about it.
pcm: We wan make goment teach us about am.

en: We will continue to live in peace.
pcm: We go continue to dey live wit peace.

en: What is ranching
pcm: Wetin be ranching

en: The National Geographic said ranching involves rearing livestock, especially cattle, on a vast area of land.
pcm: Di National Geographic pipo tok say ranching na to dey rear livestocks, especially cattle ontop big land

en: This activity, which is business oriented, enable livestock to graze in a controlled land for pastures, fodders and water provided for consumption through purchase of hays and growing of pasture.
pcm: This thing, weykari business sense go, go make livestocks dey chop for a land wey get control for grass and water  ontop contract and to dey plant grass

en: The practice is not a sedentary mode of grazing since the spacious land allows herders to walk around with their herd to consume grown fodder in a confined area.
pcm: This way nor dey function as grazing mode as chance dey for herdsmen to dey waka up and down wit dia cow to dey chop things wey dey any area wey dem go.

en: However, growing fodder in the grazing area might not be sustainable as lack of rainfall or water to grow it would result in shortage.
pcm: But, to dey grow grass for area fit dey easy because rain shortage or water shortage nor go make am do well.

en: Overgrazing is another factor making it unsustainable.
pcm: Overgrazing sef dey among wetin nor go make am deyrish.

en: The concentration of livestock in an area, as ranching offers, reduces the proclivity of fat reduction among cattle as well as contributes to the livestock subsector.
pcm: To focus on livestock for one area, ranching dey give, reduce di reduce hunger among cattle dem sef and to add join livestock subsector.

en: National Geographic notes that Ranching is an efficient way to raise livestock to provide meat, dairy products, and raw materials for fabrics.
pcm: National Geographic pipo tok say Ranching na di beta way to take dey raise livestock to provide meat, milk and raw material for fabrics.

en: It is a vital part of economies and rural development around the world.
pcm: Na ogbonge part for economies and rural development around di world.

en: But the livestock industry has effects on the environment through contributing to air and water pollution.
pcm: But di livestock industry dey get effects on di environment for contribute put for air and water pollution.

en: Harmful products from ranches can include manure, antibiotics and hormones given to the animals, as well as fertilizers and pesticides.
pcm: Harmful product wey dem fit see for ranches fit be manure, antibiotics, and hormones wey dem dey give animals dem join wit fertilizer and pesticides.

en: Similarly, chemicals from tanneries that treat animal hides can also seep into water.
pcm: Like dat one, chemical from wia  animal dey sleep put wey fit treat animal fit good to put inside water for dem.

en: Facilities
pcm: Material

en: In an article, Encyclopedia Britannica states that barns, which serve as shelters, are the most important elements in a ranch.
pcm: For inside one tori for Encyclopedia Britannica e tok say barn wey be wia  animal dey live be di koko inside all wetin join ranch.

en: This facility is enclosed thus wouldnt be suitable for a nomadic herder who has developed a strong relation with his herd.
pcm: This material still closed for dis, e nor go sweetbodi for herdsmen dem wen wakawaka don master.

en: As such, a pen would be more suitable to keep a close eye on them.
pcm: For this, wia  animal go dey stay don do so eyes go dey dia bodi.

en: Other facilities are a milk parlour, mowers, tractors, hay barns, water irrigation system and a stall barn for the animals to rest, feed, milk and watered.
pcm: Oda facilities na wetin take dey do milk, watin dem take dey cut grass, wetin dem take dey pour water and small barn for animal to dey rest, chop kotet dia milk and put water.

en: With electricity not reliable, components of solar can be a feature in ranches in Nigeria.
pcm: As light leg nor strong, solar fit dey beta for ranches for Nigeria .

en: Ranching and the National Livestock Transformation Plan
pcm: Ranching and di National Livestock Transformation Plan

en: A human rights lawyer Femi Falana said that ranching is not a new development in Nigeria with the first ranch in Nigeria established in Cross River State at Obudu in 1951 by the British, but was taken over by Eastern Regional Government after independence.
pcm: One human right lawyer Femi Falana said dat ranching nor be new development for Nigeria as dem establish di first ranch fro Nigeria for Obudu, Cross River State in 1951 by British dem but by Eastern Regional goment  take over am after independence.

en: He added that the Awolowo regime had a ranch in Akunnu, now Ondo State with Ahmadu Bello establishing one in Mokwa, Niger State.
pcm: E add join say Awolowo regime get one rance for Akunnu wey be Ondo State now ad Ahmadu Bello sef dey establish one for Mokwa, Niger State.

en: During Yakubu Gowons regime, Audu Bako had the best ranches in the country in Kano.
pcm: During Yakubu Gowons regime, Audu Bako get di best ranches for di kontri for Kano.

en: Also, there are grazing reserves which are domiciled on bigger lands that house many herders and their families in some parts of the north.
pcm: And, grazing reserve wey dey permanent ontop big land wey be house for herdmen and dia family for some part of di north.

en: With the ranches no longer functioning, the federal government in 2018 introduced the National Livestock Transformation Plan (NLTP).
pcm: As di ranches nor longer function, federal goment for 2018 introduced di National Livestock Transformation Plan (NLTP).

en: The plan which was piloted in Adamawa in 2019 had the backing of the National Economic Council composed of the governors of the 36 States governors and chaired by the Vice President, Yemi Osinbajo.
pcm: The plan wey dem test for Adamawa for 2019 get di backing ofdiNational Economic Council wey be governors for di 36 States governors and di Vice President, Yemi Osinbajo be di chair

en: The NLTP is a N100 billion 10-year initiative (2019-2027) that would ensure Economic growth and avert the farmers/herders crises.
pcm: The NLTP na one N100 billion 10-year initiative (2019-2027) wey ensure say Economic dey grow and prevent di farmers/herdsmen kasala.

en: The plan will see to the creation of four ranch sizes housing 30, 60, 150 and 300 cows with feeding facilities, watering facilities, a market and a breeder ranch for a minimum of 1,000 cattle.
pcm: Di plan go see to create four ranch size wey go contain 30, 60, 150 and 300 cows wit food facilities, water facilities, and market and a breeder ranch of 1,000 cattle for minimum

en: Osinbajo in a speech during the launch of the programme said the ranches would propel integrated business centre for commercial crop production, the supply of livestock materials and facilitation of improved access to basic services for herders.
pcm: Osinbajo wen im bin dey give speech wen dem dey launch di programme saydiranch go add put for join-join business centre for crop production for business, di supply of livestock materials and help to improved access to basic services for herdsmen.

en: According to him, participating states will provide the land as its own contribution to the project.
pcm: As im take tok, state go provide land as dia own contribution for di project

en: The Federal government merely supports the project.
pcm: The Federal goment only support di project.

en: It is a plan that hopes to birth tailor-made ranches where cattle are bred, and meat and dairy products are produced using modern livestock methods.
pcm: Na plan to take design ranches wia  dem go dey raise cattle, meat and milk wey dem go produce go dey wit newschool livestock.

en: During his presentation, he delinked the NLTP from the controversial cattle ranching colony, RUGA, which was perceived in some quarters as a land-grabbing project by the federal government to house herders and their families in a particular area.
pcm: When e present, he bin cut NLTP commot fromdidat ranching colony wey wan bring wahala, RUGA, wey some pipo see as as federal goment wan force kolet land to keep heldsmen and their families for a particular area.

en: 2023: Disquiet in Kwara APC over governors sister
pcm: 2023: Wahala fo Kwara APC ontop governor sister.

en: The protracted leadership crisis rocking the Kwara State chapter of the All Progressives Congress (APC) took a new twist following calls for the removal of Senator Khairat Gwadabe, a sister to Governor Abdulrahman Abdulrazaq, from the Membership Registration Appeal Panel set up by the Governor Mai Mala Buni-led Caretaker Committee by some aggrieved founding members the party in the state.
pcm: Di teytey leadership palava wey dey hapun for Kwara  State chapter of di All Progressives Congress (APC) wear new cloth as dem some founding members wey dey vex open mouth say make dem comot  Senator Khairat Gwadabe, wey be sister to Governor Abdulrahman Abdulrazaq, from di Membership Registration Appeal Panel Caretaker Committee wey Governor Mai Mala Buni dey lead.

en: The call for Khairats removal is coming on the heels of the fierce struggle for the control of the soul of the party in the state between the governor and some aggrieved leaders over the second term ticket for 2023 as the next electioneering campaign beckons.
pcm: Di call say make dem remove Khairat dey kom from di wahala of who go dey control di parti for di state between governor and some members wey dey vex ontop second term ticket for 2023 di next electioneering campaign beckons.

en: The governor and some notable leaders in the party have been at loggerheads since the administration came into power in 2019 in the state over disagreement in his style of leadership.
pcm: Di governor and some leader wey get mouth for di parti don dey digger something since dis tenure enta power in 2019 for di state ontop style wey im dey take rule.

en: But despite some spirited efforts to bring everybody on the same page, according to insiders in the party, the issue appears to have festered, with the latest imbroglio having the potential to consume the party in the race for the top seat come 2023 if the needful is not done by uniting all the forces that collectively defeated the last Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) administration in the state, led by former Senate President Bukola Saraki.
pcm: But ontop all power to take bring everybody togeda under one umbrella, as one insider for di take tok am,dimata dey hot more more wit dis new wahala wey fit chop di parti comot for dis top seat for 2023 if dem nor dom am somtin by joining alldipower wey fall Peoples Democratic parti (PDP) administration for di state, wey former Senate President Bukola Saraki dey lead.

en: For many members of the aggrieved group, which has the support of top party leaders like the Minister of Information and Culture, Alhaji Lai Mohammed and his counterpart for transport (state), Gbemisola Saraki, under the factional caretaker chairman, Hon Bashiru Omolaja Bolarinwa (BOB), Khairats inclusion in the membership of the committee was part of a grand plan by the governor to hijack the party machinery in the state in the build-up to the 2023 elections.
pcm: Many members of di group wey dey vex wey get di support of big parti leader like di Minister of Information and Culture, Alhaji Lai Mohammed and im fellow for transport (state), Gbemisola Saraki, under di factional caretaker chairman, Hon Bashiru Omolaja Bolarinwa (BOB), Khairat wey dem put dey among plan for di governor to hijack parti man-machine for di state as im dey build-up 2023 election.

en: Some of the top leaders and party supporters in the state, who said they had been disenfranchised from the registration/revalidation process, pointed accusing fingers at the former senator, who they accused of working with the Senator John Danbois committee which headed the last exercise in the state to disenfranchise leaders and members believed to be against the governor.
pcm: Some of di top leaders and parti supporters inside di state, wey tok say dem don do dem ojoro ontop registration/revalidation process don accuse di former senator say im bin dey work wit Senator John Danboi committee wey head di last exercise for di state to do ojoro for members wey dem believe say dem dey fight di governor.

en: Her membership status of the committee, they argued, was to finish the work she started in the state at the national level to remove any obstacle against the second term ticket of the governor and pave the way for his smooth emergence as the partys candidate in the next gubernatorial election.
pcm: Im status for di committee, as dem dey drag am, bi to go finish work wey im bin start inside state for national level to clear road for di second term ticket ofdigovernor and open road wey roku for  im to be di parti candidate for di next governor election.

en: In one of the press releases that have since trailed the issue, a faction of the APC in the state believed to be loyal to the camp of Lai Mohammed and other aggrieved leaders, openly rejected the inclusion of Senator Gwadabe in the 61-member committee.
pcm: One of di press release weu yarn d mata small, one faction of di APC for di state believe say dem loyal to di camp of Lai Mohammed and other members wey dey vex, and tok am korokoro say dem nor want make dem add Senator Gwadabe join di 61-member committee.

en: The group, known as Integrity Group, in a statement signed by Comrade Abdul-Rahoof Bello, declared the appointment as unacceptable.
pcm: Di group wey pipo know as Integrity Group, inside on tok wey Comrade Abdul-Rahoof Bello sign yarn am kom outside dey dem nor acceptdiemployment.

en: According to the group, Here was a governors sister who worked in tandem with the Danboi committee to commit all sorts of atrocities and impunities against the partys interest in Kwara State.
pcm: As di group take talk, One governor sister dey do double mind  work wit didiDanboi committee to kos many wahala and some wuruwuru against watin di parti want for inside Kwara

en: Their call was echoed by another group believed to be fronting for the minister, Concerned APC Youth Stakeholders, which petitioned the national secretariat of the party as run by the Caretaker Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee (CECPC) over the issue, alleging the over 600,000 of its members have been disenfranchised with the connivance of Senator Khairat.
pcm: Anoda voice still kom outside wey dem believe say e dey front for di minister, ontop APC Youth Stakeholder, petitioned di national secretariat of di parti wey Caretaker Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee (CECPC) dey run ontop di issue, say dem don do over 600,000 of dia member ojoro wit di wuruwuru of Senator Khairat.

en: But shortly after their positions were made known, the governors men and foot soldiers also went to town with their trumpet to drum support for the governor and his sister over the matter.
pcm: Sometime after dem tok dia own, some governor men and supporters sef scatter full town dey wit trumpet dey drum and support for di governor and im sister ontop dimata.

en: It was the publicity secretary of the party, Alhaji Folaranmi Aro, a staunch loyalist of the governor that fired the first salvo thus, Those against the senators inclusion have no basis.
pcm: Na di publicity secretary ofdiparty, Alhaji Folaranmi Aro, a strong loyalist of di governor first fire say; pipo wey dey against say dem put di senator nor get tok.

en: Under the aegis of the Reformist Progressive Forum, the group that supports the governor, in a rejoinder to the statement by the Integrity Group, noted that Senator Gwadabes rejection by the group of political puppets in Kwara is baseless and unfounded.
pcm: Under di supporter for di Reformist Progressive Forum, di group wey dey support governor inside one quick reply to di statement of integrity group, tok say di rejection of Senator Gwadabe by group of political small pikin for kwara nor get head and norish tok.

en: This is unreasonable, illogical and destructive criticism.
pcm: Dis one nah mumu criticism wey nor get sense and fit destroy.

en: When contacted for comment, Saheed Popoola, a loyalist of the minister and lawmaker in the Kwara State House of Assembly from Offa, told Daily Trust Saturday that he was not in town.
pcm: When dem go meet am for tori, Saheed Popoola, one of di pipo wey dey loyal wella todiminister and im still be lawmaker for Kwara State House of Assembly from Offa, tell Daily Trust Saturday say im nor dey town.

en: But a top member of the party and diehard supporter of the minister from Kwara Central said although Alhaji Lai Mohammed and few others registered despite condemnation of the exercise, the action was in demonstration and solidarity with prominent national leaders of the party like Chief Bisi Akande and Bola Ahmed Tinubu, who did but still faulted the process, calling for improvement.
pcm: But one top member of di parti and diehard supporter of di minister from Kwara Central tok say though Alhaji Lai Mohammed and few odas still register despite say dem condemn di exercise. Di action na to demo and to show we dey wit you give big big leaders dem for di parti like Chief Bisi Akande and Bola Ahmed Tinubu wey still tok say di process dey wonkain, make dem do am well.

en: But on the issue of how this might affect the partys chances in 2023, the top party official said, There is still a long way to go, and many considerations may be laid on the table before then.
pcm: But ontopmata on how di tin fit take affect di parti chance for 2023, dem Oga for di parti say; dimata long gan-an and dem fit put manymata ontop table before dat time.

en: Our workings now are first to get the sham which the last exercise clearly was upturned and get the national leadership to approve the conduct of a fresh exercise in the state.
pcm: Our workings now na to first get di wayo wey bend di last exercise and to get di hand of National leader dem to do fresh exercise for di state.

en: For Kunle Suleiman, a lawyer and pioneer chairman of the PDP in the state and an unrepentant apologist of the governor, what is happening is politics and the party will rise above it when the time comes.
pcm: For Kunle Suleiman, lawyer wey be pioneer chairman of PDP for di state, wey still be one pesin wey sabi vex  and beg di Governor and go still vex am, watin dey hapun na politics and di parti go grow pass am.

en: He, however, said their concern was how to deliver good governance, which the governor promised.
pcm: Im still tok say dia konsain na  how dem go take make life beta wey di governor promise dem.

en: However, a member of the AA group and supporter of the governor in Ilorin west told Daily Trust Saturday that those aggrieved party members kicking against the inclusion of Senator Khairat were jesters.
pcm: One member ofdiAA group wey still be Governor supporter for Ilorin west tell Daily Trust Saturday say di vexvex parti members dem wey dey tackle as dem take put Senator Khairat na playplay pipo.

en: He added that the party had since moved on from that exercise.
pcm: He add join say di parti don move ontop di exercise.

en: For Gods sake, those who are complaining dont know what they are doing and saying.
pcm: For God sake, pipo wey dey complain nor sabi wetin dem dey do and wetin  dem dey tok.

en: Khairat is a member of the APC and can be made a member of any committee based on her contributions and recognition in the party.
pcm: Khairat na member of APC and fit be member for any committee onto her contributions and recognition inside di party.

en: She is entitled to it.
pcm: She dey entitle give am.

en: If she is a sister to the governor, should that deny her right?
pcm: If she be sister to governor, shey dat one suppose deny her right?

en: In politics, and where you have factions, this type of thing happens.
pcm: For inside politices wey many factions dey, dis kain tin dey hapun.

en: Somebody that is not given something always complains; and those complaining now belong to BOB and Lais group.
pcm: Person wey dem nor give somtin go complain; and pipo wey dey complain be BOB and Lai group.

en: They thought they could control the registration exercise and party politics but now realised that it has suddenly moved out of their hands.
pcm: Dem think say dem fit controldiregistration exercise and parti politics but now kom see say e don comot for dia hand.

en: They are complaining because they lost in the partys power game for now, he added.
pcm: Dem dey complain because dem don lost for di power game of di parti now. E add join.

en: He, however, said the party would get its acts together in the remaining two years, adding, We came to the APC in factions.
pcm: He kom tok say di parti go get im sef for inside dis two years wey remain as im still add say  We kom inside APC faction faction

en: These same people that are saying the governor will not get the ticket also said so during his first term and did not vote for him, yet he got it; and he will get it again.
pcm: Dis same pipo wey say di governor nor go get ticket still tok like dat for im first time and dem nor vote for am, e still get am; and e go get am again.

en: It is about strategy and getting your politics right.
pcm: Na ontop make you use sense and get your politics koret.

en: We are not afraid.
pcm: We nor dey fear

en: Also, the issue of the governors kind of politics has been at the centre of the present disagreement, with notable figures like Professor Abdulraheem Shuaib Oba and Akogun Iyiola Oyedepo describing him as a featherweight politician that could be easily discarded in 2023.
pcm: Also, di mata of how d governor dey do politics don bi watin dey kos palava as big big pipo like Professor Abdulraheem Shuaib Oba and Akogun Iyiola Oyedepo dey tok about di governor say im bi politician wey im weight dey like feather wey go dey easy to blow comot for 2023.

en: In the view of some political watchers, what has played out in the way the governor has dealt with Lais group and how he handled the registration exercise only indicate how things could get complicated in the struggle to control the party ahead of 2023.
pcm: For di eyes of some pipo wey sabi watch politics, watin don hapun ontop how governor take deal wit Lai group and how e take handle di registration exercise show how mata fit no take get head to control di parti  before 2023.

en: Vandals cut off section of Warri-Itapke rail line
pcm: Thug pipo cut some part of Warri-Itapke rail line.

en: Vandals have cut several sections on the Itapke-Warri rail line.
pcm: Thug pipo don cut many part comot for Warri-Itapke rail line.

en: In a viral video, the vandals, still unknown, used what appears to be a saw to slice through the rail line to a point where the pieces could be taken thereby exposing passengers to danger.
pcm: Inside one video wey dey waka, di thug pipo, wey dem still neva sabi, use watin bi like saw take slice di rail wia  dem fit take comot some, wey kom put like of passengers dem for danger.

en: The incident, our correspondent gathered, happened along the Warri-Itakpe standard gauge line around KM 30 Adogo, Kogi State section of the rail.
pcm: Di trouble, as awa  news pipo take gather, e hapun along di Warri-Itakpe standard gauge line around KM 30 Adogo, for Kogi State section for di rail.

en: The managing director/CEO, the Nigerian Railway Corporation, Engr.
pcm: Di managing director/CEO, Di Nigeria Railway Corporation, Engr.

en: Fidet Okhiria, confirmed the incident to our correspondent.
pcm: Fidet Okhiria, confirm di trouble give awa  news pipo

en: He, however, said the train is still being operated as there is an alternative.
pcm: E, still, tok say train still dey work bicos, anoda way dey.

en: The incident happened two days ago.
pcm: Di trouble hapun like two days ago.

en: But we are still in operation because we have an alternative, he said.
pcm: But we still dey work because we get anoda way. Na so im tok.

en: Pillars battle Nasarawa Utd in top of the table clash
pcm: Pillars diga wit Nasarawa Utd for clash of pipo wey dey top for di table

en: Kano Pillars will square up with perennial rivals, Nasarawa United this afternoon in the Nigeria Professional Football League week 23 top of the table clash at the Ahmadu Bello Stadium Kaduna.
pcm: Kano Pillars go diga wit dia evritime rival, Nasarawa United dis afternoon for di Nigeria Professional Football League week 23 of  clash of pipo wey dey top for di table for Ahmadu Bello Stadium Kaduna.

en: However, in case of a draw, the winner in the other fixture between Kwara United and Rivers United in Ilorin will go to the top of the table.
pcm: As e be, if tighttight go dey, pesin wey win inside Kwara United and Rivers United for Ilorin go go  di top of di table.

en: While Pillars are on 41 points, Kwara United, Nasarawa United and Rivers United are on 39 points each with a chance of going to the top.
pcm: As Pillars dey 41 points, Kwara United, Nasarawa United and Rivers United dey 39 points all of dem get chance to enta top.

en: Therefore, if the two matches in Kaduna and Ilorin end in draw, Pillars will assume leadership again pending the outcome of tomorrows match between Abia Warriors and Akwa United in Okigwe.
pcm: Mean say, If di two match for Kaduna and Ilorin go finish for draw, Pillars go enta top first before we sabi di result of tomoro match between Abia Warriors and Akwa United for Okigwe

en: Although Pillars will be motivated by Super Eagles captain, Ahmed Musa and their influential captain Rabiu Ali, they must be wary of Nasarawa United who ended their 12-year unbeaten home record with a 2-1 victory in 2015.
pcm: Though Pillars go dey motivated wit di Captain of Super Eagles Ahmed Musa and their captain wey get influence Rabiu Ali, but dem must fear Nasarawa United wey spoil dia 12-year unbeaten for home wit wining of 2-1 for 2015.

en: In todays match, Pillars will have to put an eye on Adamu Hassan who left them under unpleasant circumstances in 2020 to rejoin his home club and has been consistent in scoring against them.
pcm: For today match, Pillar go wan put eyes for Adamu Hassan wey as e comot go join im town club for 2020 nor sweet am and e don dey score dem evri time.

en: It will also be recalled that the experienced striker scored a brace against Pillars when Nasarawa United trounced them 5-0 in a friendly match last year.
pcm: We go remember say dis striker wey get experience score two enta pillar wen Nasarawa United waya dem 5-0 for one friendly match last year.

en: And when they met in the first round of the ongoing season in Lafia, it was the same player who denied Pillars victory when he scored the equaliser in the 1-1 draw.
pcm: And wen dem meet for di first round of dis season for Lafia, na dis same player no gree make Pillars win wen e score equaliser for di 1-1 tight tight .

en: Hassan is, therefore, confident he will score against his former club as he told Daily Trust yesterday that he normally scores anytime he plays against Pillars.
pcm: Hassan now, don get mind say im go score im former club as im bin tell Daily Trust yesterday say im normally score anytime he play against Pillars.

en: I know they must have mapped out their plan against me but it has been hard for them to stop me.
pcm: I sabi say dem go don do dia plan against me but e dey dey hard for dem to stop me.

en: They think they know me
pcm: Dem think say dem sabi me.

en: but I keep scoring against them.
pcm: But I still dey score dem.

en: Tomorrows (today) match is not going to be an exception.
pcm: Tomorrows (today) match no go dey different.

en: I know by the grace of almighty Allah, I will score again, he said.
pcm: I sabi say by di grace of almighty Allah, I go score again, Na so im tok

en: In other week 23 matches billed for today, Adamawa United will host Katsina United in Gombe, FC IfeanyiUbah visit Dakkada in Uyo, Lobi Stars will move from Lagos where they lost 0-1 against MFM to play Wolves in Ozoro, MFM will attempt to dim Sunshine Stars in Akure while embattled Wikki Tourists battle Enyimba in Bauchi.
pcm: Inside other week 23 match wey dem put for today, Adamawa United go host Katsina United for Gombe, FC IfeanyiUbah visit Dakkada for Uyo, Lobi Stars go move from Lagos wia  they lost 0-1 against MFM to go play Wolves in Ozoro, MFM go go face Sunshine Stars wey no him light no too shine for Akure while Wikki Tourists wey get challenges go challenge Enyimba for Bauchi.

en: Power: Nigerians spend $21bn on generators — Reps
pcm: Power: Nigeria pipo dey spend $21bn ontop generators — Reps

en: The House of Representatives has said the manufacturing sector lost $200 billion while other Nigerians spent $21 billion on generators between 2015 and 2021 on self-generated electricity due to poor electricity supply from the national grid.
pcm: Di House of Representatives don tok say pipo wey dey manufacture lost $200 billion as other Nigeria pipo spend $21 billion ontop generators between 2015 and 2021 ontop light wey pesin generate for im sef ontop say light no good for di nation.

en: The House also called on the Nigerian Electricity Regulatory Commission (NERC) to suspend the proposed increase in electricity tariff.
pcm: Di House also don call Di Nigeria Electricity Regulatory Commission (NERC) to suspend di increase wey dem wan do ontop price for light.

en: According to Aniekan Umanah who moved the motion at the plenary on Thursday, NERC, working with Distribution Companies (DisCos), increased electricity tariff five times since 2015, the latest being on January1, 2021.
pcm: According to Aniekan Umanah wey moved di motion for di plenary for Thursday, NERC, dey work wit Distribution Companies (DisCos), and dem increased electricity tariff five times since 2015, di last one na January1, 2021.

en: According to him, despite the increases, Nigerians have not enjoyed significant improvement in power generation, but grapple with epileptic supply and poor services from the DisCos.
pcm: As e take talk, despite say dem increases, Nigeria pipo neva enjoy beta ontop light, but dey suffer wit on and off light and poor service wey dem DisCos dey give.

en: Poor services by the DisCos have impacted negatively on the socio-economic growth of the country as the International Monetary Fund (IMF) Report of 2020 on Nigeria indicated that the manufacturing sector lost over $200bn to inadequate power supply while a whopping $21bn was said to have been spent by Nigerians on generating sets within the period under review.
pcm: Poor service wey DisCos pipo dey give don get bad way ontop to grow di economy of di kontri as di International Monetary Fund (IMF) Report for 2020 ontop Nigeria show say di manufacturing sector lost moni wey pass $200bn to light wey nor good and big $21bn n aim dem say Nigeria pipo don spend on top to generator inside dat time wey dem review.

en: The House, therefore, urged the federal government to direct NERC to rescind the decision to further increase electricity tariff proposed for June, 202l, in view of the hard times Nigerian masses were going through.
pcm: Di House, now don beg di federal goment  make dem direct NERC to cancel dia plan to still put moni join wey dem put for June 2021 bikos of dis hard time wey Nigeria pipo dey.

en: The house mandated the committees on power, poverty alleviation and labour, employment and productivity to ensure compliance.
pcm: Di house don make di committees for power, poverty alleviation and labour, employment and productivity see say dem do am.

en: Border reopening discourages hoarding in Katsina markets
pcm: Border wey dem open back spoil to dey keepkeep tins for Katsina markets.

en: The reopening of four land borders by the Federal Government last week has significantly slowed down hoarding activities in Katsina markets, Daily Trust can report.
pcm: As di Federal Goment open four land borders last week don slow down keepkeep wey dem dey do for katsina, Daily Trust fit tok.

en: Prior to the announcement, grain merchants and other businessmen hid under the guise of company agents to buy farm produce in bulk and store to maximise profit in the near future.
pcm: Before dom shout am, pipo wey dey sell grains go disquise say dem be agent from company kom buy bigbig farm produce keep to store and get profit later.

en: According to dealers, despite the restriction on the importation of rice and other food items, merchants were still skeptical to stockpile farm produce as government might change its decision anytime, depending on the circumstance on ground.
pcm: As one dealer take tok, despite say dem match leg ontop to dey carry rice and other food enter Nigeria , market pipo still get double mind to keep market ontop say goment  fit change dia mind anytime depend on wetin dey ground.

en: Alhaji Aminu Hussain, a sorghum merchant, said hoarding of farm produce was not a new business in the markets, but the practice seriously increased with the new agricultural policy of this administration and border closure.
pcm: Alhaji Aminu Hussain, wey dey sorghum, say to dey keepkeep market no be new tin for di  market, but e kom go up wit di new  agricultural policy of dis administration and border wey dem close.

en: Many of us made huge profits on farm produce last year, that is why our people came out early in this harvest period, mopping up the produce; but the recent reopening of land borders has slowed us down.
pcm: Many of us chop beta gain ontop farm produce for last year, na why pipo kom out quick dis harvest time to dey buy keep but border wey dem open don slow am down.

en: The fear among us now is that market price of food items will come down.
pcm: The fear wey we get na say price for food go still kom down.

en: He added that the shortfall of farm output, occasioned by incessant activities of bandits this year, had also motivated the merchants to hoard the produce.
pcm: E add join say farm produces wey no kom out plenti bikos of bad way of dem bandit dis year, don give market pipo mind to keepkeep dia market.

en: Rice, maize and sorghum were the most targeted produce.
pcm: Rice, maize and sorghum n aim dem put eye.

en: Mallam Muhammadu Tarzana, a grain dealer at Bakori market, said the announcement of border reopening last week had made an impact on the market price of major food items.
pcm: Mallam Muhammadu Tarzana, wey dey sell grain for  Bakori market, say as dem shout to open border again  last week don get hand ontop price for major food for di market.

en: Unlike last year when, by this time, maize was between N8,000 and N9,500, sorghum was N7,000, they are now sold at N14,000 and N13,000 respectively.
pcm: E no be like last year we, by dis time, maize dey around N8,000 and N9,500, sorghum dey N7,000, nah N14,000 and N13,000 dem dey sell dem now.

en: The recent announcement of border reopening has crashed down the price of paddy rice from N14,000 to N12,000, sorghum from N14,500 to N13,000 and maize from N15,500 to N14,000.
pcm: Dis shout of open border again wey dem shout down spoil di price of paddy rice from N14,000 go N12,000, sorghum from N14,500 go N13,000 and maize from N15,500 go N14,000.

en: Tarzana added that most merchants withdrew from bulk purchase of the produce after the announcement, expecting that waivers for the importation of food items would follow anytime soon.
pcm: Tarzana add join say many market pipo comot hand to dey buy market bigbig afta dem shout am, get am for mind say di breeze from importation of food go enta anytime.

en: Our correspondent observed that there are mixed reactions to the land border opening.
pcm: Our news pipo see say di land border wey dem open again get many eyes.

en: Majority of the farmers and merchants prefer the borders to be closed so that they would continue to exploit the numerous value chains of our local agricultural produce.
pcm: Plenti of di farmer and market pipo want make di border dey lock so dat dem go dey chop beta for di market wey we dey do for awa  house.

en: Consumers, on the other hand, welcomed the recent development, in anticipation that government would allow importation of rice and other food items.
pcm: Pipo wey dey chop am and some other pipo hapi wit di development and dey expect say goment go allow make dem dey import rice and other food.

en: But their expectation was shattered by governments reiteration that rice, poultry, cooking oil and other food items remained banned from importation.
pcm: But goment kon fall dia hand as im tok say rice, chicken and turkey, oil for cook and other food still dey under ban to dey import.

en: Sani Muazu Hunkuyi, an agric expert, enjoined the Federal Government not to bow to pressure and give waivers for food importation.
pcm: Sani Muazu Hunkuyi, wey be one agric expert, beg di goment make dem sumit give di pressure, allow food to dey enter.

en: Government has invested a lot in the agricultural sector and we should not allow such huge investment to go down the drain by wavering food importation in this country.
pcm: Goment don invest plenti agric sector and make we nor allow dat big investment enta water wit breeze of importation inside dis kontri

en: It is true that there is palpable fear of food crisis, but we can mitigate that through irrigation farming.
pcm: Na true say fear for food crisis don burst evriwia, but we fit reduce am wit farming wit water.

en: Besides, food importation will only worsen the already economic recession the country is battling with, Muazu said.
pcm: To dey import food go make dis economic recession wey dey di kontri worst to tackle, na im Muazu tok

en: He added that farmers would be seriously affected if government reversed its policy on food sufficiency.
pcm: E add join say yawa go gas for farmers dem if goment cancel dia policy ontop to make food plenti.

en: Why flood-resistant rice is crucial to farmers
pcm: Why rice wey flood nor dey important to farmers dem.

en: The threat to food security in Nigeria as a result of flood will soon be an issue of the past following the release of the FARO 66, a variety of rice that is resistant to flood.
pcm: Di threat ontop food for Nigeria bikos of flood go soon be tin of di past as dem release FARO 66, one type of rice wey flood no fit kari.

en: FARO 66, recently released to rice farming communities by the National Cereal Research Institute (NCRI), is a variety that has characteristics and traits that are different from what local farmers are used to.
pcm: FARO 66, wey National Cereal Research Institute (NCRI) release give farming pipo dem be type wey get some tins wey dey different from wetin farmers for here sabi before.

en: This variety is taller than other ones known to the farmers.
pcm: Dis type tall pass other one wey farmers sabi.

en: With its height, coupled with effective ecological farming management, it is capable of withstanding the stress of flood to a larger extent.
pcm: Witi how im tall and some betabeta farming mata, e get power to survive palava of flood wella.

en: Acceptability of new varieties among farmers has always been a huge challenge, and the introduction of the FARO 66 is no exception.
pcm: To kolet new tins among farmers dem dey always be big problem and as dem introduce FARO66 no dey different.

en: However, when fully embraced by the farmers, the threat to food security in terms of rice production would be reduced.
pcm: But if dem farmer kolet am finish, di threat ontop food about rice mata go reduce.

en: During this years Field Day, organised by the NCRI station in Birnin Kebbi, the capital of Kebbi State, farmers and other stakeholders were introduced to the new variety after a field trip to the institutes demonstration farm in the metropolis.
pcm: For dis year field trip wey NCRI station for Birnin Kebbi, capital of Kebbi State organise, farmers and dem oga dey introduced to dis new type afta a field trip wey dem do for di institute demonstration farm for di city.

en: At the demonstration farm, farmers were exposed to FARO 66, which withstood the stress of the recent flood, side by side with the farm of other rice varieties that were washed away by the same flood.
pcm: For di demonstration farm, farmers dey expose to FARO66, wey stand gidigba wit flood inside farm and other rice follow di same flood waka.

en: The two farms, which are situated side by side, revealed the flood disaster tolerant capability of the FARO 66 variety, as despite all stress, it grew to maturity.
pcm: Di two farm wey dey near each oda show di power to tanda wit flood wey FARO66 type get, wit all di wahala, e grow and strong.

en: On the farm of the other rice variety, only the remnants of the rice plant could be seen.
pcm: One di farm of other type of rice, na di remaining of rice wey die remain dem see.

en: Speaking to our correspondent, the head of the NCRI station in Birnin Kebbi, Andrew Shema, said the FARO 66 variety could best resist flood if planted early.
pcm: As im follow awa  news pipo talk, di oga for di NCRI station for Birnin Kebbi, Andrew Shema, say di FARO 66 go tanda wit flood if dem quick plant am.

en: He added that with its hard stem and height, if planted early, the variety could grow to a size that when flood sets in, the plant could resist the condition.
pcm: E add join say, im stem wey hard and as e tall, if dem part am quick, di type go don grow reach size wey be say if flood com, di plant nor go gree for am.

en: He said FARO 66 was released two years ago, but acceptability, as is the case with any new variety, must be gradual, noting that when it becomes widely accepted among farmers, flooding would not be a threat to rice farming any more.
pcm: He tok say FARO66 dey release two years ago but to kolet, as for di case wit any new tin, must be small small, tok say, if farmers dem don accept am wella, flood nor go be threat to rice farming again.

en: According to him, to sensitise the farmers as research on the improved variety progressed, they were carried along to appreciate the processes and results recorded.
pcm: As im take tok, to open di eyes of farmers dem as research ontop dis new type dey go front, dem carry dem join bodi to see how e dey go and to record result.

en: He added that the scientists on the research work were optimistic that if farmers were allowed to appreciate the ability of the plant to withstand flood, acceptance of the new variety among them would not only be fast but also effective.
pcm: E add join say science pipo wey dey ontop di research get sense say if dem allow farmers dem to see how dis plant fit take tanda wit flood, no be only to accept am go dey fast, to dey use sef go dey.

en: Shema, who said lack of sufficient funding had been their major constraint in the research work, called on all stakeholders to invest in the initiative for a better tomorrow as research is not only limited to the development of improved varieties but also created jobs, as well as developed the economy of a nation.
pcm: Shema wey tok say as dem nor give dem plenti moni be dia major wahala for di research work, e call stakeholders dem to kom invest ontop dia idea for beta tomorrow as di research no go only develop di new type but e go still create job, and still develop economy for di kontri.

en: He explained that public lectures were also conducted as part of the day one Field Day activities, saying the essence of introducing public lectures in this years activities is to bring to the notice of stakeholders that research only comes to fruition with sufficient funding
pcm: E explain say dem still do public lecture wey dey among program wey dem do for di first day of di field day wey dem do, e say why dem introduce public lecture join dis year program na to show stakeholders dem say nah if moni wey reach dey n aim research fit get head.

en: He appealed to well-meaning Nigerians and organisations to inject enough into research.
pcm: E beg pipo wey get mouth for Nigeria and organization to kom drop put for research.

en: The day two was on exhibition and application of technology in farming.
pcm: Di two days nah ontop to show how technology take enter farming

en: When we said flood-tolerant, we are not saying it will not be affected by flood completely.
pcm: Wen we tok say he dey tanda wit flood, we no tok say flood no go affect am patapata.

en: What we are saying is that with its characteristics and desirable trends, it would withstand flood stress to some extent.
pcm: Wetin we dey tok be say wit all di tin wey e get for bodi, e go tanda wit flood wahala reach one side.

en: FARO 66 is tolerant to flood because it is taller than FARO 44 and FARO 52.
pcm: FARO 66 go tanda wit flood wahala bikos e tall pass FARO 44 and FARO 52.

en: Its stem is also harder than the other varieties.
pcm: Im stem still hard pass other one.

en: Ecological management in term of timing for planting is key in resisting flood.
pcm: To manage sky as in to plant quickquick na im be di key to tanda wit flood.

en: Early planting saves a larger proportion of the crop when flood sets in.
pcm: To plant quickquick dey save bigbig if flood come.

en: The moment rain starts, farmers dont need to waste time.
pcm: If rain don starts, farmers dem no need to dey waste time.

en: They should immediately mobilise for planting.
pcm: Dis one go make crop dey strong and hold leg for ground wella before flood go com, as im tok.

en: This enables the crop to have good vigour and be established well before the flood comes, he stated.
pcm: Dem suppose start to dey plant sharpsharp.

en: Chelsea and Leicester charged over players clash
pcm: Dem fine Chelsea and Leichester as dem players fight

en: Chelsea and Leicester City have been charged by the Football Association (FA) following a stoppage-time clash between players and staff from both teams during their Premier League game on Tuesday, the governing body said on Thursday.
pcm: Football Association (FA)  don fine Chelsea and Leichester as dem players and staff bin fight for stoppage time for dia Premier League game on Tuesday, na so di governing body tok.

en: Three days after Leicester beat Chelsea in the FA Cup final at Wembley, the sides met again at Stamford Bridge in a match key to their hopes of finishing in the top four.
pcm: Three days after Leichester beat Chelsea for FA Cup final for Wembly, di two side meet again for Stamford Bridge for one march wey be card to dia hope to finish for top four.

en: It is alleged that both clubs failed to ensure their players and /or club officials conducted themselves in an orderly fashion and/or refrained from provocative behaviour during the 93rd minute, the FA said.
pcm: Dem tok say di two team nor get mouth tok to dia players and/abi club officials make dem do dem sef well and/abi comot hand for jagajaga behavior for di 93 minute, na so FA tok.

en: Para-athletics team charged to be worthy ambassadors
pcm: Dem tell Para-athletics team to be worthy ambassadors.

en: The Minister of Sports, Sunday Dare has charged the Nigerian Para-athletics team to Nowil, Switzerland to be worthy ambassadors of the country as they seek to qualify for the Tokyo 2020 Paralympics.
pcm: Di minister for Sports, Sunday Dare don tell Para-athletics team wey dey go Nowil, Switzerland to be worthy ambassadors of di kontri as dem dey tri to qualify enta Tokyo 2020 Paralympics.

en: The Minister gave the charge on Sunday when he bade farewell to the team for the Qualifiers at the Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport, Abuja.
pcm: Di minister tok am on Sunday wen e dey do save journey to dis team for di qualify, inside Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport, Abuja.

en: He said, Nigeria is solidly behind your bid for qualification for the Para- Athletics event in Notwil, Switzerland.
pcm: E say, Nigeria dey your back well well to qualify enta di Para- Athletics event for Notwil, Switzerland.

en: In addition, he commended the special athletes as he said There is no doubt about your abilities which you have always proved over the years.
pcm: To add, e praise dis special athletes as E tok say, Una ability no get double mind, wey una don dey show tey tey

en: You must be worthy ambassadors of our dear country by conducting yourselves very well to attain the best standards for Qualifiers.
pcm: Make una be worthy ambassadors of awa  kontri ontop to do una self well to reach di best for qualifier.

en: Dont be distracted.
pcm: No dey disturb.

en: Nigerians are solidly behind you.
pcm: Nigeria  dey your back gidigba

en: You have always made us proud and we are confident that you will not disappoint this time by reaching the qualification threshold.
pcm: U don dey do to make us do yanga and we get mind say u no go fall awa  hand dis time as u go qualify.

en: We have done our bit, now the ball is in your court to ensure that Nigerias flag flies high.
pcm: We don try small, na your hand e dey naw to see say Nigeria flag fly for up

en: 10 Athletes will be seeking to qualify in the para-athletics event taking place from 11th -17th
pcm: 10 athletes go dey look to qualify for di para-athletics wey go hapun from 11th reach 17th.

en: May 2021 at Notwil in Switzerland.
pcm: May 2021 for Notwil wey dey Switzerland.

en: Sasakawa moves to cushion COVID-19 effects on farmers
pcm: Sasakawa dey do make Corona no get power ontop farmers dem

en: Sasakawa Global 2000 (SG 2000) said it had initiated a process through which farmers are linked with commodity buyers as a way of cushioning the effect of the COVID-19 pandemic.
pcm: Sasakawa Global 2000( SG) don tok say im don find way wey farmers dem fit take colabo wit buyers to see say di wahala wey Covid-19 kos no get power ontop farmers dem

en: This was disclosed by the organisations research and training officer, Mr Benjamin Shamaki, during a media field tour they organised.
pcm: Na dis tin di research and training officer for di organization, Mr Benjamin Shamaki yarn inside one media field tour wey dem do.

en: According to him, Sasakawa has trained farmers in Kano and Gombe states on effective utilisation of the aggregator facilities, as well as linking farmer associations with prospective buyers to ensure value for their produce, as well as ensure quality of what the farmers are selling during the pandemic period.
pcm: As im take talk, Sasakawa don train farmers dem for Kano and Gombe state to dey use di aggregator facilities and to colabo di association of  dem farmer join wit buyer wey go give beta value, give dem wey dem dey plant and to see say wetin dem dey sell Corona time beta wella.

en: We have trained women farmer groups, not only in modern farming techniques but also on value addition to their produce.
pcm: We don train women wey bi farmer, no be for only new-school farming, but also to take give dia crop beta value.

en: We have encouraged them in the formation of associations, through which we successfully linked them up with buyers of their produce.
pcm: We don encourage dem ontop how dem go dey form association, ontop wetin we don successfully colabo dem wit buyers.

en: They also produced along the value chain of a particular crop, he revealed.
pcm: E tok say dem dey don still produce along di value chain of one crop

en: Similarly, the chairman of Bagwai Farmers Association, Malam Danladi Yahaya Bagwai, said farmers in the area were ready to make good use of the aggregator facilities provided for their agricultural sustainability by SG 2000, adding that they would ensure proper utilisation of the aggregator facilities.
pcm: As e be, di chairman for dem Bagwai farmer association, Malam Danladi Yahaya Bagwa tok say dem farmer for dat area dey ready to use di aggregator facilities wey SG 2000 give dem for dia agricultural stability wella, e add join say dem go see say dem use di facilities wella.

en: According to him the COVID-19 pandemic has indeed negatively affected farming activities in various states of the federation, including Kano.
pcm: As im take tok say Covid-19 don kos bad-market ontop farming for different different state for di kontri, for Kano too.

en: He added that without Sasakawas intervention, farmers in the area would have been out of business for long.
pcm: E add join say if no be for Sasakawa put hand, dem farmer for di area go don forget dia work tey tey.

en: He further revealed that during the pandemic, farmers in the area were assisted with improved seed varieties, fertilizer and pesticides, which he said had helped them tremendously during the period.
pcm: E still tok say for di pandemic time, dem give farmer for di area different different beta seed, fertilizer and otapiapia for plant wey im tok say e help dem wella for di time.

en: The chairman also stated that the introduction of an aggregator facility, which serves as service providers to eliminate some of the marketing effort issues in the area, had helped farmers to store and access their produce with ease, as well as sell with high market value.
pcm: Di chairman still tok say as dem carry aggregator facility cum, wey stand gidigba as dia help to comot some marketing palava for di area, don help farmers dem keep dia produce witout gbege and to sell for big price for market.

en: He said the aggregator facility had enabled farmers to collectively put their produce together in one centre and Sasakawa would connect them with mega companies that would buy the produce with value and in good market value.
pcm: E tok say di aggregator facility don help farmers dem gather wetin dem dey produce for one place and Sasakawa go help colabo dem wit big big companies wey go buy am for plenty money.

en: It has been on record that farmers in this area have been producing, but due to lack of proper marketing strategies, they usually ended up getting virtually small value of no value for their produce.
pcm: E don dey on record say farmers for dis area as dem no get marketing skil, e dey make dem get small value on top dia produce.

en: Sasakawa has established for us an effective aggregator centre, and it has equally provided us with the knowledge on how to effectively utilise this facility to increase our products market value.
pcm: Sasakawa don establish one aggregator centre for us,  wey dey give us wisdom wey we go take use dis facilities take make pipo buy awa  market wella.

en: No doubt our initial inability to put into practice a proper marketing strategy that will ensure effective gain in sale of our produce in the open market has negatively affected our productivity, he said.
pcm: E dey sure say as we no get marketing skil before wey go help us make moni wella for wetin we dey farm  don cause plenty kasala for us, na so im tok.

en: Similarly, according to the Sarkin Noma of Bagwai, Alhaji Bello Gurdo, in the irrigation site of Kano State, COVID-19 and its aftermath has made things harder for farmers.
pcm: As e be, Sakin Noma of Bagwai, Alhaji Bello Gurdo don tok say for di irrigation site for Kano State, Corona burst kasala for farmers dem.

en: He said the site, which is 1,562 hectares of land, had hundreds of farmers, both male and female working on it.
pcm: Im tok say di site we be 1,562 hectares of land, get hundred farmers, wey be man and woman wey dey do work on top am.

en: He added that the intervention received from SG 2000 had assisted the farmers to remain afloat during the period.
pcm: E tok am say di hand wey SG 2000 put am don help make di work of farmers dem dey berekete for di time.

en: Blast heard in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia – report
pcm: We hear blast for Ridyadh, Saudi Arabia- tori

en: An explosion was heard in the Saudi Arabia capital, Riyadh on Tuesday, according to a Reuters correspondent, but the cause of the explosion is yet to be ascertained.
pcm: We hear bomb wey blow for Saudi Arabia Capital, Ridyadh for Tuesday, as one pesin wey dey yarn tori for Reuter take talk, but watin cause am neva open.

en: Saudi-owned Al Arabiya TV cited local reports of an explosion and videos circulating on social media of a missile being intercepted over Riyadh.
pcm: Di Al Arabiya TV wey bi Saudi own don show local tori ontop one explosion wey hapun and di videos wey dey waka for internet ontop a missile wey dem double-cross wey dem stop over Ridyadh.

en: On Saturday, the Saudi-led military coalition engaged in Yemen had said it had intercepted and destroyed an enemy air target launched towards Riyadh.
pcm: One Saturday, di join-bodi of military wey Saudi dey lead don tok say dem double-cross and scatter one enemy air target wey dem do to enter Riyadh

en: Poverty of governance and illegal weapons in circulation by  Adefolarin A. Olamilekan
pcm: Governance wey dey poor and illegal weapon for wey dey spread by Adefolarin A. Olamilekan

en: Governance in Nigeria in recent times especially since the return of civil rule in 1999 increasingly attracts significant attention.
pcm: Governance for Nigeria in dis new time especially since di time wey Civil rule don return in 1999 don dey make pipo dey put eye for am.

en: The attraction is a sad tale of incessant governance failure to address the insecurity situation all over the country.
pcm: Di eye wey dem put na bad tori of di goment  wey no gree tackle security mata for di country.

en: There is a sense in which the current situation makes a case for a wider understanding and recognition of governance, especially with millions of illegal weapon circulation in Nigeria.
pcm: E get one sence wey wetin dey hapun make to take sabi governance wella, especially wit plenti plenti illegal weapon dem evriwia for Nigeria .

en: The nation is not in a palatable one, but concerns over the safety of citizens.
pcm: Di nation no dey good at all, but dey concern for di safety of im pipo.

en: There is an inherent cry for help by the people for a decent existence in terms of security of life and properties.
pcm: Pipo dey cry for help for beta security of life and dere properties

en: As of today, the menace of illegal weapons in circulation in the land is a huge threat to our economic sustenance, unity and co-existence.
pcm: As im be today, di way wey weapon dem wey dey illegal dey  plenti evri wia na serious wahala  for economic sustenance, unity and to dey togeda.

en: It is in this that we discover the nexus between governance and millions of illegal weapons in circulation being a salient matter at this point of our national life.
pcm: Na inside all dis kasala wey we take sabi wetin di link wey dey between governance and di illegal weapon wey dey evriwia be,  wey be main mata for dis time of awa  national life.

en: The current drift and drain of governance in Nigeria in the last two decades have position many Nigerians to be conscientised by the practical experience of poverty of governance.
pcm: As Nigeria dey go up and down for di last two decades don make plenti Nigerians sabi wetin be di poverty governance.

en: Therefore, it is also very imperative for us to point out what governance entails in its simple sense, as well as in the context of this piece.
pcm: As e take be like dat, e go beta for us make we sabi wetin governance be for simple sense and wetin in be for inside dis context.

en: The Oxford Advanced Learners Dictionary, Sixth Edition defines governance as an activity of controlling a country or the way in which a country or institution is controlled.
pcm: Di Oxford Advanced Learners Dictionary, Sixth Edition tok say governance na di way wey dem dey control one kontri or di way wey one kontri or institution deu dey control.

en: Thus, governance involves a process of control and controlling activity in a country, including arms and weapons in circulation.
pcm: So, governance na di process of control and controlling activity wey dey a kontri join weapon wit im circulation.

en: Again, governance can be seen as the process whereby constituted official elements wield powers, authority and enact policies concerning public life and economic decision for overall social development.
pcm: Again, governance still fit dey look as di process wey dem goment  pipo dey hold power, authority and di way wey dem dey give policy wey pertain to pesin life and economic decision for di beta beta of di pipo.

en: However, this governance process takes the in-depth application of suitable and influential decision that impacts on the management and distribution of resources that includes revenues, man and materials.
pcm: As e be, to dey run di goment  go take make dem use decision wey dey good and wey go get good impact on top di management and di sharing of resources wey include moni, pesin and material.

en: Moreso, it involves the regulation, implementation and enforcement of desirable policies for target objectives, goals and aspiration through capacity.
pcm: E go involve di regulation, implementation and enforcement for d policy wey pesin want, wey go be for objective wey get target, goals and aspiration through capacity.

en: Therefore, governance is simply controlling for desirable development result of which, safeguarding life and properties of citizens is key through exact regulations of arms and weapons is vital.
pcm: As e be, governance  na to dey control di development wey pesin want, wey be say,  to protect life and property of kontri pipo tru d regulate of arms and weapon dem be koko.

en: However, many reasons are being advanced to explain the continued inexorable poverty of governance in Nigeria.
pcm: As e be so, e get plenty reason wey explain di poverty wey never stop since for governance for Nigeria .

en: For instance, poor institutional capacity leads to government failure, so also is the wider inequality, access to justice and fairness that create a burden of oppression and repression.
pcm: For example, poor institutional capacity na im cause goment  failure, wey no make  everything  balance in di wey dem dey do justice and fairness, wey cause oppression and jagajaga for mind.

en: In addition to this, is the ever-rising provocation of nepotism and bigotry, ethnic sentiment that amputate national cohesion in decision making, coupled with negligence on the part of political representatives.
pcm: To add join dis one, na as dem dey do ojoro dey help dere family dem, as dem dey selfish, ethnic partial wey don cut to dey togeda ontop decision making troway, and as di political representative no dey too do dia work.

en: The recent alarm raised by the Chairman of the National Peace Committee (NPC) and former Military Head of State, General Abdulsallami Abubakar at a dialogue session of the committee with stakeholders at Transcorp Hilton in Abuja that over 6 million illegal weapons are currently traced to civilians, many of whom are jobless, hungry and angry.
pcm: Di mata wey di Chairman for di National peace Committee (NPC) and d former Military Head of State, General Abdulsallami Abubakar tok for Transcorp Hilton for Abuja say e pass 6 million illegal weapon wey dem fit trace to di kontri pipo, many of dem no get work and dem dey hungry and angry.

en: The number of small arms in circulation in Nigeria, in the hands of civilian non-state actors is estimated at 6,145,000, while the armed forces and law enforcement collectively account for 586,600 firearms.
pcm: Di nomba of di small small weapon wey dey Nigeria for di hand of kontri pipo wey no dey military reach 6,145,000 and armed forces and law enforcement pipo count dia own to be 586,000 weapon.

en: He went further to reveal the deplorable insecurity challenge in the country.
pcm: E still tok go front about di sekuriti problem wey dey di kontri.

en: Informing the nation that 80,000 Nigerians have died in recent months with close to three million Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) spreading across the country all because of growing dire insecurity and illegal weapons circulation in the country.
pcm: E tell all di nation say na 80,000 Nigeria pipo don die for recent month and like three million pipo  be Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) evriwia for di kontri bikos say sekuriti problem dey plenti and illegal weapon dem waka evriwia for di country.

en: He also added by saying that the security forces are not only overstretched but are under-funded, asserting that they can perform better with more sophisticated weapons, equipment and with accountable funding provided.
pcm: E kon tok say di sekuriti forces no just dey over work but dem no get moni, and e tok say dem fit do beta if dem give dem beta weapon, equipment and make dem give dem moni wey go dey accountable.

en: The concern raised by the former head of state and the chairman of National Peace Committee (NPC) stands a reason to take governance seriously over the carnage in the land.
pcm: As di forma head of state and di chairman for National Peace Committee (NPC) take shuk mouth for di mata, e don show say we suppose take governance serious ontop plenty die-die tins for di kontri.

en: Incidentally, this has shown that even those who exercise power and authority are living in fear.
pcm: Wela, e don show say pipo  wey even dey power and authority dey live for inside fear.

en: It is in this context that they must pay heed to the cry of the people for help by taming the illegal weapon circulation.
pcm: For dis side dem suppose hear cry for help of d pipo make dem try reduce as illegal weapon dem waka evriwia.

en: Moreover, a recent report on arms proliferation in Africa tagged
pcm: For onetime dem tok say na for Africa weapon dey increase pass.

en: Small Arms, Mass Atrocities & Migration in Nigeria highlighted that arms proliferation gave rise to armed groups and also led to the displacement of several Nigerians.
pcm: Small arms, Mass Atrocities & Migration for Nigeria, tok say na as weapon too dey increase na im make bring gunpipo, n aim still kos di scatascata of many Nigeria pipo.

en: Conversely, the report stated that the proliferation of arms in Southern Nigeria has led to increasing violence in the region, such as communal clashes, cultism, kidnappings, ethnic and religious clashes, and militancy in the Niger Delta.
pcm: Di report tok say na as weapon dey plenti for  Southern Nigeria n aim make kasala plenti for area like village wahala, cult, kidnapping, tribe and religion gbege,  and militancy for di Niger Delta.

en: In the same vein, the report had it that in the Northern region, due to existing state corruption, large tracts of ungoverned spaces, and mass unemployment has been responsible for rising criminality and violence in the region.
pcm: And na d same way di report tok say for Northern Nigeria side, as per say corruption don plenti for dat side, dem get plenti land wey no get pesin wey dey rule am, and dem no too get work and na dis tins don make criminal and wahala mani for dia side.

en: The report opines that the aforementioned succeeded because of the proliferation of Small Arms and Light Weapons (SALW).
pcm: Di report tok say wetin we tok before hapun bikos say Small Arms and Light Weapons (SALW) dey increase.

en: The situation calls to question, the feasibility of the National Task Force on Small Arms and Light Weapon.
pcm: Di mata dey question di feasibility of di National Task Force on top Small Arms and Light Weapons.

en: Hence, we must chart the way forward, even though it looks blink and insurmountable.
pcm: So, we must to find di way to dey go front, even say e no dey clear and we no fit settle am.

en: We must rise to the occasion to tackle illegal weapon circulation in the country with the entire government structure confronting the menace headlong at federal, state and local government.
pcm: We suppose face di mata and tackle as di illegal weapon dey dey evriwia for di kontri wit all di goment  structure wey dey tackle di mata for di federal, state and local goment  level.

en: Equally, the National Task force on Small Arms and Light Weapon and office of the National Security Adviser to the President (ONSA) must re-double their efforts in the fight against illegal arms proliferation through preventive and repressive engagement.
pcm: And as e be, di National Task Force for Small Arms and Light weapons  and di office of di National Sekuriti Adviser for di President (ONSA) must tight moremore to tackle di illegal arm wey don plenty wit to disturb and to stop am.

en: Succinctly, appropriate people-centred governance programmes and security policies are needed to incorporate not just community policing but individuals and group policing networks of intelligence sharing.
pcm: As e kon be like dis, we need program wey go teach how dem dey carry pipo for mind for governance and di sekuriti policy dey needed no be only community policing but policing for individual and group to dey share intelligence.

en: Essentially, transparency, accountability and responsibility are the key watch of governance, without this, eliminating illegal weapons in circulation is tantamount to fruitless exercise.
pcm: Di main tin na transparency, accountability and responsibility for beta governance, if dem dey, we no go fit comot all di illegal weapon wet dey evriwia.

en: Olamilekan  is a Political Economist & Development Researcher and can be reached via whatsapp
pcm: Olamilekan na political economist and development researcher and you fit reach am for Whatsapp

en: Nigeria records highest start-ups among peers — Report
pcm: Nigeria don record him highest start up among him mate - Tori.

en: Nigeria has ranked highest in start-ups among other countries in Africa, a report by fDi Intelligence, a specialist division of the Financial Times, has stated.
pcm: Nigeria don carry first for di start up among oda kontri for Africa, na one tori from fDi Intelligence, one specialist division for di Financial Times, tok am.

en: An analysis of the report by Tolu Olasoji in the Leadership newspaper indicated that while Nigeria can boast of the largest number of start-ups in the Africa technology ecosystem, it lags in other important metrics.
pcm: As Tolu Olasoji take analyse di report for inside leadership newspaper, e tok say as Nigeria fit do make mouth for di biggest numba for startup for Africa technology ecosystem, e dey back for oda metrics wet dey important.

en: The report compiled by fDi Intelligence in partnership with Briter Bridges, said investment in the continents start-up space is tiny in comparison to the global North.
pcm: The report wey di FDI Intelligence and di Briter Bridges write, tok say di investment for di continent start up space no reach di one for di global North.

en: For example, US start-ups raised $156.2bn in venture capital last year, per Pitchbook.
pcm: For example, US start up don raise $156.2bn as dem enta venture capital for last year, per Pitch book.

en: By comparison, African start-ups have raised just more than $2bn in the past two years, according to data.
pcm: And for Africa start up dem don raise just more than $2bn for Nigeria for two years, as data tok am.

en: Seventeen countries were selected for evaluation based on being home to several tech hubs, having more than 50 start-ups, and attracting investments greater than $500,000 between 2019 and 2020.
pcm: Na seventeen kontri don dem pick for di evaluation ontop house for plenti tech hub, if dem get more 50 start up, and if dey get kolet investment wey pass $500,000 for 2019 and 2029.

en: While South Africa ranked first place in the advancement of start-ups, Kenya came second.
pcm: Na South African carry first for di advancement of start up, and Kenya carry second.

en: But in terms of capacity, Nigeria had the highest volume of start-ups – over 750.
pcm: But for capacity, na Nigeria get di highest volume of start up - e pass 750.

en: South Africa came second, but its start-ups raised $241m raised in 2020, compared to Nigerias
pcm: South Africa carry second, but him start up don raise $241m for 2020, wey no be like Nigeria.
