en: The country was missing altogether in the top 10 for categories that are critical to helping a start-up thrive beyond its founding, including cost effectiveness and the level of countrywide tech talent.
pcm: Di kontri dey missing inside di top 10 of pipo wey dey important to dey maintain start-ups beyond im founding, wit cost effectiveness and di level wey di tech talent of kontri dey.

en: It also only ranked sixth for business friendliness.
pcm: E just carry numba six for business friendliness.

en: This highlights the frustrating state of conducting business in Nigeria by entrepreneurs, the analysis stated.
pcm: Dis one don show as tins take bad for pipo  wey get business for Nigeria, na wetin di analysis tok.

en: Father defiles underage daughters in Anambra
pcm: Papa sleep wit im small female pikin dem for Anambra.

en: The Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC) in Anambra has presented a 48-year-old plumber, Thomas Igbo, for allegedly raping his three underage daughters.
pcm: Di Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC) for Anambra don carry one 48 years old plumber, Thomas Igbo, say him rape im three pikin wey dey small.

en: The ages of the three defiled children are eight, three, and one and half years.
pcm: Di children wey him rape na eight years old, three years old and one and half years old.

en: Mr David Bille, the commandant of the corps in the state, equally presented one Solomon Isaac for jumping into the NSCDC premises at night hours.
pcm: Mr. David Bille, wey be di Oga for di corps for di state sef carry Solomon Isaac kom wey jump enta di NSCDC place for night.

en: Bille told journalists on Thursday in Awka that some civil society personnel on May 25, reported that Igbo was defiling his three underage daughters.
pcm: Bille tell di journalist for Thursday for Akwa say some vigilante pipo for May 25 kon repot say Igbo dey sleep wit im small small pikin.

en: When we got the report, we arrested one Thomas Igbo, a plumber, residing in Enugwu-Ukwu town in Njikoka area of the state.
pcm: Wen we hear di mata, we arrest One Thomas Igbo, one plumber wey dey live for Enugwu-Ukwu for Njikoka area for di state.

en: Our medical personnel later conducted a test and uncovered that the children were being abused sexually.
pcm: Our health pipo kon do test for di children see say na tru true say dem dey abuse dem wit sex.

en: The suspect confessed to the crime and very soon, we will conclude the investigation and arraign the suspect, Billie said.
pcm: Di suspect don confess say e dey do am and small time we go finish di investigation and we go carry am go court, be wetin Bille tok.

en: The Confession
pcm: Di confession.

en: He said that he only had carnal knowledge of the eight-year-old daughter once and used his fingers to penetrate others at different times.
pcm: He tok say na only di eight years old pikin e sleep wit one time say na im finger e dey use for di oda girls for different different time.

en: I had sex once with my eight years old daughter.
pcm: Na only one time I sleep wit my pikin wey be eight years old.

en: Others, I only used my fingers to penetrate their private parts when I am bathing them, he said.
pcm: Di remaining one, na my finger I dey use enta dia bodies wen I dey bath for dem, na wetin di man tok.

en: Igbo, from Ikoloani Igboetiti area of Enugu State, claimed that he was under the influence of alcohol the day he slept with the daughter.
pcm: Igbo way kom from Ikoloani lgboetiti area for Enugu State, tok say na ogogoro dey worry am di day wey him sleep wit hin pikin.

en: On the case of 28-year old Solomon Isaac, Billie said he was arrested for jumping in the premises of NSCDC state headquarters, Awka on May 24.
pcm: Ontop di mata for di 28years old Solomon Isaac, Bille tok say dem arrest am bikos say e jump enta di NSCDC state head quarter, for Akwa for May 24.

en: But Isaac, a native of Ejuleala Ofu Local Government Area of Kogi, claimed he was being pursued by cultists about 8 p.m. on the day he was arrested, saying I jumped into the place for safety.
pcm: But Isaac wey kom from Ejuleala Ofu Local goment  Area for Kogi, tok say na cultist dey pursue am for 8pm for di day wey dem arrest am, e tok sayI jump enta di place make I dey safe.

en: Mrs Laura Ugwuanyi, the state Coordinator of the National Human Right Commission, who was at the NSCDC office during the presentation of the suspects, expressed worry over the upsurge in rape cases in the state in recent times.
pcm: Mrs. Laura Ugwuanyi, wey be di Oga for di National Human Right Commission, wey dey for di NSCDC office for di time wey dem dey show di suspect, show say she dey wori as rape case don dey plenti for di state dis time.

en: She advised residents to always report such ills whenever they got to know about them as a way of fighting the menace.
pcm: She advice pipo  say make dem dey repot dat kain mata if dem see am, say na like dat dem fit stop am.

en: HealthPlus, Canadian firm partner on telemedicine
pcm: Health Plus, wey be Canadian firm firm partner for telemedicine.

en: Outpost Health, a Canadian digital health provider, has partnered with HealthPlus Limited to deliver its award-winning telemedicine platform in Nigeria.
pcm: Outpost Health , wey be one digital health provider for Canada, don join hand wit Health Plus Limited to do di award-winning telemedicine platform for Nigeria.

en: According to a statement by the management of HelathPlus, the partners held a meeting on the pact where Outpost Co-founders Dr. Didi Emokpare and Dr. Jude Emokpare spoke about the platform.
pcm: As e take dey for one tori of di Oga dem for Health Plus, di partner dem bin do meeting wia di two pipo  wey get Outpost, Dr. Didi Emokpare and Dr. Jude Emokpare, tok about di platform.

en: The Outpost platform connects providers, patients, payors, pharmacies, labs and health facilities globally and serves to provide seamless access and enhanced quality of care to all.
pcm: Di outpost platform go connect di provider, patient, payors, pharmacies, labs and health facilities for di world and e go help provide beta health care quality for evribodi.

en: They said there are challenges of healthcare access and industry fragmentation in Nigeria and so his platform seeks partners with the highest ethical standards and a commitment to providing innovative quality healthcare, such as HealthPlus.
pcm: Dem  tok say problem dey for health care access and industry fragmentation for Nigeria , so did platform na to find partner wey get higher ethical standard and dey committed to dey provide beta healthcare like Health Plus.

en: HealthPlus on its part said it is delighted to announce the launch of our newest innovation, the digitization of our pharmacy and retail services powered through a partnership with Outpost Healthcare.
pcm: Health Plus for im side tok say e dey hapi to tell pipo say we wan start use awa  new work, di digitization for awa  pharmacy and retail service through partnership wit di Outpost Health care.

en: It noted that through the Outpost app, customers will be able to, consult a specialist doctor via a virtual visit, digitally fulfil a prescription, maintain health records, among others.
pcm: E tok say through di Outpost application, customer dem go fit follow doctor tok  korokoro for online, fit kolet medicine and maintain beta health record.

en: Commenting, Chief Transformation Officer of HealthPlus, Chidi Okoro, said: We are excited to continue in our quest to provide the Nigerian consumers with high-quality, lifesaving, affordable products, and services.
pcm: Di Chief Transformation Officer for Health Plus, Chidi Okoro, wen im dey tok putWe dey hapi to dey do awa  tin dey go to provide di consumer dem for Nigeria wit high quality, life saving, and affordable product dem and service.

en: We will continue to make a meaningful and lasting impact by contributing our quota to the achievement of universal healthcare coverage and to increasing life expectancy for all Nigerians.
pcm: We go dey continue to dey do impact wey get mini as we go dey contribute wetin we get to see say we get di universal health care coverage and to dey increase life expectancy for all di Nigeria pipo.

en: Inside Buni-led committees tortuous journey of 9 months
pcm: For inside di wicked journey for di committee wey Buni lead for 9 months.

en: The emergence of the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) Caretaker/Extraordunary Convention Planning Committee on June 25, 2020 gave a huge relief to party members after a period of intense crisis in the party.
pcm: As di Caretaker/Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee for di ruling All Progressive Congress (APC) show face for June 25, 2020, e make di parti members put mind for ground afta fight fight wey don dey too much for di parti.

en: This was sequel to the dissolution of the Adams Oshiomhole-led National Working Committee (NWC) over an alleged abuse of office.
pcm: Did one na afta dem don scata di National Working Committe (NWC) wey di leader be Adams Oshiomhole as dem tok say dem dey abuse di office.

en: Pundits say the party under Oshiomhole was gradually going into extinction following the crisis that engulfed the system.
pcm: Pundit dem tok di parti under Oshiomhole don dey die wit di wahala wey spuns for dia.

en: The Buni-led caretaker committee was mandated by the National Executive Committee (NEC), which is the second highest decision-making organ of the party, to reconcile all aggrieved members, embark on membership drive and organise a national convention within six months.
pcm: Di caretaker committee wey Buni lead don collect work for di National Executive Committee (NEC) hand, wey be di second highest bodies wey dey make decision for di parti, say make dem settle all di fight wey dey di parti, make dem do membership drive and make dem plan one national convention for inside six months.

en: But the committees timeline was later extended by the NEC on December 8, 2020 by another six months to enable it accomplish its mandate.
pcm: But later NEC shift time timeline go December 8, for 2020 wey be by anoda six months make dem fit do evri tin wey dem give dem do.

en: The committee, on assumption of office, commenced the process of reconciliation nationwide and recorded significant milestones in the process.
pcm: Di committee, as dem enta office, don start to dey settle mata for di kontri and dem don dey so well for di process.

en: On August 23, 2020, the Buni-led committee summoned the Minister of Transportation, Rotimi Amaechi and the Minister of State for Petroleum, Timipre Sylva, to the partys national secretariat in Abuja, where they were reconciled and asked to work together for the party.
pcm: For August 23,2020, di committee wey Buni lead call di minister for transportation, Rotimi Amaechi and di minister of state for petroleum, Timipre Sylva, to di parti national Secretariat for Abuja, wia dem settle dia fight and tell dem say make dem dey work togeda for di parti.

en: Similarly, the committee received some Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) bigwigs who jumped ship into the APC following moves by the ruling party to whittle down the structures of opposition parties ahead of the 2023 general elections.
pcm: As e be, di parti kolet bigbig Peoples Democratic parti (PDP) pipo  wey jump ship enta APC afta di ruling parti don dey plan to scata all di structure of di opposition parti before 2023 general election go reach.

en: The latest defection was recorded on Thursday when Governor Ben Ayade of Cross River State dumped the PDP for the ruling party.
pcm: Di one wey spuns last na for Thursday wen di Governor for Cross River State, Ben Ayade, leave PDP kom di ruling parti.

en: Ayades defection came six months after his counterpart in Ebonyi, Dave Umahi, joined the APC.
pcm: Ayade defection spuns six months afta hin pesin for Ebonyi, Dave Umahi, son join APC.

en: Similarly, the APC has, within the period, harvested other PDP bigwigs, including a former Speaker of the House of Representatives, Yakubu Dogara; former national chairman of the PDP, Chief Barnabas Gemade; a PDP senator representing Adamawa North, Elisha Abbo.
pcm: Di APC, for di time, don collect some oda PDP pipo  wey include one former Speaker for di House of Representative, Yakubu Dogara; one former National Chairman for PDP, Chief Barnabas Gemade; one forma PDP senator wey dey represent Adamawa north, Elisha Abbo.

en: Chief Jimoh Ibrahim; a former Head of Service of the Federation, Mr Danladi Kifasi; Senator Isa Hamma Misau; Alhaji Salisu Takai; senators, members of the House of Representatives; members of state Houses of Assembly and many others also pitched tent with the ruling party.
pcm: Chief Jimoh Ibrahim; one former Head of Service for di Federation, Mr. Danladi Kifasi; Senator Is a Gamma Misau; Alhaji Salish Takai; Senator dem, members for di house of assembly and plenti pipo  kom join di ruling parti.

en: Most of the defectors attributed their decision to pitch tent with the APC to an alleged poor handling of issues and injustice in the PDP, a claim that was refuted by the top echelon of the opposition party.
pcm: Plenti pipo wey kom join APC tok say na bikos of di way wey dem dey carry mata and as dem dey do ojoro for PDP make dem comot, tok wey  one Oga for PDP tok say na lie.

en: Unveiling his scorecard recently, Buni said the committee had resolved some life-threatening challenges in 11 of its state chapters, adding that reconciliation effort was still ongoing in the party.
pcm: As Buni dey show im scorecard, e tok say di committee don settle som mata wey fit kill pesin for 11 state out of di state wey dey for APC state, say dem still dem settle mata for di parti.

en: Daily Trust
pcm: Daily Trust.

en: Saturday reports that the APC had not renewed its membership register since the initial registration exercise of 2014 despite the surge in its membership.
pcm: Saturday report say di APC neva do new membership register afta di one wey dem don do for 2014 even as dia member dey change.

en: Sequel to this, the caretaker committee, during a meeting with President Muhammadu Buhari in Aso Villa recently, got his nod to embark on nationwide membership registration and revalidation exercise which ended on March 31, 2021.
pcm: Bicos of dis, di caretaker committee, for one meeting wit Oga Presidio Muhammadu Buhari for Aso Villa, kolet permission say make im do do nationwide registration and revalidation wey don finish for March 31, 2021.

en: The Buni-led committee had pushed for the establishment of a tripartite committee to be saddled with the responsibility of enhancing communication and relationship between the executive, legislature and the ruling APC, with a view to ensuring smooth and effective service delivery to Niigerians.
pcm: Di committee tok say make dem form one tripartite committee wey go dey di middle for di executive, legislative and di ruling APC wey go make sure say dem dey serve Nigeria well well.

en: President Buhari appointed Vice President Yemi Osinbajo as the chairman of the tripartite committee.
pcm: President  Buhari don choose di Vice President Yemi Osinbajo as di Chairman for di tripartite committee.

en: The president had said an amicable resolution of conflicts in the party through regular consultations would create more understanding.
pcm: Di President don tok say as dem dey settle fight jejeli go make dem understand dia sef wells.

en: The Buni-led committee had also led the party to victory in the Ondo State governorship election.
pcm: Na di committee wey Buni lead win di governorship election for Ondo State.

en: Our reporter also learnt that the APC was amending its constitution to bring sanity and discipline among card-carrying members.
pcm: Awa reporter tok say di APC dey repair him constitution make dem fit carry discipline enta di card-carrying members.

en: A source in the party said the constitution was being amended to include, among other things, a clause that would compel its elected and appointed officers to meet with people at the grassroots, at least twice a year.
pcm: One pesin for di parti tok say dem dey repair di constitution make im get, for evri oda tin, one place wey go force di pipo  wey dem elect and di officer dem dey dem appointed make dem dey meet wit di pipo  wey dey grassroot, at least two times for one year.

en: Speaking at the partys secretariat in Abuja a few months ago, Buni said, Apart from the issue of membership registration, there are the outstanding issues of constitutional amendment.
pcm: Buni wen him dey tok for di parti secretariat for Abuja som month ago tok sayApart from di problem of di membership registration, e get som problem wey dey before about di constitution wey dem dey repair.

en: This is a matter that is as important as reconstitution of leadership, if not more important.
pcm: Dis one na mata wey dey important like di reconstitution of di leadership, if e no dey important pass am sef.

en: I believe our capacity to strengthen our rules through constitutional amendment would help us to put all the problems that led to the crisis that brought us to this point behind us.
pcm: I believe say awa  capacity to dey make awa  rule strong as we dey repair di constitution go help us reach dis point wey dey awa  back.

en: I will, therefore, invite you to take all the necessary steps to forward recommendations that will enable us to strengthen our rules.
pcm: I go invite you say make you take all di step wey dey necessary to send recommendation wey go make us make awa  rule dey strong.

en: Hurdles
pcm: Wahala.

en: Tongues are wagging over the possibility of the caretaker committee to organise an elective national convention not later than June this year.
pcm: Mouth don full ground say di caretaker committee suppose organize one elective national convention for June dis year.

en: There are twists and turns, dark clouds and anxiety as pundits are arguing that the much-touted June convention date is shaky and may hit the rocks.
pcm: We get som magomago as di pundit dem dey argue day Di June convention wey pipo tok fit no apun and e dey shake leg.

en: Impeccable sources confided in our reporter yesterday that the APC top echelon was still battling to unite members, bury internal crisis in state chapters, reach key decisions on the issue of zoning, organise ward, local government, state and zonal congresses as a prelude to the convention.
pcm: Pipu wey sabi wella don tell awa  reporter yesterday say di Oga for APC still dey struggle to make im pipo  dey togeda, make dem bury di wahala wey dey inside, make dem make decision wey consine di mata of zoning, make dem organize ward, local goment, state and zonal congress before di convention.

en: Daily Trust
pcm: Daily Trust.

en: Saturday reports that the caretaker committee has not yet constituted convention sub-committees that would help in planning and executing various tasks ahead of the convention.
pcm: Saturday report say di caretaker committee neva still set di convention subcommittees wey go help for di planning and to dey do plenti work wey dey before di convention.

en: There is an uproar over alleged plots by some party bigwigs to extend the timeline allotted to the Buni committee and shift the partys national convention beyond June.
pcm: Kasala don burst as dem tok say som big pipo  for di parti wan put more days for di timeline wey Buni committee don tok and dem wan carry di parti national convention comot for June.

en: There are concerns that barely 40 days to the expiration of the interim committees timeline, it is not yet ready to organise the national convention and congresses to elect a new crop of leaders at various levels.
pcm: Problem don dey as e remain just 40 days make di time wey dem give di committee pipo finish and dem neva dey reading to do di national convention and congress to choose new leaders for different different level.

en: The committee also has a herculean task of putting things in proper shape and organising congresses, where new ward, local government, state and zonal executives would emerge.
pcm: Di committee sef get one important work to see say evrithing  in order for di parti, make dem organize congress, wia dem go form new ward, local goment, state and zonal executive dem.

en: This is sequel to the dissolution of the partys structures from ward to zonal levels at the NEC meeting of December 8, 2020, which was held at the Presidential Villa in Abuja.
pcm: Did na bikos of how dem scata di parti structure from di ward reach di zonal level for di NEC meeting for December 8, 2020, wey dem do for di Presidential Villa for Abuja.

en: But a statement by the secretary of the caretaker committee, Senator John James Akpanudoedehe few days ago in Abuja, indicated that the party was not planning to release its schedule of activities for congresses and convention any time soon.
pcm: But inside one statement of  di secretary for di caretaker committee, Senator John James Akpanudoedehe small days ago for Abuja,  say di parti neva redi to release di time and di work wey dem go do for Congress and convention now.

en: However, there were reports in some quarters that the committee would release the timetable soon.
pcm: As in be so, den  dey  yarn for som quarters say time table go soon show.

en: Reacting, Akpanudoedehe said, The CECPC is focused and is delivering its mandate to recover, rebuild and reposition the APC, as well as achieve peace-building, true reconciliation and to give a sense of belonging to every member of the party.
pcm: Akpanudoedehe wen hin put mouth for di mata tok say di CECPC dey focus and dem dey deliver wetin dem suppose do, dem dey rebuild and dey reposition APC, dem dey kip peace and dey make pipo  wey fight for di parti  join body.

en: On Monday, May 17, 2021, the APC national secretariat resumed from Sallah break and will also resume work on several ongoing and important party activities.
pcm: For Monday, wey be May 17, 2021, di APC national Secretariat don open from Sallah holiday and dem go start to dey work on top di plenti work wey Dem dey do for dia parti.

en: As usual, we will promptly communicate the outcomes of these activities through official channels when available.
pcm: Like before, we go tok di outcom give pipo witi mouth wey pipo sabi if e don dey.

en: We have never lied on our activities, and we simply have no reason to.
pcm: We no dey lie for di work wey dey do, we no get reason to lie.

en: The consultative party leadership style instituted by Governor Mai Mala Buni as chairman of the CECPC has institutionalised the APC as a party of processes and internal democracy.
pcm: The consultative parti leadership wey Governor Mai Mala Buni form as di Chairman for di CECPC don make APC be parti wey dey run im democracy for inside.

en: But some party chieftains are worried that the party would hit the rocks if the convention is not held in June, citing legal issues.
pcm: But some big fish for di parti dey worry say di parti go spoil if dem no do di convention for June, and dem dey tok court mata.

en: There is also anxiety in the APC as controversy rages among top party leaders over which zone should produce the partys 2023 presidential candidate.
pcm: Double mind dey for APC as di pipo wey be dia oga dem dey fight on top di zone wey dem go comot pesin wey go be presidential candidate for 2023.

en: There are hints that the convention is being delayed for various issues, including zoning, lingering crisis in some state chapters, fear that some members might pull out if the outcome of the convention does not favour their interests.
pcm: We dey hear say dem dey delay di convention bicos of many tins like how dem go do di zoning, some wahala wey don dey ground for some side and  dem dey fear say some pipo go comot for di parti if wetin dem do for di convention no dey okay for dem.

en: Others say the APC is buying time to wait for the PDP to decide on zoning of its 2023 presidential ticket and chairmanship before acting.
pcm: Oda pipo tok say APC dey wait make PDP do dia zoning for di 2023 election for dia presidential ticket and di one for chairmanship before dem do any tin.

en: Daily Trust
pcm: Daily Trust.

en: Saturday reports that the PDP national convention is expected to hold in December, 2021 when the tenure of the Prince Uche Secondus-led NWC would elapse.
pcm: Saturday tok say di national convention for PDP suppose hapun for December, 2021 wen di time for di NWC wey Prince Uche Secondus dey lead go finish.

en: Discussions around alleged lack of reward system in the APC is equally generating tension and gaining momentum by the day.
pcm: Di mata wey dem dey tok say APC no dey reward him pipo sef dey cause wahala and di mata dey big evri day.

en: Party stalwarts are grumbling over the issue and asking the national leadership of the party not to allow new entrants to hijack the system but recognise and reward old members who contributed to the growth of the party.
pcm: Di pipo wey don tey for di parti don dey tok small small for di mata and dem dey tok say make dem no gree  make pipo wey just enta parti come take over ,say make dem sabi di pipo wey don tey, wey don help di parti and  make dem reward dem.

en: However, it is left to be seen whether the Buni committee would tackle all the challenges before June and organise a crisis-free national convention or get an extension of its timeline for the third time.
pcm: Make we just dey luk if di Buni committee go fit settle all di wahala before June go reach, and if dem go fit do di convention make e no get problem, abi dem go shift am go front di third time

en: Nigeria loses N3.7tr to poor cold chain logistics
pcm: Naija don loss N3.7tr for poor cold chain logistic.

en: Nigeria is estimated to be losing N3.7 trillion annually due to wastage arising from improper storage of foods.
pcm: Naija n aim dem don calculate say e dey lose N3.7 trillion evri year for di waste wey dey com ontop as dem no dey keep food well.

en: Chairman, Governing Council, Nigerian Institute of Transport Technology (NITT), Mr. John Onojeharho disclosed this while speaking at the 8th Nigeria Annual Transport Lecture held in Lagos at the weekend.
pcm: Di Chairmo for di Governing Counsel for Naijan Institute of Transport Technology (NITT), Mr. John ONojeharho, wen im bin dey tok for di 8th Naijan Annual Transport Lecture wey dem do for Lagos for weekend.

en: He said, Nigeria is ranked one percent in terms of cold chain management.
pcm: E say, Naija get one percent for di way wey dem dey manage cold chain

en: The market is huge and if properly tapped, we can save $9 billion annually by avoiding food wastage through proper storage.
pcm: Di market dey big and if dem fit run am well, we fit save like $9 billion for evri year if we stop to dey let food dey waste and we dey keep dem well.

en: Onojeharho said if the 15 million metric tonnes of perishable goods wasted annually were well preserved, inflation would drop and there would be drastic improvement in the economy.
pcm: Onojeharho tok say if we dey keep di 15 million metric tonnes of market wey fit spoil wey dey waste evri year wella, tins no go dey cost and our economy go beta.

en: He added that Nigeria ranks 110 out of 160 countries globally in the performance index of logistics.
pcm: E add join say Naija be number 110 out of 160 countries for di world inside to perform for logistics.

en: The transport expert attributed poor cold chain logistics to lack of good road infrastructure, continuity of the cold supply chain, high capital investment, power supply amongst others.
pcm: Di pesin wey sabi transport well tok say why di cold chain logistic no good na  bicos of di road wey no good, as di cold chain dey continue, high capital investment, light and like that like that.

en: Minister of Transportation, Mr Rotimi Amaechi who was represented by the Executive Director in the ministry, Mr Agbaji Francis, said there are efforts by the government to improve the transport sector.
pcm: Di minister for transportation, Mr. Rotimi Amaechi wey Mr. Agbaji Francis, di Executive Director for di ministry come represent, tok say di goment dey try make di transport sector dey beta.

en: He said in the rail subsector, 859 kilometres of standard gauge rail lines have been constructed and commissioned for commercial use in the last five years.
pcm: He tok say for di train sector, dem don do 859 kilometres train road and dem don open am inside five years wey pass.

en: Air Peace gifts passengers cards, others
pcm: Air Peace dey give him passenger card, dem odas.

en: To mark the Eid-el-Fitri celebrations, Air Peace is delighting its customers with numerous gifts in-flight.
pcm: To mark sallah celebration, Air Peace dey make dia customer hapi plenty gift as dem dey fly.

en: The Eid campaign is intended to put smiles on the faces of the customers for choosing Air Peace.
pcm: Dem do di Eid campaign say make plenty customer dey hapi say dem dey use Air Peace.

en: The campaign entails placement of gift cards in random seat pockets and during the flight, passengers are told to check the seat pockets in front of them to know if they have won a gift or not.
pcm: Di campaign be to put card scatascata for di flight, dem kon say make dem check di pocket of d seat wey dey dia front to sabi if dem win gift abi dem no win.

en: The activities started on Wednesday, May 12 and will run through the week.
pcm: Na for Wednesday, May 12 dem start to dey do dis tin and na for one week dem go do am.

en: Passengers stand a chance to win gifts such as thermo water-flask, food flasks, diaries, umbrellas, notebook bottles, remote organisers and free Health Maintenance Organisation (HMO) cards.
pcm: Di passenger fit win tins like thermo wata flask, food flasks, diary, umbrella, notebook bottle, remote organizer and free card for di Health Maintenance Organization (HMO).

en: Spokesperson of Air Peace, Stanley Olisa, reiterated the airlines commitment to offering unparalleled flight experience while also expressing gratitude to all customers for their continued patronage.
pcm: Di tok pesin tok for Air Peace, Stanley Olisa, tok say na dia work make pesin dey fly and no get any complain say im dey thank all di customer wey dey always use dem.

en: He added that this is an extension of the airlines Random Acts of Love campaign.
pcm: E add join say say na part of di way wey di airline dey do dia show show love campaign.

en: The airline initiated the campaign during Easter last month, to appreciate its teeming customers for their loyalty.
pcm: Di airline start di campaign for Easter for last month, to dey thank all dia customer wey dey always dey with dem.

en: Nigeria has low dairy consumption level — Report
pcm: Naija get low report for chop chop of diary tin.

en: Nigeria has a low dairy consumption level at 15 to 20 litres per capita in spite of its health benefits with citizens opting for other staple food, a report by the Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) of the United Nations (UN) stated.
pcm: Naija chop chop of diary tin na 15 to 20 litres per capita even as e get plenty tins wey e dey do for bodi, di pipo dey chop oda type of food, na wetin one tori of Agriculture Organization (FOA) for di United Nations (UN) tok.

en: CHI Limited, a dairy manufacturing firm in Nigeria quoted the report in a statement yesterday.
pcm: CHI Limited, wey dey produce diary food for Naija tok di report for inside one tori yesterday.

en: It said: This is partly attributable to low purchasing power of the average Nigerian household which rank milk and dairy products as non-essential luxuries and prioritise other staple foods such as rice, beans and yam.
pcm: E tok say: We fit say na bicos some Naija pipo no too dey buy milk and diary tins as per say e no too dey important, like important food wey be rice, beans, and yam cos am.

en: Towards improving the situation, CHI said it would mark its first Hollandia Dairy Day next Tuesday to drive national discourse on the health and nutrition benefits of dairy consumption.
pcm: To see say di tin change, CHI tok say e go mark dia first Hollandia Dairy Day for next week Tuesday to make pipo sabi di benefit wey dey for pipo wey dey chop diary food.

en: The day which will be marked through a conference with the theme: Dairy Nourishment to Support Healthy Living, is the first of such by a single company.
pcm: Di day wey dem go mark inside one conference witi di theme: Diary Nourishment to Support Healthy Living, be di first time wey one company go do

en: Chi said the physical and hybrid conference would feature presentations, interviews and panel discussions from health experts and nutritionists as they provided insights and shared perspectives to guide informed decisions about dairy consumption as part of a daily balanced diet.
pcm: CHI tok say di conference go dey with plenty presentation, interview, tok tok from di pipo wey sabi health and food mata, as dem go dey tell pipo how di dairy food dey dey part for pesin wey wan dey chop balance diet.

en: The company  stated that, By provoking the conversations and stimulating public action/intervention, Hollandia aims to drive consciousness for dairy consumption and its importance to achieving optimum health, and to get many more Nigerians drinking, using and consuming dairy products.
pcm: Di company tok say as dem dey tok di mata and dem dey make pipo dey tok, Hollandia wan make di pipo sabi say e good make dem dey chop dairy food for beta health and to make plenty Naija pipo to dey use am.

en: Dairy foods such as milk and yoghurt contain essential nutrients, including Vitamins A and D, Zinc and Protein which support immune function, especially as Nigeria and other countries battle the COVID-19 pandemic.
pcm: Dairy food like milk, and yoghurt get som beta tins inside am like Vitamin A and D, Zinc and Protein wey dey make bodi atak sickness, especially as Naija and som country dey try fight Covid-19.

en: 2023 polls:  PDP asks INEC to transmit results electronically
pcm: 2023 poll: PDP dey tok say make INEC put di result for inside computa.

en: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) has asked the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) to conduct and transmit results of the 2023 general elections electronically.
pcm: Di Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) don tok say make di Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) kari komputa do di 2023 general election and di result.

en: The partys position is predicated on INECs announcement of its readiness to conduct online (electronic) registration of voters for future elections in the country.
pcm: Wetin di parti tok na bicos say INEC don announce say dem dey readi to do online registration for di pipo wey go dey vote for di kontri for future.

en: The party, in a statement on Tuesday by its National Publicity Secretary, Kola Ologbondiyan, said since INEC is now in the position to deploy technology to conduct online registration of voters, which entails electronic transmission of voters data to its central server, the commission can also conduct an electronic transmission of results directly from the polling units to its central server.
pcm: Di parti, inside one tori wey di National Publicity Secretary for di parti, Kola Ologbondiyan tok for Tuesday, e tok say as INEC don get power to dey use technology dey do election to dey register di pipo wey go vote, wey be to kari di data of voters go for dia central server, dem go fit send di result from di polling unit enta dia central server sef.

en: Our party calls the attention of the commission to the fact that it no longer has any excuse not to employ the direct transmission of results from polling units, which will ensure credible elections by eliminating manipulations, alterations, switching and disappearance of election results during manual collation processes.
pcm: Our parti dey call di commission say e no get excuse pass to open result direct from polling unit wey go make sure say election go well, and to comot magomago, to dey change hand, to dey switch, disappear of result for di manual counting style.

en: The PDP insists that if INEC can use the electronic platform for registration of voters, it could as well deploy the same technology for electronic transmission of results in future elections including the 2023 general elections.
pcm: Di PDP don tok say if INEC fit use computa do registration for di voters, dem fit use am count di result for election wey dey come for 2023 and di oda one wey go com for future.

en: Our party, however, urges INEC to ensure that the online registration of voters is credible, transparent and not open to the manipulations of desperate politicians.
pcm: Our parti still dey tell INEC say make di registration on top computa dey good make e no get any kain magomago of politician we dey despirate.

en: The PDP also calls on the APC leadership in the National Assembly to know that it has no further pretext to continue to sit on the Electoral Act
pcm: Di PDP stiil dey call di lida dem for APC for di National Assembly say make dem know say dem no get any reason again to dey sit down on top di Electoral Act.

en: Amendment bill and frustrate genuine efforts to ensure credible, free and fair elections in our country, the PDP said.
pcm: Ammendment bill and to work wella to see say election dey good and free and fair for we kontri, na so PDP tok.

en: Kidnappers kill Minor after collecting N5m naira ransom from parents in Kaduna
pcm: Dem kidnapa kill one small pikin afta dem don collect N5m for im parent.

en: A boy kidnapped from his parents home in a Kaduna suburb was found dead, seven days after he was taken and N5 million ransom paid for his release.
pcm: Dem tif one pikin from im papa house for Kaduna but dem see am wey e don die afta seven days wey dem kari am, and dem don pay N5 million to take release am.

en: Muhammad Kabir, the victim, who was taken from Badarawa suburb of Kaduna North local government area, is believed to have been killed by his kidnappers.
pcm: Muhammad Kabir, di pesin wey dem kari for Badarawa, Kaduna North local government, na im dem tok say pipo wey tif am kill.

en: His body was found in drainage in Kano after a weeklong search.
pcm: Dem see him bodi for inside gutter afta dem don dey find am for one week.

en: One of the arrested suspects leading the police to the drainage where the body was found
pcm: One pesin wey dem catch na him kari dem go di gutter wey dem take see am.

en: Sources in the area believe a neighbour connived with another resident, an ex-military personnel, to kidnap the boy.
pcm: Pipo wey dey di area believe say na one neighbor plan witi anoda pesin wey don dey military before take tif di boi.

en: Police have arrested three people, including the said neighbour, in connection with the kidnap and murder of Kabir.
pcm: Police don arrest three pipo, witi di neighbor wey get hand  fot di tif and kill of Kabir.

en: Sources in the community also told Daily Trust that immediately the boy was declared missing,  a search for him was done for days before a call came in from the kidnappers demanding N50m, and then later reduced the amount to N35m before finally agreeing to N5m.
pcm: Pipo for di area tell Daily Trust say as dem tok say dem no see di boy, dem don dey find am for plenti days before di kidnapa dem call dey ask N50m, but dem later reduce d moni go N35m before dey kon later gree N5m laslas.

en: Abdulrahman Kabir Magayaki, a brother to the victim, told Daily Trust that the late Kabir was taken away from their house to Zaria from there to Kano State where his body was retrieved after the ransom was paid.
pcm: Abdulrahman Kabir Magayaki, wey be di broda  of di pesin wey die, tell Daily Trust say dem carry di Kabir wey die from dia house go Zaria and from dia go Kano State wia dem see him bodi afta dem don pay di moni finish.

en: One of the suspects that took the boy away was our neighbour while the ex-military personnel was also a resident in the community.
pcm: One of di pipo wey be suspect wey kari di boy comot na our neighbor as di pesin wey don be military before dey live for di community.

en: They took him to Zaria from there to Kano where his body was retrieved inside drainage after they collected 5 million naira ransom, he said.
pcm: Dem carry am go Zaria and from dia dem carry am go Kano wia dem see him bodi for inside gutter afta di kinapa dem don collect 5 million naira, na so e tok.

en: He said the victims body was brought back to Kaduna and buried according to Islamic rites on Saturday.
pcm: He tok say dem carry di bodi com back Kaduna for Saturday and dem bury am as muslim take dey bury pesin.

en: Another resident said the victim must have been killed after he recognised the faces of his abductors since they are all living in the area.
pcm: Anoda pesin wey dey live for di area tok say dem fit kill di boy bicos say e don sabi pipo wey kari am bicos dem dey live for disame area.

en: Details of how the suspects were apprehended remain sketchy but they led the police to where the body was dumped.
pcm: Di tori as dem catch all di suspect no dey clear but na dem carry di police go wia dem put him bodi.

en: Kaduna State Police Command Spokesman ASP Mohammed Jalige who confirmed the incident said the three suspects confessed to the crime but said he cannot comment on the military background of one of the suspects until investigation is concluded.
pcm: Di tok pesin for di Kaduna State Police Command, ASP Mohammed Jalige wey confam wetin apun tok say di suspect don confess say na dem but dem no fit tok di mata for di pesin wey don dey military before until dem don confam.

en: Nadal, Djokovic eye history as Roland Garros embraces quiet night in
pcm: Nadal, Djokovic dey look history for eye as Roland Garros don dey like di night wey dey quiet.

en: Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic will set their sights on more Grand Slam history at Roland Garros as the French Open embraces a new and eerily empty era of nighttime tennis.
pcm: Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic go see plenty Grand Slam for Roland Garros as di French Open don start one new and empty era wey be, tennis for nighttime.

en: The 14th title in Paris for Nadal would take him to a record-setting 21st major, surpassing the mark he shares with Roger Federer who has already written off his hopes of adding to his lone success in the French capital back in 2009.
pcm: Di numba 14 title for of Paris for Nadal go carry am go 21 major wey be record, as e pass di mark wey e dey share with Roger Federer who don already comot mind to add join im own success wey dey for im for di French Capital for 2009.

en: Djokovic, the champion in 2016, can move to 19 Grand Slam titles with victory.
pcm: Djokovic wey be di Champion for 2016 fit move go di numba 19 Grand Slam title witi winning.

en: That would make the world number one the first man in over half a century to win all four majors on multiple occasions.
pcm: Na dat one go make di numba one man for world be first pesin to win all di four major for plenty time for inside time wey pass half century.

en: Nadal arrives in Paris buoyed by having defeated Djokovic in the Rome Masters
pcm: Nadal reach Paris as e get ginger say e don beat Djokovic for di Rome Masters.

en: final in what was the pairs 57th meeting.
pcm: final for wetin dey for di Pairs 57th meeting.

en: It was Nadals 10th title in the Italian capital.
pcm: Na Nadal numba 10 title for di Italian capital be dat.

en: Not that he was reading too much into the statistics as far as Roland Garros is concerned.
pcm: No be say dey read too much inside di statistics wey consine Roland Garros.

en: I think I can work on a couple of things that I can do a little bit better, he insisted.
pcm: I think say I fit work on top somtins wey I fit do pass as I dey do now, he tok.

en: I just need to keep going.
pcm: I just nid to still dey move.

en: I know what I need to work on and Im going to do it.
pcm: I sabi wetin I for do and I go do am.

en: Work, relax mentally, and work the right way.
pcm: Work, relas your brain, and dey work as e suppose be.

en: At last years delayed Roland Garros, Nadal swept past Djokovic in straight sets in the final.
pcm: For di last year Roland Garros wey dey delayed, Nadal move pass Djokovic for straight set for di final.

en: It was Nadals 100th win at the tournament against just two losses since his 2005 title-winning debut.
pcm: Na Nadal 100 win for di tournament wey him play with only lose since im winning for 2005.

en: Giving Djokovic hope, however, is the knowledge that he was responsible for one of those losses, in the 2015 quarter-finals.
pcm: To dey give Djokovic hope, na as dem sabi say na him cause as dem loose for di quarter final for 2015.

en: He is also a four-time runner-up although three of those defeats in the championship match came against the Spaniard.
pcm: E don also be runner-up for four time even as  three for lose for di championship come as e follow di Spainard play.

en: 2022 govship: Fayose endorses Ekiti PDP chair
pcm: 2022 governor mata: Fayose don confam di PDP chair for Ekiti.

en: A former governor of Ekiti State, Ayodele Fayose, has anointed Bisi Kolawole, the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) chairman in the state as his preferred candidate for the 2022 governorship election in the state.
pcm: One former governor for Ekiti State, Ayodele Fayose, don anoint Bisi Kolawole who be di Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) chairman for di state as pesin wey im like for di 2022 governorship election for di state.

en: Kolawole, a former house of assembly member, was officially presented to Fayoses supporters across the 177 wards to prepare a solid ground for his emergence in the primary.
pcm: Dem don carry Kolawole, wey be member before for di house of assembly, na im dem show dem Fayose pipo for all di 177 ward to dey prepare ground wey dey strong for am for di primary election.

en: Fayose described Kolawole as a bridge-builder, one who could bring in a better future for Ekiti and the party, adding that he was our collective project.
pcm: Fayose tok say Kolawole na bridge-builder, pesin wey fit carry beta future com for Ekiti and for di parti, say e be project wey evribodi go join hand do.

en: Joy and sadness at Liverpool
pcm: Na Jolification and sadnees dey Liverpool.

en: Liverpool ended the season on a high note having qualified for the Champions League with a third place finish.
pcm: Liverpool finish di season well as dem qualify for di Champions League for third palce.

en: Regrettably the season also ended on a sad note with Liverpools excellent Georginio Wijnaldum departing for Barcelona.
pcm: Di tin wey no good be say, Georginio Wijnaldum wey be one correct player for Liverpool don leave dem go Barcelona.

en: I am told he has agreed a two-year deal.
pcm: Dem tell me say e don gree two years deal.

en: He will be difficult to replace and has been Liverpools best player this year.
pcm: E go dey hard to find pesin wey go be like am as e don be di best player for Liverpool dis year.

en: Gini has played in all 38 Premier League matches for the Reds and his reliability reminds me of Steven Gerrard who was also a hard act to follow.
pcm: Gini don play for all di 38 Premier League match for di Red and as e dey sure, dey always remind me of Steven Gerrard who no dey easy to follow.

en: He said a few days ago, Im fighting against tears right now.
pcm: Som days before, e tok say, I dey follow tears drag  now.

en: The people in Liverpool have shown me love during my five years here.
pcm: Di pipo for Liverpool don show me love for di five years wey I don dey here.

en: I will miss them.
pcm: I go miss dem.

en: Jurgen Klopp knows he has to go into the transfer market and is currently working with his scouts and backroom team to identify who would be good enough to slot into the team.
pcm: Jurgen Klopp sabi say im suppose go di transfer market and im dey work with im pipo make dem sabi who go fit enta di team.

en: Peps favourite celebratory moment
pcm: Di celebrity moment wey Pep like pass.

en: Following their success at winning the Premier League title and finishing off with a 5-0 victory against Everton, Manchester City players, staff and the manager went into full party mode.
pcm: As dem don win for Premier League and dem beat Everton 5–0 finish, Manchester City player dem, staff, and di manager enta jollification.

en: Alcohol flowed, Pep Guardiola could be seen smoking a celebratory cigar and singing along to super band Oasis.
pcm: Alcohol dey plenti, pesin fit see Pep Guardiola as im dey smoke cigar and im dey follow super band Oasis sing.

en: Peps favourite moment of the evening?
pcm: Di evening wey Pep like pass.

en: It was 11pm and 15 pizzas were delivered from a local takeaway.
pcm: Na 11 for night and dem carry 15 pizza come from one local takeaway.

en: And Pep was allowed first choice of his favourite topping!
pcm: And dem give Pep di topping wey im like pass make e first chop am.

en: Arsenal must decide about Willock
pcm: Arsenal suppose tok about Willock.

en: Discussions are already taking place behind the scenes at Arsenal regarding the future of Joe Willock.
pcm: Dem don dey tok for back for Arsenal ontop Joe Willock future.

en: The 21 year-old has progressed superbly this season, both physically and mentally, whilst on loan to Newcastle and he equalled club legend Alan Shearers record of seven goals in seven games.
pcm: Di boy wey be 21 years old don improve wella for dis season, fro im body and for im brain as dem borrow am to Newcastle and e don meet di record of Alan Shearer wey be seven goal for seven game.

en: Some would say it has been a one man show by Willock which propelled Newcastle up the league from a perilous position close to relegation.
pcm: Some pipo say na only Willock carry Newcastle go front for di league from di place wey no good wey dem for don go sit down.

en: Mikel Arteta is trying to decide whether to extend Joes loan period or bring him back to the Emirates where the danger is that he could spend most his time on the bench which could destroy his new found confidence.
pcm: Mikel Arteta dey try reason whether make im put days for di borrow wey dem borrow am abi to kari am com back Emirate, but di danger be say e fit dey ontop bench for plenty time and fit spoil as e dey get mind

en: Gareth still wont reveal his plans
pcm: Gareth no go still tok wetin im dey plan.

en: This week I tried to learn for you Gareth Bales intentions for next season
pcm: For dis week I try say make I learn work from di tin wey Gareth Bale dey plan for di next season.

en: but he is playing his cards very close to his chest.
pcm: But him dey tight for im mata.

en: No matter how much I tried, Gareth would only say he has made up his mind what is happening now
pcm: As I dey try, Gareth go just tok say he don lock up for wetin dey hapun now.

en: his loan period from Real Madrid to Spurs has ended but if he let his secret out it would cause chaos.
pcm: Im loan time for Real Madrid go Spurs don finish but if im tok im secret give any bodi, kasala go burst.

en: He just kept smiling.
pcm: E jus dey laff.

en: Gareth then flew back to Spain by private jet and joined his family who have remained at home in Madrid during his time in the UK.
pcm: Gareth fly go Spain back for inside private jet go join bodi with im family wey don dey house for Real Madrid as im dey UK.

en: Spurs do not have a loan extension option or one to buy him outright and therefore Chairman Daniel Levy would have to renegotiate a new deal with Real Madrid if he wants Gareth for next season which is his final contracted year to the Spanish side.
pcm: Spurs no fit extend di loan  for im abi make dem buy am, na why di Chairman Daniel Levy go follow Real Madrid tok again if dem wan Gareth for di season wey dey come, wey be im last year for di contract for di Spanish side.

en: Rumours about Spurs head coach
pcm: Tori about di head coach for Spur.

en: I am receiving rumours from Tottenham that there has already been contact with Roberto Martinez regarding the managerial role.
pcm: I dey hear tori for Tottenham say dem don follow Roberto Martinez tok say make im be manager.

en: Martinez is currently leading Belgium in the Euros but is keen to return to club management.
pcm: Na Martinez bin dey lead Belgium for Euros now but im wan com back to manage di club.

en: Spurs have publicly said they are not interested in Martinez however the rumours I am picking up are strong.
pcm: Spurs don tok am for outside say dem no want Martinez but di tori wey I dey hear dey strong.

en: Moyes addresses West Ham fans
pcm: Moyes follow West Ham fans dem tok

en: I was amused by West Hams manager David Moyes response to their successful bid for European football next season.
pcm: Wetin West Ham manager David Moyes tok for di bid enta di European ball for next season laf me.

en: There were 10,000 fans in the London Stadium and after West Ham beat Southampton 3-0
pcm: Na 10,0000 pipo wey like West Ham for London stadium afta dem beat Southamton 3-0.

en: he addressed them by saying, Make sure you are all vaccinated and get your passports out because were going to Europe!
pcm: E follow dem tok say, Make sure sure una collect di injection kon kari una passport out bicos say we dey go Europe!

en: West Ham are about to reward Moyes with a new three-year contract.
pcm: West Ham wan reward Moyes witi anoda contact wey go be for three years.

en: Edinson explains his motivation
pcm: Edison don tok wetin dey ginger am.

en: Edinson Cavani has been talking about his role at Manchester United.
pcm: Edison Cavani dondey tok about wetin im dey do for Manchester United.

en: Having signed a new one year extension to his contract he explained his motivation at being the senior player behind the scenes at Old Trafford.
pcm: As im don sign anoda one year contract, e tok wetin dey always ginger am as im be senior player wey be backbone for Old Trafford.

en: He said this week, Ive always been a student of football.
pcm: For dis week, im tok say, I dey always be student for ball.

en: Throughout my whole career, Ive tried to learn and absorb positive things that could make me a better player and a better team-mate
pcm: For my career, I don try to dey learn good tins wey fit make me be beta player and beta team mate.

en: and I try to show that with the team.
pcm: And I dey always show am give di team.

en: Nowadays, Im the oldest player, the elder statesman in the team and that is a great motivation for me.
pcm: Na me be di player wey old pass, di statesman wey big pass for di team and na confam ginger for me.

en: It pushes me during training sessions, it pushes me when I go out and play a match and compete.
pcm: E dey always ginger for traning and e dey ginger me if I go outside go play one match.

en: So I try and enjoy it and work hard for my team
pcm: So I dey always try to dey injoi am and to dey work wella for my team.

en: and I have to set an example.
pcm: And I supposed be example.

en: I think that you set an example with your behaviour, how you compete, doing your best for your team, always being there to train and trying to be the best player in training sessions.
pcm: I think say you dey set example with di way wey you dey behave, how you dey compete, as you dey take work well well for your team, as you dey always dey dey training and as you dey try be di player wey good pass for training.

en: Is Werner good enough to play for Chelsea?
pcm: Shey Werner dey good reach to play for Chelsea?

en: Chelsea striker Timo Werner has run out of chances and
pcm: Di striker for Chelsea, Timo Werner, don enta one chance.

en: Blues coach Thomas Tuchel is looking around Europe for new talent capable of scoring regularly.
pcm: Di coach for di Blues Tuchel don dey look about for Europe for fresh talent wey dey capable to dey score wella

en: Werner is Chelseas joint leading scorer with 12 goals and 14 assists this season but only six of these have come in the Premier League and the German has missed a large number of clear-cut chances.
pcm: Na Werner di pesin wey score pass for Chelsea as im get 12 goal wey e don score and 14 assist but na only six of dis don com for Premier League and dis pesin wey from Germany don miss plenti chances.

en: Chelseas other main striker Tammy Abraham is out of favour and is looking to leave which leaves Tuchel with the task of finding a replacement.
pcm: Di second striker for Chelsea, Tammy Abraham don enta one chance too and im dey find as e go comot wey make Tuchel dey find pesin wey go replace am.

en: Whether or not Werner is sold is yet to be decided however Romelu Lukaku is having an excellent season at Inter Milan with 23 goals and  Erling Haaland has scored a goal every 93 minutes with a total of 39 goals in 40 games for Dortmund.
pcm: Whether to sell or never sell Werner, Romelu Lukaku dey injoi beta season for Inter Milan with 23 goal and Erling Haaland don score one goal for evri 93 minute wey all im goal kon be 39 for 40 games wen im dey Dortmund.

en: Both are on Chelseas radar.
pcm: Di two of dem dey Chelsea eye

en: The Blues clearly need to find a new Didier Drogba and owner Roman Abramovich has promised the funds to make it happen.
pcm: Di blues don need to find new Didier Drogba and owner Roman Abramovich don tok say im go give money to make am hapun.

en: 36 year-old Fernandinho set to stay at City
pcm: Fernandinho wey be 36 years old don tok say im go stay for City.

en: Despite his 36 years, Fernandinho remains a player
pcm: As im don be 36 years, na player Fernandinho still be.

en: Pep Guardiola wants in his squad.
pcm: Pep Guardiola want im for im squad.

en: The midfielder has played 34 times this season, scored one goal and made two assists.
pcm: Di midfielder don play for 34 times  dis season, im score one goal and im do two assist.

en: His main quality is being able to dominate the centre of the pitch and foresee what opponents are going to do and stop them.
pcm: Wetin im sabi do pass no how im dey always control di pitch and im dey always dey see wetin di opponent wan do and e go stop dem.

en: Fernandinho joined City in 2013 from Shakhtar Donetsk and Pep has kept him at the heart of this team since he joined in 2016.
pcm: Fernandinho enta di City for 2013 from Shaktar Donetsk and Pep donkeep am for di heart for team since 2016 wey im join.

en: He was also handed the club captains badge following David Silvas departure.
pcm: And dem give am captain as David Silva comot.

en: In recognition of his leadership and importance Manchester City have extended his contract for another year.
pcm: To take recognize im leadership and importance Manchester City done shift im contract witi anoda year

en: The pressure on Guardiola to find another holding midfielder has now eased but it is Citys intention to look for a permanent replacement as Fernandinho approaches retirement.
pcm: Di wahala on top Guardiola to  find anoda midfielder don reduce but na wetin City get for mind to find pesin wey go dey permanent as Ferrnandinho go soon retire.

en: Amazing fact about Leicester.
pcm: Tori wey fit tear mouth wey consine Leicester.

en: I was speaking with Leicester this week and my contacts pointed out an amazing fact.
pcm: I dey foolow Leicester tok for dis week and I hear tori wey fit tear mouth about am.

en: Leicester have just missed out on a top four Champions League qualification place for next season and yet they spent 242 days in the top four of the Premier League table whereas qualifiers Manchester United were in the top four for only 155 days, Manchester City 131 days,
pcm: Liecester just miss di top four for Chapions League qualification for di season wey dey come and dem done use 242 days for di top four Premier League table as Manchester United wey dey di top four dey dia for only 155 days and Manchester City ns 131 days.

en: Liverpool 140 days and Chelsea only 103 days.
pcm: Liverpool na 140 days and Chelsea na 103 days.

en: Leicester are a fantastic family club with genuinely nice people working there
pcm: Leicester na koret family club wey get beta pipo wey dey work for dia.

en: and I am sorry they have, once again, missed out on the top prize.
pcm: And I dey sorry say dem don miss for di top prize again.

en: Olusegun Ajuwon: Its wrong for sports ministries to concentrate only on football
pcm: Oluwasegun Ajuwon: E dey wrong make di sport ministry to put eye for only ball.

en: The Chairman of Aso Table Tennis Club, Dr. Olusegun Ajuwon has said too much attention being paid to football by sports ministries and administrators
pcm: Di Chairmo for Aso Table Tennis Club, Dr. Olusegun Ajuwon don tok say di ministry for sport and di administrator don too put eye on top ball.

en: is detrimental to the existence of other games.
pcm: E dey bad for di oda game wey dey.

en: Speaking recently in Abuja, the table tennis enthusiast reiterated the need for corporate organisations and individuals to sponsor more table tennis tournaments.
pcm: As im dey tok from Abuja recently, di pesin wey dey tokabout Tennis tok say dem corporate organisations and individuals twey go fit sponsor more table tennis tournaments.

en: Ajuwon also spoke on efforts his club is making to develop the game in the FCT and beyond.
pcm: Ajuwon don tok say hinclub dey try make dem develop di game for FCT and beyond.

en: Youve been so committed to the game of table tennis.
pcm: You don committed to table tennis game.

en: Where do you draw your inspiration?
pcm: Wetin dey always ginger you?

en: I cant tell exactly what the motivation is all about.
pcm: I no fit tell you wetin di ginger be.

en: All I can say is that I like the game.
pcm: Wetin I fit say be say I like to dey play di game.

en: I like the game of table tennis.
pcm: I like to dey play table tennis.

en: It is a game that is easy to play.
pcm: Na di game wey dey easi.

en: What I mean by this is that you dont need costly gadgets to play table tennis.
pcm: Wetin I mean be say, you no nid any tin wey wey cost do play table tennis.

en: I started playing table tennis in my school hostel.
pcm: Na for my hostel for school I begin to dey play table tennis.

en: The school built concrete slabs for us to iron clubs.
pcm: Di school do concrete slabs  for us to take dey iron cloth.

en: But that became our first table tennis board.
pcm: But na im turn our first table tennis board.

en: We would put two tins of peak milk and a stick to make a net.
pcm: We dey always put two pangolo and one stick make e be net.

en: We would then use kpako (wood) or cardboard to produce bats with which we played the game.
pcm: We go use kpako or cardboard do bats wey we go use play di game.

en: Balls were always available for us to play.
pcm: Ball dey always dey wey we go paly.

en: I think that is where I derived my inspiration for the game of table tennis.
pcm: I dey think maybe na where I see ginger to take play tennis

en: I had the opportunity to play golf but I think it is for rich people.
pcm: I get chance to play golf but e be like say na for rich pipo.

en: So I settled for table tennis due to its simplicity and effectiveness in terms of exercise.
pcm: So I face table tennis bicos say e dey simple and e good for exercise.

en: Table tennis is one of the safest games one can play.
pcm: Table tennis na one of di game wey dey safe pass wey pesin fit play.

en: Would you say enough effort is being made by the appropriate authorities to develop the game of table tennis in Nigeria?
pcm: Shey you go tok say dem dey try to dey develop di game of table tennis for Naija?

en: I am not a fan of Big Brother Nigeria, BBN, but I can see that in their last edition, they promoted table tennis.
pcm: I no too like Big Broad Naija, BBN, but I see say dem dey promote table tennis for do last one wey dem do.

en: Anytime they were free they played table tennis.
pcm: Any time wey dem dey free na table tennis dem dey play.

en: It is wrong for the ministry of sports at both the federal and state level to concentrate only on football.
pcm: E dey wrong for ministry for sport for di state and di federal level to put eye for only football.

en: I think it is wrong because it is not everybody who can play at the highest level.
pcm: I think say e dey wrong bicos say no be evri bodi fit play for di high level.

en: But table tennis can keep so many people engaged.
pcm: But table tennis fit make plenti pipo dey busy.

en: Paying too much attention to football is wrong but it has become a tradition.
pcm: To too dey put eye for football wrong but e don be normal tin.

en: And where we copied football from, there is so much pool betting in Europe, especially in the UK.
pcm: And di place wey we from copy football, dem too dey bet for Europe, especially for UK.

en: There is so much betting around the game that is why it is so popular.
pcm: Betting dey too much for di game and na why evri bodi sabi am.

en: Here in Nigeria, we are so blessed with talented youths in table tennis
pcm: Here for Naija, we dey bless witi youth dem wey sabi table tennis well well.

en: so we should be able to domesticate it.
pcm: So make we try dey do am for our house.

en: It is easy to start.
pcm: E dey easi to begin.

en: And we can engage so many people at any time.
pcm: And we fit put plenti pipo for dia for any time.

en: This is my appeal.
pcm: Na wetin I dey beg for be dis.

en: Would you say there are enough tournaments to keep the players busy?
pcm: Shey you go tok say tournament dey plenti to make di player dem dey dey busy?

en: We should pay more attention to hosting more competitions at regular intervals.
pcm: Make we put eye for how to dey host competition evri time

en: It doesnt have to be so big like bringing together all the states like Aso Table Tennis Club is doing.
pcm: E no must to dey big but make we dey carry all di state come like wetin Aso Tennis Club dey do.

en: It can be local but let it be a constant thing like every month or every two months, there is a competition.
pcm: E fit be local but make we dey do am like that for evri month abi evri two month, competition go dey.

en: Among other benefits, this will help keep the kids away from social vices.
pcm: Inside other benefit, dis one go help comot di eyes of dem pikin for things wey no good

en: How much is Aso Table Tennis club contributing to the growth of the sport in the FCT?
pcm: Na how much di Aso Tennis Club dey contribute give say make sport grow for FCT?

en: Before we involved other states, this competition was exclusively for the FCT.
pcm: Before we kari dioda states join, dis competition dey only for FCT.

en: After some time, we began to involve neighbouring states.
pcm: Afta time don pass small, we start to dey call di states wey dey near us put.

en: At the moment, what we do is to get a coach in the FCT to go round the secondary school to publicise this competition.
pcm: For did time, wetin we go do be say we go find one coach for FCT wey go dey go all di secondary school to tell dem about di competition.

en: Ajoke Ojomo and three of her mates graduated from a secondary school here in the FCT.
pcm: Ajoke Ojo and three pipo wey be her mate gada finish from one secondary school here for FCT

en: They were discovered through this tournament.
pcm: Na witi dis tournament we dem sabi dem.

en: So the Aso table tennis championship is for the FCT and Abuja people should take full advantage of it.
pcm: So di Aso table tennis championship na for di FCT, make di pipo wey dey Abuja use am well.

en: The tournament is not going to leave Abuja.
pcm: Di tournament no go comot for Abuja.

en: Are there any concrete plans to ensure that this tournament is held annually?
pcm: Any plan dey wey go make am dey sure say dis tournament go be evri year?

en: What I know for sure is that it will continue to hold because we are getting more and more people who are interested and have the means to support us.
pcm: Wetin I sabi be say e go dey continue bicos say we don dey see plenti pipo wey don like am and get power to support us.

en: They are willing to give.
pcm: Dem dey readi to give.

en: It may also interest you to know that what we use in hosting this competition, big as it may sound, is not so much.
pcm: E go do you for bodi say to sabi say  wetin we dey use do dis competition, as e be like say e big, no reach any tin.

en: Our budget is below N5m.
pcm: Our budget no reach N5m.

en: And I am sure one year is enough to raise N5m.
pcm: And I dey sure say one year reach to garther N5m.

en: So there is every assurance that the Aso table tennis championship will continue to hold every year.
pcm: So e dey sure say di Aso table tennis championship go dey hapun for evri year.

en: At the moment, how many corporate organisations are sponsoring Aso table tennis tournament?
pcm: As e dey so, na how many company dey put money down for di Aso table tennis tournament?

en: For the 2021 edition, we got a big sponsor but we are not mentioning his name.
pcm: For di 2021 own, we get one big sponsor but we no go tok him name.

en: Hopefully, we would get more sponsors so that we wouldnt have to worry when the competition is near.
pcm: We dey hope say we go see plenti pipo wey go support us make we no go dey worry if di time don dey reach.

en: We are also hoping that if the economy improves, we would bring on board more corporate sponsors.
pcm: We dey also hope say if di economy dey beta, we go kari plenti company come make dem sponsor us join.

en: Three years ago, we were hopeful but the economy has been bad so anywhere we go, they say
pcm: For three years ago, we dey get hope but di economy dey too bad so if we go any wia dem go say.

en: well you know what is happening.
pcm: You sabi wetin dey hapun.

en: However, we hope to get corporate sponsorship that will be constant.
pcm: But we still dey hope say we go get company wey go dey dey with us.

en: How much support is Aso table tennis and the game in general enjoying from the FCT Sports Council?
pcm: Na how much help FCT and di sport Kansu dey give table tennis and all di game?

en: I think they can do a little better because the players that went to the recently concluded National Sports Festival in Benin City didnt have enough support from the FCT Sports Council.
pcm: I think say dem fit do beta bicos say all di player dem dey go luk National Festival wey just finish for Benin City no see help kolet like dat from FCT Sports Council.

en: I think we can do better.
pcm: I think say we fit do pass di one wey we don do.

en: There are so many talented players in the FCT waiting to be discovered and nurtured.
pcm: E get plenti player wey get talent for FCT wey dem dey wait to discover dem and train dem.

en: Police arrest 4 over murder of groom-to-be in Kwara
pcm: Police don arrest 4 pipo say dem kill one man wey be wan do wedding for Kwara.

en: Police in Kwara have arrested four people suspected to be involved in the killing of Olokose Ojo, a staff of University of Ilorin Teaching Hospital, six days before his wedding.
pcm: Police for Kwara don arrest four pipo wey dem think say dem kill Olokose Ojo, pesin wey dey work for di University of Ilorin Teaching Hospital, six days before him wedding.

en: Ojo, in his early 30s, worked in the National Health Insurance Scheme unit of the hospital.
pcm: Ojo wey just be 30 years plus, dey work for di National Health Insurance Scheme unit for di hospital.

en: It is believed the attack was orchestrated by the kingpin of the gang and the deceased next-door neighbour named as Kazeem Mohammed who lured him to a bush in Patigi on the guise of helping him purchase three cattle to be used for the event at the rate of N350,000.
pcm: Dem tok say na di pesin nebo wey dey live beside him house kill am and na him be di oga for di pipo wey kill am, say, e take sence kari am enta one bush for Patigi say im wan help am buy three cow wey im go use for di wedding for N350,000.

en: He was however murdered and his body dismembered by the gang after withdrawing over N1.2m from his account with his ATM and demanding N12 million ransom from his wife-to-be, Ilori Oluwakemi.
pcm: Dem kill am kon cut him body afta dem don collect money wey pass N1.2m for him account witi him ATM and dem dey ask for N12 million to free di man from di wife wey e wan marry Ilori Oluwakemi.

en: His body was exhumed by the police and taken to the UITH mortuary for autopsy.
pcm: Di police don comot im body for ground and kari am go for UITH mortuary wia dem go test am.

en: The police gave the names of the other three suspects as Mohammed Chatta, Jimoh Abdulateef and Madi Jeremiah all of whom are now in custody adding that they will be charged to court once judiciary workers call off their strike.
pcm: Di police don tok di name of di three pipo wey remain, Mohammed Chatta, Jimoh Abdulateef and Madi Jeremiah, and dem don dey police custody say dem go kari dem go court if di Judiciary pipo finish dia strike.

en: Speaking on the development, Police PPRO, Ajayi Okasanmi, said the suspects confessed in their statements that the victim was lured into the remote part of Patigi where he was told the cattle he paid for were tethered but was shot on approaching the spot.
pcm: Di police PPRO, Ajayi Okasanmi, wen im bin dey tok about where mata reach, tok say di suspects don confess for dia statement say dem kari am go inside one bush for Patigi say na dia dem tie all di cow wey im don pay money for say dem con shoot am as e wan reach di place.

en: The deceased was said to have been buried in a shallow grave inside the bush and his head and arm severed to be used for alleged money ritual.
pcm: Dem say dem bury di pesin wey dem kill for di grave wey no deep for inside di bush and dem don comot him head and arm for mini ritual.

en: Food, beverage companies fast collapsing — TUC
pcm: Company wey dey do food and beverages don dey fall down quick quick, TUC.

en: The Trade Union Congress (TUC) has decried the negative effects of federal government policies and the COVID-19 pandemic on the food, beverage and tobacco sector, saying the sector has suffered several factory closures and redundancies.
pcm: Di Trade Union Congress (TUC) don tok say how di government policy and Covid-19 take affect di food, beverage and tobacco sector for di country no good, di sector done suffer close close and bad market.

en: TUC President, Quadri Olaleye, who doubles as the outgoing President of the Food Beverage and Tobacco Senior Staff Association (FOBTOB), stated this in Abuja during the 14th National Delegates Conference of the association.
pcm: Di presidio for TUC, Quadri Olaleye, who still be di Presido for di Food, Beverage and Tobacco Senior Staff Association (FOBTOB), na him tok am for Abuja for di 14th National Delegates Conference for di association.

en: It is no news that the COVID-19 pandemic spotlighted the food, beverage and tobacco industry as an engine room for boosting the Gross Domestic Product (GDP).
pcm: Na evri bodi sabi say di COVID-19 put eye for di food, beverage and tobacco industry as na dem be di main tin wey dey make di Gross Domestic Product (GDP) dey rise.

en: The hardworking members of the Association defied all odds to ensure that food items were made available to Nigerians during the lockdown.
pcm: Di pipo for di association wey dey work well well na dem make sure say food dey inside di time of lockdown.

en: It was very unfortunate that despite the vantage position of this industry to our economical sustenance, it has not received 10 percent of the attention given to other sectors of the economy.
pcm: Na di bad tin be say as dis industry dey important for di economy, dem neva dey even give am 10 percent of di attention wey dem dey give oda sector for di economy.

en: The production cost has gone up but nothing has been done in terms of financial support and tax relief by the government to cushion the effects of this.
pcm: Di moni wey dem dey take produce don cost but di government neva do any tin to take help dem witi money of to cut rice for tax.

en: Rather, we are subjected to different bans ranging from accessibility of forex to import of raw materials to forced backward integration.
pcm: Instead na block dem block us witi  make we no fit buy any tin from anoda country and dem kon force us make we go back go dey buy dem for inside di country.

en: We are not opposed to backward integration in any form but its implementation was ill-timed as it has led to massive redundancy in our industry, Olaleye said.
pcm: Olaleye tok say, no be say we no want to dey do togeda for di country, but di time wey dem tok am don make plenti industry no too get mouth again.

en: He explained that companies under FOBTOB had sacked not less than 1,478 workers between 2015 and 2021, which had diminished Nigerias revenue.
pcm: He tok say all di company wey dey under FOBTOB don sack like 1,478 worker from 2015 reach 2021 say e don even make di revenue for Naija come down.

en: He further said, It is our hope that the government would wake up from the snail speed approach to governance since governance is a serious business for serious-minded people.
pcm: He tok am again say na our hope make di government go wake up from how dem dey  waka  like snail come lead well as to lead well be for pipo wey dey serious.

en: The government must urgently start addressing the issue of the growing unemployment rate, insecurity, and the general infrastructural decay in our nation.
pcm: Di government must start to dey face di problem wey dey make pipo dey get work for hand, sekuriti problem  and make dem settle evri tin wey don dey spoil for we country.
